Summary: We stayed here for a Disneyland trip and chose this place because the pictures looked decent, was close to the park, and had free breakfast. When we got there, the place was so run down and the room was not as expected. The floors were dirty, there were stains on our towels, the towels were so hard and felt like sandpaper on our bodies. Their "free Internet" didn't even work and the continental breakfast was a joke. There were only three or four things to choose from. I would not stay here again, nor would I recommend this place to anyone.

I stayed at this hotel checking in on Friday, 2/10, and checked out on Sunday, 2/12, for a quick trip to Disneyland.  I feel like the service here has gone WAY DOWN.   Saturday morning, 2/11/23, I was taking a shower before heading to the parks and while I was trying to move the shower curtain to the end because it kept sliding to the middle and getting the floor wet, the rod finally came crashing down on me and hit me on the head while i was in the shower.  I screamed and struggled not to slip and not to have the rod fall and hit my fit while the shower is still going.  My husband tried to set it back up but there was nothing really holding the shower rod in place at all (no screw or anything).  I finished my shower getting the whole bathroom wet and slippery in the process.

The hotel was very close to Disneyland about a 10-minute walk to and from the park. The overall look of the hotel outside was not the greatest, it looks like they were doing some renovations. The rooms were clean but definitely could use some updating. They did include breakfast with pastries, breakfast sandwiches and cereal. The staff was friendly. We did have an issue that required a repair as the toilet was not fully connected to the floor so it rocked every time we used it.  We called everyday and they promised that they would fix it that same day but they never did. That would be our only complaint.
Manager Response: Dear Kathie-  Thank you for staying at the Travelodge Inn and Suites on Disneyland Drive and for taking the time to review our property. We appreciate all feedback from our guests and use it to improve both our customer service and our facilities.  We are so pleased that you had a good stay with us here. We are sorry that the toilet was not fixed during your stay - we wil talk to the maintenance staff.    We know that you have choices when it comes to lodging in the Disneyland area and we hope that you always choose the Travelodge for your needs.  Sincerely The Management and Staff

Summary Heading: Ok for the right price, could use improvement.
Summary: Positives:  Staff was great. Location is about a 20 minute walk to Disneyland. Free parking. Rooms in East building were nice and spacious. Convenience store next to property.  Fridge and microwave worked well. Working AC.  Negatives: Rooms in West building were very musty/smelly. Internet was horrible, super slow when it works, drops constantly, sometimes for up to an hour, almost unusable. Breakfast is just carbs/sugar/fat, disappointing.  Pool had a lot of dirt on bottom. Low parking on East side. Pillows were flat. Management ignored email. On site laundry required 2 drying cycles meaning a single load cost $12.  Summary: Probably worth staying here for under $130/night. More than that and I would go somewhere else.  A few improvements from management would make a big
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest-  Thank you for staying at the Travelodge Inn and Suites on Disneyland Drive and for taking the time to write a detailed review of our property. We appreciate all feedback from our guests and use it to improve both our customer service and our facilities.  We are so pleased that you had a good stay with us here. We know that you have choices when it comes to lodging in the Disneyland area and we hope that you always choose the Travelodge for your needs.  Sincerely The Management and Staff

Summary: Location next to Disneyland. USB ports all broken. Pillows very stiff. AC loud. Have stayed numerous times and will return. One not so great room doesn’t kill the whole complex. The bagged breakfast is better than nothing.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest -   Thank you for staying at the Travelodge Inn and Suites on Disneyland Drive and for taking the time to review our property. We are so pleased that you are going to stay with us again, but we want it to be great next time.  We know that you have choices when it comes to lodging in the Disneyland area and we hope that you always choose the Travelodge for your needs.  Sincerely, The Management and Staff

Summary Heading: Pay more and stay somewhere else
Summary: We booked two rooms last week. To say this hotel was a disappointment is an understatement! Even though we were fairly close to the Disney parks, we had to drive to park (for a $30 fee). A shuttle would have been nice. The website said there was a free breakfast provided. The first morning we went to the lobby to get our "free breakfast" and were shocked! Their idea of breakfast was a kids juice box. a bag of prepackaged mini-muffins, a bag of cheese crackers and a granola bar! We had to drive to get breakfast because there was nowhere within walking distance. Our grandkids were with us and we noticed their feet were all dirty on the bottom. Their mother washed them and 15 minutes later they were dirty again. The carpets were filthy! There was no tub stopper in one room and the
Room tip: Avoid this hotel like the plague.
Manager Response: Dear John-  Thank you for staying at the Travelodge Inn and Suites on Disneyland Drive and for taking the time to review our property. We appreciate all feedback from our guests and use it to improve both our customer service and our facilities.  We are so sorry you did not have a good stay with us here. We will look into the issues that you mentioned and see what we can do.  Thank you for bringing them to our attention.  We know that you have choices when it comes to lodging in the Disneyland area and we hope that you always choose the Travelodge for your needs.  Sincerely The Management and Staff

Summary Heading: Not as convenient as you would think
Summary: My family and I stayed here last week. From the map, it looks like it’s an easy walk to Disneyland. Not. You better have a car an plan for Disney parking, or us Uber/Lyft. They advertise a shuttle to the park, but when we inquired, we were told it was stopped during COVID and not very reliable when it did run. Plus, in the past, the last run was at 8 PM. Disneyland is open until midnight. The free breakfast is available at 7 am. We left the hotel at 6:30, as any Disney “expert” knows, gets you to the front of the lines when the park opens. So, no free breakfast for us. On our checkout day we went down to pick up our breakfast in a bag. Ugh! Sunny Delight rather than orange juice, Hostess muffins, salty potato & bacon chips, and a chocolate peanut butter bar. Although bedding and
Room tip: You can see the fireworks every night from the rooms facing the freeway, but every night it’s loud.
Manager Response: Dear Kathi-  Thank you for staying at the Travelodge Inn and Suites on Disneyland Drive and for taking the time to review our property. We appreciate all feedback from our guests and use it to improve both our customer service and our facilities.  We are so sorry you did not have a great stay with us here. We will look into the issues that you mentioned and see how we can serve our Disney community better... Thank you for bringing them to our attention.  We know that you have choices when it comes to lodging in the Disneyland area and we hope that you always choose the Travelodge for your needs.  Sincerely The Management and Staff

Summary: Stayed in #245 with 3 queen beds... very basic room, fortunately, the beds were comfortable.  Bathtub is old design and hard to get in an out of.  Elevator button would not call elevator to 2nd floor.  I had to go down the stairs then take elevator to 2nd floor so handicap friend could get down.  No breakfast service instead you walk up to the lobby door, and a woman cracks the door open to pass you a brown bag with 3 assorted inexpensive snacks (cheese its, mini muffins, granola bar) with a kid's sugary beverage box.  Rather disappointed, but it served the purpose since the room was clean. Close enough to Disney, but I would recommend to look elsewhere to stay.

Summary: Despite having a good location, the property is old and outdated. The bedding, towels, walls and couch had visible stains. Pillows were hard.  The breakfast consists of prepackaged goods high in fat and sugar.

Summary: Hotel was nice and spacious for 3 people, but the room was musty and smelled like mildew, we shortly discovered that our blankets on our bed were damp and even the floor was wet. I requested cleaning for when we were away at Disney and no one came!! So I had to call again.  Breakfast was horrible.. they gave us to go bags and it contained bbq potato skins, orange juice and tiny muffins. BBQ CHIPS ARE NOT A BREAKFAST FOOD!! Which led to me having to spend more money on breakfast items because the ones the hotel provided were horrible.  Two things I liked about this hotel is that you can see the fireworks from here and it's about a 5-10 minute walk from the park entrances, which is very convenient.  Another downside was how early the pool closes, it's burning hot outside and they

Summary: This hotel was a nice stay and short walking distance from the Disneyland park. The breakfast was decent. The facilities were clean. You can also see the fireworks from the park. I would recommend for anyone going on a disneyland vacation who doesn't mind walking. You'll save a lot on parking and it's walking distance from the shuttle.

Summary: This is a clean and very nice hotel. The staff is friendly and helpful. I loved the stay and the room even had a picture of Mickey Mouse on the wall to help the Disney Magic come to life! I loved everything about my stay here and it was super close!!

Summary: Our staying was ok, close enough to walk to disney (0.7 miles), friendly staff, cleanliness was ok. reservation listing showed breakfast was included, but what they provided was a bag of paper with a snack with; a 6 oz juice, a granola bar,  4 oz cheez it crackers and 4 mini muffins (it was ok. I always try to be a grateful person, but we were expecting something else) and as our personal point of view it's not a 5 stars hotel nor luxury hotel, so don't expect much. Don't want to sound rude nor picky and try to be objective, so people who's planning to stay in this hotel have a much better idea of what to expect.

Summary Heading: Dirty floor and no one cared - don't stay here there are much better options in the area
Summary: We were due to stay here for 3 nights in June '22. We checked in and went straight to the pool after a long hot drive. After a quick dip we showered the kids and after walking on the carpet their feet were black. I'd been getting them dry etc. and my socks were also black. I went to reception to explain that we wouldn't be staying due to how dirty the room was and the response was "okay" no apology, nothing, just let booking.com know!

Summary: Every morning at 06:30-8:00 the housekeeping staff moved all their carts and Wheeled baskets right in front of our room making a tremendous amount of noise coupled with the radio playin from the laundry room with the door open. One morning it sounded like maintenance in the room upstairs at 06:00 two hours of bangs and crashes total noise!!! Will never stay here again

Summary: We stayed in 3 queen room. The room was spacious and clean. I could walk to bridge to downtown disney in about 15 minutes that includes waiting at 3 traffic lights. Breakfast was a granola bar, bag of mini muffins, potato skins and sunny d. Please improve Breakfast!!!! Arco gas station next door. We will stay again if Breakfast gets improved. Price for room was reasonable and you don't have to pay parking fee. Did not use the pool but it appeared clean. Only short fall of stay was the Breakfast.

Summary: Overall, our stay was nice. Great location to our tournament locations. Short distance to downtown Disney and we got to enjoy the evening fireworks during our stay from the walkway to our room. Breakfast was like a field trip snack bag so that was nice to eat later but wasn’t breakfast.

Summary: Room was nice, spacious. Fridge was a good size and thankful for the microwave.  5 day stay- no room service  Our curtains didn’t close.  Really close to Disneyland, but no shuttle. Check In was fast and check out was even faster.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest -  Thank you for staying at the Travelodge and for taking the time to review our property. We appreciate all feedback from our guests and use it to improve both our customer service and our facilities.  We are so sorry that you did not have a great stay with us here. We will look into the issues that you mentioned and see how we can fix them. Please know that the new standard in the industry is cleaning upon demand.  Simply call the front desk the day before you want service and they will schedule it for when you are gone.  We are so sorry that you were not made aware of this new feature during check-in.    We know that you have choices when it comes to lodging in the Disneyland area and we hope that you always choose the Travelodge for your needs.  Sincerely The Management and Staff

Summary: Only plus is location to the park, which is about a half mile. No room service, no hot breakfast (bagged “breakfast” was a sweet roll, granola bar, bag of chips and juice box), no lobby access (room reserved through a slot) and a homeless guy outside our room for a half hour at about 3 am screening in an unknown language before moving on. As a father and husband, I will never put my family in that position again. Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else.

Summary Heading: Great room and super close to disneyland
Summary: We were very happy with how close to the parking garage we were for Disneyland. The room was very clean and spacious. The only downfall we had was the first night we could hear anyone outside of the room with the windows shut. It was almost like they were in our room. Other than that the rest of the nights were quiet.

Summary Heading: Property Looked Pretty Shady from the Outside
Summary: The property looked pretty shady from the outside. When I checked in, I could not access the lobby. I had to check-in through a dark window with a drawer that came out I could not see the person helping me. tt looked like there was some work being done in certain spots and a stairway was blocked off. The walkways on the second floor were not level, they were slanted at an angle. They did not come by to clean the room and when I left for the day, I went to the window to ask them if I could have the room cleaned, they said it was too late in the day and that the cleaning staff was going home.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest -   Thank you for staying at the Travelodge and for taking the time to write a review of our property. Summary: We had a three-bed family room which was spacious and clean except for a predominance of small flying bugs that were annoying. The room was on the first floor near the front so was unusually loud with lots of traffic noise in addition to the loud conversations from other guests as they walked by. Another drawback was the "free" breakfast which was made up of innutritious snacks rather than any real breakfast foods. I didn't have high expectations for the meal but it didn't even meet those however low they were.  The nearness of Disneyland was a big perk and we were able to watch the fireworks from the room, but in terms of value for location, I'm sure that I could have found better in the same price range or something that would meet the same expectations for a lower price.

Summary: Hair on bathroom floor, my daughters feet on bottom were black after walking on carpet 15 minutes, holes in bedding, trash laying around parking around. No room service during 3 day stay to pick up trash.

We know that you have choices when it comes to lodging in the Disneyland area and we hope that you always stay at the Travelodge whenever you need a place to stay.  Sincerely, The Management and Staff

Summary: Perfect location. Short walk to Disney. Very affordable. Right next to gas station which was highly convenient. I felt safe and secure. Great view of fire works which was a pleasant bonus.  Will stay here again in a heart beat.

Summary: The cleanliness and affordability of the stay was excellent. The front staff was kind and thoughtful. The hotel cleaning staff adhered to keeping with face masks and gloves. The proximity to DL was a +

Summary: Most of the reviews I red about this place was correct. My mean issue is the carpet, it really needs to be replaced. It can be professionally cleaned but I dont think I would waste time with the cleaning, probably just best to replace it. The only positive was how close it was to Disneyland. The room was a decent size and it accommodate the family of five (2 adults and 3 kids). We brought a camping bed to assist with one of the kids sleeping in the room. There is a small window to check in, I guess that is because of covid.  I personally did not mind it. The people running the place was OK. The room did not have a bad smell but definitely an older smell I think its primarily due to the carpet needs to be replace. The hotel was not expensive so I think you get what you pay for.

Summary: The lobby was closed and you literally had to check into a tiny hole in a window which is unnecessary. All hotels are open during Covid with the proper barriers set up. The pillows were extremely old and lumpy and felt like cotton balls were stuffed inside. There was a dirty smear on my sheets, and there was no duvet on the bed just a sheet and a thin blanket. There were no drinking glasses provided which is unsanitary because I assume everyone is putting their mouth to the faucet too. Bathroom door and handle were visibly dirty. Super thin walls, I was woken up multiple times every night from other guests so I had to buy earplugs. The location is somewhat close to Disneyland but still a good 25 minute walk.

Summary: This hotel location to Disneyland was super great. beds are super comfy, and the water pressure was outstanding.  The place is clean and will stay here again.  Can't wait till they have complimentary breakfast again.  Oh yea, the greatest part is you can see the fireworks from Disneyland from the 2nd floor viewing area.

Summary: I was a little skeptical from reviews but my stay was nice. The check in/checkout was a little impersonal through a window due to covid i assume. I needed to call everyday for a housekeeper but they were very nice about it and cleaned thoroughly. It’s a few minute drive to disney. Would not recommend walking due to highways and amount of walking. Trolly was not useable at this time. Though uber might work out well. Overall, is good and roomie if you have kids. Has a microwave, and frig, which I always look for. Water pressure in shower is great! Enjoy your stay!

Summary: Room was clean and well stocked with towels and toiletries. Bummed no breakfast offered, one of the reasons I booked with them, but understand.  Easy to get to and from Disneyland.  Pretty quiet for being by a major intersection.

No where to be found. :(

Had to go to office for more toilet paper.

Summary Heading: Don't stay here if you like to shower
Summary: No Hot Water, even at 4 a.m., no hot water!  No coffee pot in room, no ice bucket in room. Had to get those myself when,after several hours, no one brought them to the room.  The A/C worked well!  There's not enough Handicapped parking spots throughout the parking areas.  Only 2 at the front check-in, 1 in the back and one on one side.  Total of 4.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest -   Thank you for staying at the Travelodge and for taking the time to write a review of our property.  We appreciate all feedback from our guests and use it to improve both our customer service and our facilities.    We are so sorry you did not have a great stay with us here.  We will look into the issues that you mentioned and see how we can fix them immediately.  Thank you for bringing them to our attention.  We know that you have many lodging choices in the Disneyland area and we hope that you always choose the Travelodge for your needs.  Sincerely, The Management and Staff

Summary: The Lobby doors were locked and all communication was through the slot window. I started calling this the "Prison Window" because the guy behind the window treated you like a leper (no services until AFTER you left and very strident warnings and notices at check-in. VERY UNFRIENDLY. And the Phone was non-operational the whole time-it was reported and ignored for 3 days) and I never got a good look at him. That's Customer Service for you....when your customers are an infectious disease to managed. Very Poor. Room itself was serviceable except for the phone.

Summary: Rooms were very clean and relaxing. The location is perfect for visiting Disneyland. The pool was awesome and spa was perfect for stress after long road trip and had there own towels for pool. Rooms were clean and tidy.

Summary: It's great for its value, great location also. The parking feels pretty safe. Although there's no breakfast me and my family had an overall positive experience. Rooms very spacious and have Disney themed art also. Very neat.

Summary: But the rooms were pretty dirty. The carpets were extremely sticky and the was quite a bit of blood on the comforter. The bathroom had hair all over. The bed was broken so it pushed you towards the ground. But the location is good and the price isn't bad if you can get past the dirty part.

Summary: When we got into the room we felt a strong smell of cigarettes, my room is non-smoking, I had to leave the door open for several minutes in the hope of getting better, it didn't work, I went to other friends' rooms and they were having the same problem, I noticed that the hotel corridors stink of cigarettes, I would not decide to complain because wherever I went I felt this unbearable smell.  The sheets in my room were full of cigarette burn holes.  The shower seemed to leak, we couldn't wash our hair properly.  For my family and the family of my friends, all of us with children, it was extremely difficult.  I don't recommend it to anyone and if they ask me about this hotel I'll tell them about the problems we went through.

Summary: I was there to visit Disneyland. When I arrived they did not offer anything they had advertised. No coffee in the room or  in the building and no continental breakfast. If I wanted a hairdryer I would have to ask for one. Will not be returning

Summary: This place was an absolute nightmare.  I arrived to find dirty stained sheets on my bed.  When I called the front desk, they proceeded to bring my up a top sheet to go ahead and change the sheet myself.  No offer of a different room since I had just arrived.  The hotel is run down and the pics they have on their website must be of one little section of the hotel.  The walls are paper thin and people were so loud.    They don’t offer housekeeping during your stay which I understand, but had no extra rolls of toilet paper for a three night stay?  When I called and asked for some to be brought to my room, I was told I could come down to the front desk and pick it up?  Are you kidding???  This place is overpriced and absolutely awful.  Avoid it at all costs.

Summary: It was easy check in and literally right down the street from the Disneyland Parking structure entrance. I recommend staying here if you are doing anything at Disneyland or California adventure. The price is great and we used our AAA for an additional discount.

Summary Heading: You should get what you paid for. But don't. Just becareful of area.
Summary: So first appearance the Travelodge main gate in Anaheim looks shabby from the outside. You're not allowed in the lobby. There is a little night window you check in to. I get it because of covid. But you feel very unwelcome. They shove paper in and out through this tiny hole and we prepaid the woman checking us in was quite shocked as well as not so nice. The parking lot was blocked mostly off everywhere which made it so inconvenient. If you were coming around one corner at the front if another car was entering the same way you would have smacked in to each other and I doubt the hotel would take blame for not having a proper entrance and exit.  So we get to our room and there are so many cars in the lot that are broken down junk. Seriously a rusted out old van, 2 cars right in
Manager Response: Dear Amanda-   Thank you for staying at the Travelodge and for taking the time to review our property.  We appreciate all feedback from our guests and use it to improve both our customer service and our facilities.  We are so sorry you did not have a great stay with us here.  We are recovering from Covid19 lockdown and we appreciate your understanding and patience as we work to get back to the place we were before.  We know that you have choices when it comes to lodging in the Disneyland area and we hope that you always choose the Travelodge when you need a place to stay.  Please come back soon!  Sincerely, The Management

Summary: We stayed here for 1 night and a silly cheap price booked through booking.com so wasn't expecting much but we had tickets for the disney halloween night so literally just needed somewhere to rest for a few hours. Pleasantly surprised when we pulled up at reception, looked alright. Gentleman booked us in very quickly, pointed us direction of disney and explained to us that they have fireworks so not to panic at the noise if we were woken by it. Took our bags to room, was nice. A nice clean basic room. It was clean, tidy and cheap. Disney was a short walk from the hotel, was actually a nice walk after coming from a short stay in San Francisco I felt very at ease and safe, we also walked back in early hours in dark, wasn't fazed at all, would quite happily walk it with younger
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest-   Thank you for staying at the Travelodge and for taking the time to review our property. Summary: Comfy beds, even the sofa bed was ok our teen told us (we ordered extra blankets and pillows for the sofa bed to make to comfier). Front desk staff was great! Pool was a little cold for my liking but the hot tub was nice. It’s a short walk to Disney but after a long day it was a little long, we opted to drive our 2nd day but super easy drive. Close to drive/Uber to anything you need around Anaheim. Clean rooms. We were on the back towards the Super 8 and it was very quiet where our room was. Keep in mind it’s not a 5 star but it was a great place to stay for a Disney vacation - you can’t beat the price for a room with space for 2 teens (2 beds + sofa bed). Breakfast was standard, we opted to go out instead. Would like to have had cream for coffee. Great stay for us.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest -  Thank you for staying at the Travelodge and for taking the time to review our property.  We appreciate all feedback from our guests and use it to improve both our customer service and our facilities.  We are so pleased that you had a great stay with us.  We know that you have choices when it comes to the Disneyland area and we hope that you always choose the Travelodge whenever you need a place to stay.    Please come back soon!  Sincerely, The Management

Summary: We just returned from Disneyland today, spent 7 days at the Travelodge in Anaheim.   Pro’s: - check in was quick - reasonable price - able to accommodate our needs for # of beds per room / location in the hotel  - proximity to Disneyland was excellent. 15 min walk to and from the hotel.   Con’s: - rooms need a thorough cleaning; floors (carpets) leave your feet completely black if not wearing socks or shoes - bathtub felt like it was sinking when stood in (floor concaved) - lack of sound-proofing; you can hear people in the corridors outside the rooms, stomping above or beside you, screaming / yelling at all hours of the day and night. The front desk does nothing when you call to complain that your children can’t sleep at 11:30pm due to the neighbours.  - pool is freezing. Like
Manager Response: Dear Tracy-   Thank you for staying at the Travelodge and for taking the time to review our property.  We appreciate all feedback from our guests and use it to improve both our customer service and our facilities.  We are so sorry you did not have a great stay with us.  We will look at all of the issues that you mentioned and see how we can fix them.  Thank you for bringing them to our attention and just know that we will do our best to improve them.  We know that you have choices when it comes to lodging in the Disneyland area and we hope that you always choose the Travelodge whenever you need a place to stay.  Please come back soon!  Sincerely, The Management

Summary: I was honestly concerned about staying at a 2 star hotel, and find Travelodge can be hit or miss. We usually stay at a 3.5 star further away from Disneyland but they were looking for ridiculous prices even though one app showed hotels were only 44% full during our stay. This is a motel style property but felt our room was secure. Staff was responsive to our needs. Housekeeping had provided several bottles of shampoo but no conditioner. When my daughter called the desk at 11pm, someone quickly brought some to us. The hotel is under renovation so the front desk is in a hotel room off to the side but easy to find. As others suggested, breakfast is 100% carbs and very limited but considering our room rate, we were okay with that. This hotel was a surprise and for the price
Manager Response: Dear David-  Thank you for staying at the Travelodge and for taking the time to review our property. Summary: This was fine for a one night last-minute trip to Disneyland. I wouldn’t recommend the location if you plan on walking to Disneyland, as this is a little bit of a haul after a long day in the parks. If you are driving, parking was super easy - we were able to get a spot right outside of our room! The front desk staff were nice and the room itself was quiet. The renovations are nice - our room provided quite a bit of space. The value for the price is good - two queen size beds and a pullout couch for well under the cost of a Disney hotel. The room wasn’t the tidiest, however. The beds were disheveled, the toilet hadn’t been flushed and the floor of the shower was grimy. I should note that we normally stay at Disney owned properties, so maybe my expectations as far as presentation

Summary: Lesson learned--ask if there's construction before booking.  Jack hammers from 8am until 10pm during our stay, ruined our vacation.  The 1960s construction of the building, and the wood framing, meant that all sounds carry throughout the structure.  From the construction, to people walking up stairs or down the hallways, to toilets flushing next door, to doors closing--all could be heard in our room.  All night long--on a week day.  This property is in dire need of a complete rebuild from top to bottom.  I will never stay here again.  Ever.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest-  Thank you for staying at the Travelodge and for taking the time to review our property. We appreciate all feedback from our guests and use it to improve both our customer service and our facilities.  We are very sorry you did not have a great stay with us. Please know that the construction means that we are trying to make this place better - most people have given high marks to the newly remodeled rooms.  We know you have options when it comes to accommodations in the Disneyland area and we hope you always choose the Travelodge when you need a place to stay.  Please come back soon!  Sincerely The Management

Summary: Stayed here when we went to Disneyland for a couple of days. The hotel staff was really great and friendly. The room was clean, but rather noisy with people around. It was a 5 minute drive to Disneyland or about a 15 minute walk which wasn't bad at all. For the price, this hotel was really great! My wife forgot a post card on the dresser that she was going to mail out and when we called the front desk to see if they found it, the gentleman went right up to the room himself while she was on hold to check and see. He ended up finding it and mailed it out for her, which was very much appreciated. Would definitely stay here again, especially for that kind of customer service.

Summary: Upon our arrival  We were greated by a friendly front desk staff. Everything was ready and easy. Our room very clean and appealing. Couple of nice touches too. While heading south we got a courtesy call to make sure we were still coming..nice touch Also in the room..the headboard has a light. That when activated..makes the ceiling look like the night sky..pretty cool. If you are traveling on a budget, this place makes you feel welcome and comfy. The pool and jacuzzi were clean and presentable. I love this little gem of a hotel. Highly recommend

Summary Heading: 3 Queen beds in one room was perfect!
Summary: We 3 adults spent the day at Disneyland, and loved being able to sleep in our own beds that night. The place is convenient enough to walk to Disneyland's tram station. And was only $6 to Lyft back that night. Room was clean. Very helpful check-in staff. Only negative was there wasn't much in the way of a continental breakfast which was OK because we didn't choose the hotel for that offering.

Summary: This hotel has their heads up their butts! They checked us in to a room that already had guests in it. Poor guy was in bed and we walked in. This could have had a bad outcome if he had a weapon. Because she startled him and freaked us out too. The clue should have been when we checked in a group of guests were at desk complaining about a huge bug that was in their room which they brought in to office in a napkin. Gross!
Manager Response: Dear Linda-   Thank you for staying at the Travelodge and for taking the time to review our property. We know that you have choices when it comes to lodging in the Disneyland area and we hope that you always choose the Travelodge when you need a place to stay.  Please come back soon! Summary: Room was sufficient for family of 6 simple but clean. Outside wasn't as clean as seen in pictures. Pool was small but nice. For the amount of guest and location kitchen/ eating area needs to be upgraded.

Summary: We drove down to Disneyland and hadn’t booked a hotel.  We kept checking the Hotel Tonight app and just couldn’t find any good deals on a Saturday night.  We happened to drive by this place on our way to the parking garage, so I opened the Wyndham app and found this hotel for a significantly cheap price.  We went ahead and booked it.  We showed up about 11pm.  The man in the lobby wasn’t too friendly, but figured it was a late hour, maybe he was tired or about to be off work... not sure.  We went to the room and was so nervous about it.  The outside just made me nervous.  The room was clean and smelled clean!  Really no complaints whatsoever about the room.  A surprising find.  They also don’t charge for parking, which is a plus.  We only were staying the one night.  My husband

Summary: Typically I don't stay in Travelodge's. Haven't had the best of luck. But after reading the reviews, decided to give this one a try. The outside is a little rough, but don't let that fool you. Our room was impeccably clean and updated. It was quiet and felt safe. The beds weren't terribly comfortable, but they were far from the worst I've slept in. The AC worked well, and we had plenty of towels. All in all in was a great stay for a great price!

Summary: Traveled to Southern Ca for a last minute trip with the family. The stay at the Travelodge was awesome. Its in a great location, with awesome low price, & the breakfast was a plus...Awesome to get a full belly before hitting the theme park with high prices for EVERYTHING!

Summary: We stayed for 2 nights on a quick trip to Disneyland at the end of September. Room and bathroom were really clean and smelled clean as soon as we walked in. Check in was quick and easy. The guy working the front desk was super friendly too. Wifi worked fairly well, we weren't in the room much but when we were at night we were able to use it easily. Fridge worked well for keeping drinks cold. The little in room AC unit worked really well too. Rooms seem to be pretty well insulated as we didn't hear anything from our upstairs or neighbors beside us. There is a gas station right next door which was really convenient for us too when we needed drinks/snacks at the room. Will definitely stay here again for our next trip to Disneyland. Parking and wifi were both free so that was

Summary: We’d booked a triple queen room and the room allocated smelled damp & musty - they even accepted this was the case and moved us to a smaller room. Reception staff said if we accepted this room a discount if 50% would be applied as it was a downgrade & for the inconvenience! A week after we left, the manager Eric, blagged it that was a 15% discount! Had specifically asked the reception to confirm the amount so was very dissatisfied at the outcome ! We were 2 adults & 3 teenagers, crammed in! Still awaiting a response from Travelodge! Bathroom was really tiny. Toilet was blocked and they brought us a plunger to clear it ourselves, despite us not having used it at this point! Yuk!! Breakfast isn’t worth it....2 cereal choices, toast, waffle machine & some syrupy bananas! Coffee

I liked my first night stay so well that I extended my stay for a second night.

Summary: This place is a bargin if you are wanting to go to Disneyland and don't mind a walk. Check in was smooth and the chap on the front desk was really helpful about the area and how to get to Disney, maps provided etc.  Downtown Disney is about a 15-20 min walk which was really simple and when you saw some of the traffic into the parking lots the walk was worth it!   The rooms were large, good AC, large beds rooms had fridges and microwaves. The pool area is nice. Laundry was also available. There is a 24hr garage next door which is well stocked and reasonably priced. Lots of parking and free for guests.   My only issue here was the WIFI- totally shocking.   If I was visiting Disney again would certainly consider staying here again.
Manager Response: Dear Louise -   Thank you for staying at the Travelodge and for taking the time to review our property. Summary: This hotel is a great location for Disneyland - just a 15-20 minute walk to Downtown Disney and Disneyland Park  and California Adventure are at the other end of Downtown Disney.  The hotel is located just off Interstate 5 and check in was easy and efficient. Our first floor room was well equipped with two large double beds, complimentary toiletries, fridge and air conditioning. There was also a good sized pool and jacuzzi, which had great views of Disney's fireworks.  Brrakfast was served in rooms close to reception but tables were limited, so we ate in the reception area. There was a good choice at breakfast of cereal, juice, bagels, waffles, bread and fruit.  Check out was quick and efficient and our family of four enjoyed our stay.

Summary: Hotel was substandard for the money. Room was only passably clean. When we attempted to get ready for our day out the hot water for shower and sink was nonexistent. Called manager and was told water heater was broken and was being repaired. Two plus hours later water was still COLD! Finally got out near noon and had to fight crowds of those who got to the park when it opened. Manager was full of excuses but no solutions. ZERO STARS

Summary Heading: Great location, rooms are decent for the price you pay. We stay here every time we are visiting Disneyland.
Summary: Great location, rooms are decent for the price you pay. We stay here every time we are visiting Disneyland and California Adventures. It’s very close to everything and we never had any issues with our rooms. Only thing is the breakfast area can get really busy and crazy during that time.

For the price, I would try to find somewhere else to stay if you can. Otherwise, make due as most of your excitement will be at Disneyland any ways.

Summary: Reception: Friendly and helpful staff  Room / facilities: Room number 219 is on the second floor ( on the Super8 side of the hotel) and is very quiet, clean and recently updated. There is 2 x queen bed, flat screen TV, self control Air-conditioner, in tub shower, fridge, iron and board, alarm clock, and coffee table with 2 x single arm chairs.   A guest computer is located in the lobby with printing facilities, to print flight boarding passes.  Car parking is plentiful and free.  The television is large with just as huge number of channels with only a handful in english, and all others are either in Spanish, Indonesian or the TV displays “no signal”.   Self control air conditioning with a window that opens fully.  The hotel also has a pool   Laundry:  Self service coin laundry

We do understand that they serve mostly large families so the need to keep the cost down is understandable. We ended up eating elsewhere. We liked the adjoining rooms. Many hotels will try to put you close together so this was a huge plus. We would stay there again.

Summary: This is a dreadful location, you must have a car if you stay here, it is to far to walk with children, be aware THERE IS NO TRANSPORTATION WHAT SO EVER TO DISNEY any where near this hotel, even the tram is not accessible to guests with no car as the tram collects you from the car park on the same side as the motel, but as there is no foot path on that side you have walk on the other side, then you can not cross the road until you actually get to downtown Disney. The beds are awful, not able to sleep at all in them. Internet is virtually non existent. I would say only stay here if there are no other hotels in Anaheim. It’s not even as if it’s cheap on price it isn’t, it’s expensive for what you actually get. Even the telly doesn’t play properly due to internet issues. I would

Summary: Good value for the price, but you get what you pay for.  The coffee was so disappointing—I mean, at least have decent coffee.  The channels were all staticky, and there was no guide, so it was difficult to watch TV as a means of relaxation.  The pool was clean, the room was clean, limited storage (we only had two drawers), “mini” fridge was actually a good size, and the view of the fireworks was really great (just no music).  Walking distance to Downtown Disney or trams to Disneyland, so we got our exercise.  Easy to get to, Lots of parking. Breakfast wasn’t worth it for us, but it was included.  At least the kids liked the waffles, bananas, and clementines.

I would completely understand if they were polite and needed to get the room cleaned but they were not booked and the maid hasn’t even been near our room yet.  We watched 45 minutes after leaving our room and no maid.  We come here all the time for modeling and will never be back. FYI we checked out by 12.

When he did show up they cancelled our room keys. When we got back to the hotel late that night we had to wake him up to get our new room keys. The front desk did not seem bothered or concerned that they cancelled our keys when someone else checked in. The room itself was fine as we were only sleeping there. The carpet could definitely do with a clean, but the room itself was nice with a fridge and microwave. You

Summary Heading: Great stay with good decent breakfast.
Summary: My boyfriend and I had a great stay at this hotel. We liked the idea of sleeping in a bit late and walking to Disneyland being that it is so close; instead of having to get up early and drive there (we're locals that live in Los Angeles). We had a good breakfast at that hotel provided and being that we could leave our car park there we also saved on the $25.00 parking. I am very happy with the stay.

The Travelodge was clean and has all amenities necessary for a trip to Disney. We spent only a max of two hours when we weren’t sleeping in our room and didn’t feel like money was wasted on an expensive hotel. There is a pool and a hot tub and the hotel is a 6-7$ Uber to Disneyland. You can walk up the street and take the shuttle but the road was under construction when we were there and was more a pain then it was worth. Close to restaurants and the exits to the highway to get to Universal. Hotel says “breakfast included” but you can barely call it a breakfast. It consisted of juice and waffles with bananas in strawberry syrup. We did not eat at the hotel once. Room was spacious.

We walked to Downtown Disney a few times via Walnut Rd and it was a 20/25 min or so walk.  One day we went down Disneyland Dr and walked to parking structure at rode tram. That was closer to a 15 min walk. Overall, a great location!

The Outlet Mall at Orange ia also only a 10 minute drive away with lots of designer shops with 30-60% off rrps.

We went down for breakfast at 8.15am on the first day and 7am on the second, both times there was more than enough food available and it was quite tasty. The walk to the park was a little longer than I was expecting (mainly because you have to wait for so long to cross the roads!) but it was well lit and there were others using the path too. Summary: We stayed here in October 2018 , I don’t recommend this hotel at all. The room smelled old and like the filters haven’t been changed or there weren’t any? Beds hard as a rock, floors dirty needed shampooing or just replaced. Parking lot has super tiny  spots .  Worst part, as were walking back from Disneyland with our 8yr old there was a guy sitting in the parking lot with a needle in his arm cause he just shot up ! Eww and gross ! Then we were walking up the outside stairs to our room and had to walk past a person standing there smoking weed and drinking alcohol ! Not a family friendly place.  The walking distance to the Disneyland tram is 0.68th of a mile....it’s a solid 15-20 min walk with older folks . It’s quicker to Uber it to the front of the park!

While the hotel was very close to Disneyland, the area where it is located does still make for a rather long walk. It is possible to walk to the park but the distance makes it a bit hard. You do have to walk through the downtown disney area once you get to the resort to actually reach the park gate. This was still a great value for the price that we paid though!

Summary: Had a great 2 night stay here, family of 5 travelling from the UK!! The room was recently renovated , clean & spacious , with a microwave , coffee maker, fridge , iron & ironing board, everything you need for a simple comfy stay. Breakfast was good , fruit , cereal , toast , bagels , waffles , coffee , tea , fruit juice ! No complaints!! There is an amazing  viewing bridge for the Disney fireworks , did not use the pool but looked good to relax. It’s a good 20 mins walk to Disney but it’s a lovely walk , I really recommend walking !! This hotel was perfect location for Disney & met our standards for what we needed. Thank you would 100% return.

Summary: So, I thought the walk into Disneyland would be shorter than it was, but the location for the price was pretty good. Room was quiet despite being on the parking lot and the daily service was simply fine. I did have to go down every few days and ask for additional towels, because they’d only leave us 4 when the room was booked for 6.   The breakfast room was okay, if not a touch cramped with everyone trying to make their waffles. Definitely felt a bit crowded in there.  All that said, great staff, good management, easy location and clean, well-maintained room. No real complaints at all. Would probably return again if no other hotels/motels on the Tomorrowland side of the park had great deals.

Also the TV in our room only had 3 channels which they advertise having way more including premium channels, we complained twice and the front desk told us both days they would send someone to fix it and both days nobody came. The coffee and breakfast selection was also pretty bad. They also advertise they are .06 miles from Disneyland but that does not mean how long it takes to walk there. It was 30 minutes to walk at fast pace to the front gates, very misleading. The .06 must be to the land line of the park. I wouldnt recommend.

Summary: I was really pleased with this hotel. The room was clean and extremely quiet and that was with being right next to the pool. The air conditioner kept the room the perfect temperature all through the night. The blankets and pillows were great as they were not bulky and made for perfect sleeping conditions. I do wish there was a cover for the window near the bathroom. It prevented the room from being completely dark and that was a little annoying.  The breakfast was good. We like being able to make waffles since they are nice and filling to keep your energy levels up during the morning. They had cereal, toast, bagels and some fruit. Something for everyone really. The milk was nice and cold and they had some apple and orange juice as well. We had no problem getting a table.  We

Summary Heading: Promised Us Early Check-In, Made Us Wait Several Hours
Summary: We were in the area to work a round-the-clock event.  We just needed a place to nap and freshen up in between shifts, as we only had 8 hours to sleep, eat and shower.  We needed to check-in early in the morning.  I called the corporate number on the website and asked about early check-in.  They said it early check-in would be no problem, said they would call the inn, and advised us to do the same.  To cover our bases, I called the inn directly and asked the manager if we could be provided early check-in.  He said no problem.  We get there and they won't check us in because it's too early.  I mentioned the call to the corporate number and said I spoke the manager as well.  They refused and claimed that they can't do that.  They said they would get a room ready for us.  We tried
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest   Thank you for staying at the Travelodge and for taking the time to review our property.  We love receiving feedback from our guests and use it to improve both our customer service and our facilities.  We are so sorry that you did not have a great stay here with us.  We are sorry that you were told that it was okay to check in early - it was not possible because the entire hotel was sold out.  We are not able to promise early check-in since we are sold-out often, so it was a mistake that you were told that it was possible.  But thank you for letting us know.  We know that you have choices when it comes to lodging and we hope that you always stay at the Travelodge whenever you are in the area.  Please come back again soon!  Sincerely, The Management

Summary: We arrived from the UK for a 2 night stay to go to Disneyland. Our room was on the ground floor and near some rooms that were being refurbished but this didn’t have any impact on our stay.  Our room was not refurbished and was quite dark, however it was very large, clean and comfortable enough for what we were after. Breakfast was okay, waffle mix and bagels with cream cheese were all we were looking for.  Good location for the park and Downtown Disney we walked to and from the park that way and spent our first evening in Downtown Disney which is nice but not cheap.  We didn’t see any restaurants or shops on the blocks around this hotel however when we were leaving our shuttle took us around the south and east of the park and there were lots of hotels with some Denny’s and

Summary: If you are visiting Disneyland in Anaheim and not staying at DL Resort, this is a place you could consider because of the proximity. One could walk to DL parks (30 min) or walk to Mickey and Friends Parking lot (15 min) and take a tram to DL or Pay ~$6 for a Uber ride directly to the park. Thats the advantage. We got a nice clean "roomy" room with interesting starlight ceiling. The staffs are nice and cordial. The only complaint I have is regarding the quality of their breakfast. I travel quite a lot and didn't encountered such a low quality food. Even the breads and coffee are not of good quality (I was NOT expecting great though). They don't serve eggs. Apples are rotten.  So, if I stay with them again, I will carry my own breakfast as the rooms have microwave (as I want to

Summary: The price and location were good, the room was clean, but if you are looking for a disability-impaired room, unless you're confined to a wheelchair this is not the room you want to stay in. I did ask for it, since I do have mobility and balance issues and I wanted the security of a bar in the shower, and possibly a taller toilet, The entire bathroom was the shower, and contained the slippery floor tiles and one unstable easily moved bathmat. The mirror over the sink was so far in that you REALLY had to lean in and get on your tiptoes to see it, and if you're in a wheelchair, well, best of luck even seeing it at all! The front desk gave very bad directions as far as walking distance to the trams to get into Disneyland, and while the setup is temporarily changed in the parking

If you're desperate for a place to stay in the area because everything else is booked up, this is a good choice. Otherwise, keep looking.

Summary Heading: Not bad. Great location for Disney parking. Comfortable beds.
Summary: Great location for Disneyland parking. Beds were comfy. Relatively inexpensive. All of which met my primary requirements.  Otherwise, it's a dated property, and IMO kind of a dump, especially compared to the newer hotels popping up in the area. But for the price, I was ok with that. The rooms and property were clean. I would stay here again. Pros: Clean, price, comfortable beds, working refrigerator, AC worked well, proximity to Mickey and Friends parking which was a big plus late at night when returning from the park. WiFi was ok. Cons: The property is old, kind of dumpy, a bit of musty odor but not too bad. The continental breakfast wasn't very appealing. The TV was all antenna and was IMO worthless.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel but not the best for walking to Disneyland

We booked for the price and free breakfast (basic but filling with carbs) and hoped it wouldn't be too far to walk to the Disneyland parking structure shuttle...but with a stroller and having to fold it up it turned out to be quite a walk to the parks through downtown disney. We coped for 4 days but it was a long walk after walking the parks all day...location would be our only downside to this hotel as everything else was great!

Summary Heading: Overall a good family stay near Disneyland
Summary: Hotel was a great location near Disneyland at a great price. Keep in mind you get what you pay for. Staff was great and rooms met my expectations, but should have been a little cleaner upon arrival. Breakfast was okay, but choices were limited. Internet was great and other hotel amenities like the pool and hot tub made the stay better for the family . Overall a good value but would not choose this particular hotel if visiting again.

Also, there were other visitors that were yelling & screaming up & down the hall all hours of the night! There kids were also playing with an electric car up & down the hall at all hours. We'll never stay here again! Even the girl working at the front desk was rude. At checkout she just grabbed the keys & turned her back to me! Wow!

It’s definetly not a Hilton but I would for sure stay again for the price, convenience and friendliness!

We noticed a man was running around these red train looking things with a large metal poll. I watched him for a few minutes and realized this man was attacking what seemed to be cats. He looked like he was in his late 30's. I am not sure if this man works there, but if he does then shame on the hotel for allowing such abuse to happen. I have no plans on returning after witnessing such disturbing actions.

We know that you have choices when it comes to lodging and we hope that you always stay at the Travelodge whenever you are in the area.  Sincerely, The Management

Summary Heading: I chose this hotel because of its reviews and price. Very...
Summary: I chose this hotel because of its reviews and price. Very happy with the newly remodeled room, very clean. Great price but I think it may have been due to the remodel. Most of hotel still under construction. Debris and construction materials are everywhere. Parking was tough due to this. We were woken up at 8am with workers banging on walls starting construction. Pretty early for a sleeping in plan. Breakfast area is crammed and basic. Not restocked very well.

Summary Heading: Not bad, renovations noise was loud

Summary: My friend and I recently stayed at the Travelodge for two nights for our Disneyland visit. The walk isn’t as far as it seems, probably took us 10-15 minutes to reach Downtown Disney, and then onto the parks. It is a very easy and a well-lit walk.  The room was better than we expected. A decent sized room with a great bathroom space. We made use of the small fridge and the television, and loved the two big beds. Something we loved was the adapters being built into the lamps on the bedside table. So convenient!  Breakfast was really handy. There were two different cereals, two juices and a bunch of pastries. We enjoyed toast the first time, and on the second morning we made use of the waffle machines.   A con for us was the noise level from outside. My friend was woken by some

Summary Heading: My husband six year old daughter and myself stayed three...
Summary: My husband six year old daughter and myself stayed three nights. The next day we returned to our room and it had not been cleaned when I called the front desk they we very argumentative telling me housekeeping went home at at 5pm it was only 4pm we were rudely rush out of our room by housekeeper who came to clean with no cleaning supplies when I asked for towels for the swimming pool she said she didn't have any! I tried to show her that one of the sinks were stopped up she told me to use the other one when we return to the room I called front desk to tell the about the sink they said someone would fix it the next day and never did even tho they had a while crew doing remodeling rooms no one would come drain the nasty water out the sink. The next day stained sheets were put on

Our family (2 adults, boys 8/9) really enjoyed our stay at the Travelodge Anaheim. Clean and comfortable room, close walk to Disney tram, free parking and free continental breakfast (cereal/fruit/toast). Daily maid service made for a nice touch when returning to the room and there is a larger than normal mini fridge in the room. There is a pool that looks nice though we did not have a chance to use as we spent most of our day at the park.  This is a fantastic location and I would recommend for anyone looking for easy Disney access and all the basics.

Summary Heading: Clean Rooms for a 2 star hotel
Summary: Enjoyed my stay here last Friday for a last minute Disneyland trip. Check in was quick. The walk to the trams to Disneyland was way further than they suggested! The Mickey and Friends parking garage is a block away on the map but the sidewalks are blocked for pedestrians to walk into it so we had to walk all around the other side of the garage. Took us 20-30 minutes to walk there so we took a Lyft back to the hotel at the end of the day.  I usually stay at 4 star hotel but since it was so last minute we just needed an affordable place with a bed and bathroom and this place was a great choice. The rooms were spotless and the bathrooms were renovated hence everything was new. Beds were comfortable and loved that they had two actual queen sized beds and not two full sized like most

Summary: Me and my girlfriend went to Disneyland the last weekend of September and our stay was great. We stayed at the Paradise Pier a month before and these rooms & beds were better and a lot more comfortable. The room was spacious and clean, & quiet. We’ll be staying here again soon. The walk to Downtown Disney was a bit of a work out but worth it. The walk I won’t recommend for small kids but if you have a stroller then you’ll be good. The only negative is the surrounding area there wasn’t really anything around except an AMPM on the corner. If you hadn’t eaten already and wanted food you would either have to drive somewhere or have it delivered.

Our first couple of nights were pretty miserable because it was too hot to sleep, after they fixed it, the rest of the stay was good.

Summary: This motel was horrible and disgusting. Had to switch out our first room due to significant amounts of mold in bath tub and under sink. The conditions were only slightly better as no mold was noticeable however the sink was unusable due to the stench coming from the faucet. We are AP holders and we have stayed at about every hotel within walking distance to Disneyland.  Despite the problems it is very close to the entrance and the Front Desk staff was friendly and was cooperative on the next nights stay (no penalty for 2nd night cancellation). We knew this would happen based on the price of the hotel and staying there before (fool me once). So, we brought our own sheets and pillows so that we knew any hairs were ours :).... The free breakfast is a joke, and barely counts as a continental breakfast. There was no protein available and everything was tiny. Summary Heading: The twenty minute walk to Disney Land was nice. They...
Summary: The twenty minute walk to Disney Land was nice. They advertise a 15 minute walk which is probably accurate with small children and strollers. There was some confusion with our reservation and they put the blame all on us. It was annoying, but they did solve the problem. The wifi was slow and only worked for one device. The breakfast was ok, but had no protein other than room temp milk. It was the quietest hotel room I have ever been in and I slept great. Beds were comfy and room was adequete and clean. The mini fridge had no freezer.

Summary: The room was good right by the pool. However, other guests did not adhere to the time that the pool closed and were there after ours making noise. I had mixed feelings about some feral cats who live under the train cars that are on the property. I like cats and it bothered me some to see that they were in need of food and water. I was told by a desk person that the city had been contacted about them but did not offer any help.I would like the owner or manager to please try tp contact a feral cat organization who could come to the property and hopefully trap them. They are in a concrete jungle with nowhere to go but the parking lot and it was

I can't confirm this but, I think the bed had bed bugs as the next morning we had sores around our ankles. My wife complained about a sore on her head. The elevator was filthy and smelled of garbage. The breakfast area is small and does not offer anything other than waffles, pastries and dry cereal. This was our 45th wedding anniversary. We have stayed here due to the easy access to Disneyland. Overall it was a great stay and worth the price.

Summary: Customer service is horrible. Girls at front desk are rude and have no customer service skills whatsoever. Very unfriendly. They do not provide any type of shuttle service to Disneyland so if you decide to walk, be prepared for a good 25-30 minute walk. Their so called breakfast sucks! Toast, pastries, cereal and waffles that's it! No type of meat at all! Wireless internet?? Please! Yeah right! Their internet service is horrible! We had no wifi connection at all! Basically you get what you pay for! You wanna try and save a few dollars like myself sometimes it's just not worth it, I learned that the hard way after staying here this past week. Never again will we return to this Travelodge! Stay away!!

Only on problem though is the bathroom sink is dripping and we didnt see it until our last night at the hotel but not a big deal. Overall is this place is a nice spot if you want to spend couple of days near Disneyland, it is literally 5 mins away and the parking is awesome right in front of our room and its free with breakfast.  We are definitely coming back again.

It took 25 minutes to walk to Downtown Disney and then another 10 minutes to get to the park gates.  That's one way.  This is a long walk for small kids. Summary: We always stay here for dland trips as it is close to the parks, cheap in price, and is decent enough for an enjoyable stay. There is an alternative which is a long walk. If you have a car then the parking structure is literally 30 seconds away which is more worth it! Other than that breakfast is good, people are always helpful, rooms are remodeled and clean! Walls are thin so sometimes noise can be an issue if people are crazy loud. Overall great place to stay if you are on a budget.

Breakfast consisted of bland cereal with milk, toast, bagels without cream cheese, waffles, juice, and coffee. We ended up not even eating breakfast because we arrived at the park pretty early. Summary: This was my first time staying at this property as I usually stay at the Travelodge on Harbor Blvd.  The room was very clean and I was impressed with state of the carpet and bed. There was adequate parking available too. There was one power strip available for recharging electronic devices though the power strip was not easily accessible.  There was one shocker: I was awoken in the middle of the night by the very loud noise of streaming urination into the toilet OF THE ROOM NEXT DOOR. That is how thin the walls are. Now I'm not talking about hearing toilet flushes because that's to be expected but when you can hear the neighbors actually using the toilet...well, the walls are too thin.

Summary Heading: They will literally steal your cash deposit
Summary: Have stayed here multiple times and have had the same issues all but when one honest employee was the one at the desk. It seems that when ever she is not working the other employees acusse you of smoking in the hotel room when you have not just to keep your deposit. They have cameras outside so I make sure to smoke in front of the cameras so they see I am not smoking in the room and they will still accuse you of smoking. They have took in total over $300 in deposits from me for something I didn't even do I wouldn't recommend this hotel to my worst enemy.

The room was clean and had everything we needed, including a hairdryer and a plug for my son to have a bath. Good Wi-Fi. The breakfast was an easy way to start the day, esp with kids  (altho don't turn up with 5 mins to spare and expect everything to be there for you, give it at least 15mims before closing). We had a great 3 day stay - highly recommended.

Summary: The location of the hotel is convenient. Pretty centrally located as Disneyland is right across the street. The Disneyland tram is a couple blocks from the hotel and the hotel is right off the freeway. The rooms are comfy, our room had glow in the dark stars on the ceiling that you could see when the lights were off. Pretty neat touch I thought. The maid service could step it up a notch as far as cleaning thoroughly, but eh, you're not really there for the rooms. Be aware though, when walking to the tram, we were approached by a little girl looking for "children's donations." Other than that, we'd stay here again.

Summary: We are budget travelers, especially when staying near Disneyland.  I booked a two-queen room and requested an upper floor - upon arriving, we carried all of our things up to the room, only to find the door open and two maintenance workers fixing "a leak" - they informed us to go back down to the office.  So we carried all of our stuff back downstairs and were assigned a room downstairs right by the pool (noisy).  But this was still fine, until I realized that these aren't queen beds, they are double beds.  This is the second hotel to say "queen" and gave us doubles.  I would have booked a cheaper place; I paid $10 more for this room because I thought we'd have queens instead of the doubles offered elsewhere.  Finally, there was mold and someone else's hair in the bathroom, and

We study all feedback and use it to improve both our service and our facilities.  We are so happy to see that you had an excellent stay.  We love guests such as yourself and hope that you always stay with us whenever you are in the area.    Please come visit us soon!  Sincerely, The Management

Summary: Rooms were not that clean and need to be updated, seems like parts of the place are under construction or at least getting new paint. Room was way over priced for what was offered. The plug in the bathroom area did not work, so no hair dryer since it was connected to the wall. Checkin staff was very nice by helping us with a luggage cart. Breakfast is a choice of 2 cold cereals, juice and bagels. It is not really walking distance to the park. We booked late so this is unfortunately what happens.
Manager Response: Dear Kelly-   Thank you for staying at the Travelodge  and for taking the time to rate our property.  We study all feedback and use it to improve both our service and our facilities.  We are so sorry that you did not have a great stay at the Travelodge.  We will look into all of the issues that you listed and make sure that they are fixed.  We hope that you give us a second chance and come stay with us again.  We assure you that you will have an exceptional stay this time.  Sincerely, The Management

Summary: The hotel was close to Disney! Less than a 10 min walk to the Disney trams. I was not able to check in early, however i was able to leave my car in the hotel parking lot. A big plus...saved $ on parking all 3 days! I was also able to leave my car in their lot on day I checked out THANKS! Never made it to breakfast, wish breakfast was until at least 10:30. I booked a room with 2 queen beds but I got 2 doubles, it worked, but the extra space would have been better. If you looking for a hotel to just sleep, close to Disney and can overlook how old the hotel and the carpet is dirty, this can work for you.
Manager Response: Dear Monica-   We would like to thank you for staying at the Travelodge and for taking the time to write a review of our property.  We study all feedback from our guests and use them to improve both our service and our facilities.  We are so pleased to see that you had an exceptional stay with us here at the Travelodge.  We love guests such as yourself and hope that you always stay with us here!!!    Please come visit us soon!  Sincerely, The Management

Summary: Lovely very clean rooms staff were very friendly I most definitely will return for future stay they offer complementary breakfast that was quite good. Also the rooms are quite so sleeping was good and beds quite comfortable
Manager Response: Dear Debra-   We would like to thank you for staying at the Travelodge and for taking the time to write a review of our property.  We study all feedback from our guests and use them to improve both our service and our facilities.  We are so pleased to see that you had an exceptional stay with us here at the Travelodge.  We love guests such as yourself and hope that you always stay with us here!!!    Please come visit us soon!  Sincerely, The Management

Summary: If stayed here 4 times.I think it's super convenient, close to Disneyland parking and I like the service  I do have to say i dont loke that the 2 bed rooms are in the 3rd floor. I have little kids!
Manager Response: Dear Elena-   We would like to thank you for staying at the Travelodge and for taking the time to write a review of our property.  We study all feedback from our guests and use them to improve both our service and our facilities.  We are so pleased to see that you had an exceptional stay with us here at the Travelodge.  We love guests such as yourself and hope that you always stay with us here!!!    Please come visit us soon!  Sincerely, The Management

Summary: Best value for our dollar, the rooms were perfect size, quite walls, and parking was impecible: we loved the glow ceilings and the Disney pics. We loved how we could see the fireworks from Disneyland outside room and how close in walking distance it was. When my a/c stopped working they fixed it right away. Excellent care and friendliness from front desk. We will be back!!!
Manager Response: Dear Jessica-   Thank you for staying at the Travelodge and for taking the time to write a review of our property.  We study all feedback by our guests and use them to improve both our service and our facilities.  We are so pleased to see that you had an exceptional visit at the Travelodge with us.  We love having guests such as yourself and hope that you will  come back and stay with us whenever you are in the area.  Sincerely, The Management

Summary Heading: Kids enjoyed the hotel pool more than they enjoyed Disneyland!
Summary: Perfect for families.  Clean and kid-friendly.  Calm retreat after a crowded day at the park.  Easy walk to the tram and convenient store nearby for snacks.
Manager Response: Dear Theresa-   Thank you for staying at the Travelodge and for taking the time to write a review of our property.  We study all feedback by our guests and use them to improve both our service and our facilities.  We are so pleased to see that you had an exceptional visit at the Travelodge with us.  We love having guests such as yourself and hope that you will  come back and stay with us whenever you are in the area.  Sincerely, The Management

Summary: The check in was very good. Staff was friendly and willing to help. We were a little disappointed with the room due to the smell and it was outdated. The bathroom needed repair and a good cleaning. The tile around the tub needed to have the caulking removed and professionally redone. The breakfast could have more of a variety from day to day.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest -   Thank you for staying at the Travelodge and for taking the time to write a review.  We read all comments made and use them to improve both our service and our facilities.  We are happy that you were pleased with our staff and the way that you were treated at the front desk.  We are sorry that you were not so pleased with your room.  We will talk to our maintenance crew and make sure that they are aware of your comments.  We hope that you will come stay with us whenever you are in the area.    Please come back soon!  Sincerely, The Management

Summary Heading: In the bathroom the ceiling light fixture was exposed with wires dangling and a hole was cut around it.  room stunk bad.
Summary: Rooms are ok nothing special, and this hotel is not close to Disneyland park it's a walk especially if you hAve little ones.  Our room smelled weird old.  Our ceiling lit up at night with stars and a black light not sure why maybe cool for someone on drugs.  Not sure.  Just strange.
Manager Response: Dear Sherry-   Thank you for staying at the Travelodge and for taking the time to review our property.  We read all comments written by our guests and use them to improve both our service and our facilities.    We are glad to hear that your visit was good.  We will talk to the cleaning staff about the smell that was in your room and about the light fixtures.  Normally we use a certain cleaner, one that smells great and it is possible that they did not use it for your room.   We hope that you will come stay with us again and experience an exceptional stay with us this time.  Come back and visit us soon!  Sincerely, The Management

Summary: The walk to Disneyland is advertised as 9 minutes to the trams.  We found it was 15 minutes to the trams and a good 30 minutes to the park gates.  There are comparable alternatives closer. The Internet was unusable. We had a clogged sink upon arrival. No soap was left the first two days, when we asked for some they piled loads on the counter that day. The breakfast was poorly organized and ends up being a cluster when everyone is trying to get food before leaving. Overall not worth repeating.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest -   Thank you for staying at the Travelodge and for taking the time to write a review of our property.  We read all comments written and use them to improve both our service and our facilities.  We are so sorry that you did not have an exceptional stay with us at the Travelodge.  We will talk to our housekeeping staff regarding the issues that you experienced in your room.  Thank you for bringing  these issues to light for us.  We hope that you will come stay with us again and let us show you what an excellent experience staying at the Travelodge can be  Sincerely, The Management

Summary: Excellent guest service from the moment I stepped in to the lobby. I was able to check in an hour or so before check in time. Staff was courteous. Our room was very clean. Swimming pool was clean. Parking was wonderful. Had absolutely no issues and would recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest -   Thank you for staying at the Travelodge and for taking the time to write a review of our property.  We read all comments written and use them to improve both our service and our facilities.  We are so pleased to see that you had an exceptional experience with us.  We love it when guests such as yourself  are with us and hope that you always stay with us whenever you are in the area.  Sincerely, The Management

Summary: We have stayed at this location for many years for our visits to Disneyland. The hotel is within a SHORT walking distance from the trams, and is clean, and the staff was great. We had a room with a broken black-light (for viewing the "stars" they painted on the ceiling) but that was the only thing wrong. Beds were comfortable (the pillows left a little to be desired), and the room was clean. Breakfast consisted of waffles, cereal, juice, toast, bagels, and danishes. Will definitely stay again!
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest -   Thank you for staying at the Travelodge and for taking the time to review our property.  We read all of the comments that are written by our guests and use them to improve our service and our facilities.  We are so pleased that you had an excellent stay with us at the Travelodge.  We are  pleased that everything seemed to be satisfactory during your visit!  We hope that you will come stay with us again whenever you are in the area.  Sincerely, The Management

Summary Heading: We got 2 double queen bedrooms that were a joined. One of the rooms smelled like stale urine and literally made me sick.
Summary: We got 2 double queen bedrooms that were a joined. One of the rooms smelled like stale urine and literally made me sick.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest -   Thank you for staying at the Travelodge and for taking the time to review our property.  We read all of the comments that are written by our guests and use them to improve our service and our facilities.  We are so sorry that you had a problem with the smell in the room.  We have reviewed this issue with our housekeeping staff and assure you that it won't happen again.    We hope that you will come stay with us again and let us show you what an excellent stay at the Travelodge can be like.  Sincerely, The Management
