Summary: No hot water first day,second day were going to eat breakfast and a guy seen a fly floating around in the container that holds the milk. The pillows hard as a rock
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest -   Thank you for staying at the Travelodge and for taking the time to review our property.  We read all of the comments that are written by our guests and use them to improve our service and our facilities.  We are so sorry that you did not have a exceptional visit with us during your stay at the Travelodge.  We apologize for the minor snafus that troubled you during your trip and will talk to all of the departments that are responsible for these problems.    We hope that you will come stay with us again whenever you are in the area.  Sincerely, The Management

Summary: Getting rundown over the last few years, but a decent place to stay. Nice close walk to Disney, about 5 minutes. Staff has always been very good, the free breakfast is decent as well.
Manager Response: Dear Steve -   Thank you for staying at the Travelodge and for taking the time to write a review about our property.  We read all of the comments written about our guests and use them to improve both our service and our facilities.  We are so pleased to see that you had an excellent stay with us here at the Travelodge.  We are glad to see that you are still staying with us after all of these years.  As you know, you can always let us know if you need anything at the front desk.    Please come stay with us again soon!  Sincerely, The Management

Summary Heading: Good prices, close to disneyland, a nice viewing vantage for fireworks
Summary: Super close to disneyland. I walked to the park and also to the tram at mickey and friends parking. I was able to watch the fireworks just by opening my door. Staff was kind and room was clean.
Manager Response: Dear Elizabeth -   Thank you for staying at the Travelodge and for taking the time to write a review about our property.  We read all of the comments written about our guests and use them to improve both our service and our facilities.  We are so pleased to see that you had an excellent stay with us here at the Travelodge.  We are glad to see that everything was to your liking and hope that you always come to us whenever you are in the area.  Please come stay with us again soon!  Sincerely, The Management

Summary: We stayed at travelodge because of how close it was to Disneyland. We were very happy with how easy it was to book and change our reservation. We weren't staying very long but it was perfect for our one night.
Manager Response: Dear Theresa -   Thank you for staying at the Travelodge and for taking the time to write a review about our property.  We read all of the comments written about our guests and use them to improve both our service and our facilities.  We are so pleased to see that you had an excellent stay with us here at the Travelodge.  We are glad to see that everything was to your liking and hope that you always come to us whenever you are in the area.  Please come stay with us again soon!  Sincerely, The Management

Summary Heading: My sink was clogged and I had 3 mini pillows on the bed...
Summary: My sink was clogged and I had 3 mini pillows on the bed.  How do I sleep with a mini square pillow, it awkward.

The hotel is very close to the Disney parking structure. We had very loud neighbors that made the evening stressful and unrestful. There was a coffee maker, but I did not see cups until we were packing up. Why would they be on the desk and not near the coffee maker? Breakfast was a disappointment. Waffle makers, bagels, and cereal. I'll try somewhere else next time.

Within walking distance to Disneyland and right off the freeway, made it easy to find for someone not familiar with the area.  The continental breakfast was average and could be added to, but at least it was available.  Overall, had a nice stay and would recommend for convenience and reasonable rates.

Overall, our experience here was good. It is very close to Disneyland, which is great! The room wasn't pristine. There were some stains on the blankets, there weren't covers on the lights on the bathroom, and if you turned on the sink full blast it would quickly flood the counter. I would recommend bringing your own pillows as a I had a difficult time falling asleep on the lumpy ones provided. But we felt safe and didn't see any bugs or anything. Beds were okay. We had a room with a black light and painted stars on the ceiling which was fun. There was a safe, large mini fridge, flat screen TV, iron, and hair dryer. I wish they had a "Do not disturb" Sign you could put on your door as we got maids coming in a few times in the morning. Never heard neighbors. I would stay here

Summary Heading: Unmemorable stay connected to a great trip to Disneyland
Summary: Vending machine wouldn't work.  Told to go to the gas station next door where the prices would be cheaper anyway; prices were higher. Terrible internet service!!!

The room had multiple issues with mosquitos and gnats. The bed was made with dirty blankets, 1 bed sheets were so thin they were starting to rip. Bathroom lights were out and mold appeared to be growing in multiple areas. Shared pictures with staff and all that was offered was 10% off. Still have pictures of room 244. Management took a day to respond to concerns then offered to move my family night before we left. That was poor service overall

Two of our rooms had a knat problem inside. My room also had a bug crawling up the wall that I filmed on my phone. I called the front desk and told them about the problem. We were switched to a different room the next day. The rooms are not updated and old looking. Our room also had red stuff on carpet. Pillows are hard.

Summary Heading: Great Breakfast, No Internet, Okay stay
Summary: I am always skeptical when getting a hotel room for this cheap but I was for the most part pretty happy with everything. The things I did not like was the bathroom did not smell like it was freshly clean, it had a sort of stagnant water smell that filled the room unless we closed the bathroom door. Another thing would be that when we tried accessing the internet(Netflix for our kids) it said maximum sign ins met and we could not log on for the entire two days we were there. Besides that everything was clean and neat and the beds could have been softer but not a bad nights rest. The breakfast I would say was the best part of the entire hotel. There was so many options and it tasted great plus everything was fresh.

Summary Heading: Clean and close to park! Great value
Summary: Staff is friendly and the property is clean. Close the theme park. Pillows need some help... too hard but overall very satisfied. We try to stay here each time we go to Disneyland.

I have stayed at this Travelodge many times.  It is not walkable to Disneyland and does not have shuttle service, but is directly next to the disneyland resort parking lot.  The rooms are comfortable (though this time the fan in the bathroom was so loud we could not use it - sounded like an airplane in our bathroom).  The continental breakfast has gone downhill over the years, so we skip it, but overall the price is very reasonable, the front desk  people have improved in their customer service and the rooms are comfortable.  Yes, I will stay there again!  (And now that I've figured out Uber, we don't even have to deal with disneyland's parking!)

Just behind Disneyland. 15 minute walk each day. Happy with the property. The hair dryer was broken but quickly replaced and broke two days later. Clean except our room was missed 2 days in a row to have the beds made up but there were plenty of towels. Breakfast was adequate and next door to a gas station for extras if needed. Would definitely stay here again.

My daughter and I had a wonderful stay and great experience here. The room was large and maybe too big for us but would be great for a larger family. We were able to walk to the tram to get to Disney from the hotel. We felt safe walking back to our room late at night also. The front desk has a card with directions on how to get to the Disney tram, to transport you to Disney property. The staff worked hard at making us feel welcomed. My daughters new shoes had made a sore on her foot, she asked if they had any band aids and they handed her a handful!!!  We did not try the breakfast there, we ate mostly at Disneyland or our own food we brought from out of state. The room was older but very clean. I came to spend my time at Disneyland not to hang all day at the hotel anyways. The

We weren't able to check in until after 6 pm. The room is severely outdated. We left room in early morning and returned in late afternoon. The room was never cleaned. The breakfast was very sparse; (Only waffles, toast, cold cereal, Coffee, juice). Where's the protein?  None. The pool was not in use. We paid premium dollars to stay due to limited occupancy in the area. Avoid if possible. I do not recommend.

Stayed here in for 4 nights in March.  Perfect location.  Quick and easy walk to Disneyland.    We were in room 229 and watched the fireworks from the Magic Kingdom from our window.  The window opens so you can lean out and watch them clearly.  Breakfast is good.  Cereals, bagels, toast, and freshly made waffles.  Would not hesitate to stay here again.

I don't know where to begin, this hotel is awful. 8-thread count sheets, lumpy pillows and thin blankets, a 1/2in gap between the door and the floor, strange lumps under the carpet, strange outlets that work but won't a plug, and a virtually useless shower/tub.   The shower/tub was a weird tiled in monstrosity rather than a porcelain tub, the drain was absolutely disgusting to the point where I wouldn't bath my kids in it. I am not a especially tall person, at 6 ft tall the shower head didn't even come to my shoulder.  I complained to my wife and she told me I get what I pay for. Then I told her what I paid and she was as horrified as was. Do not stay here.
The location was convenient and the price was fair.  However it was very dirty, dark, terrible bedding and staff was hard to understand.  I would not stay here again with my family.

very reasonable for this busy, high demand area.  hotel parking barely adequate  old fashioned property, one elevator, lots of walking. easy access in and out. near highway, Disney parking. We're there for one night a year on business and always come back as its the most convenient and most reasonably priced for the area.

Check in was great! Manager was really helpful. Room needs new front door. Check out was really discouraging. I was asking for a check out and got a weird attitude. Was giing to inform about door and maybe stay the next weekend but felt rushed out. So I just left.
Safe, clean, and convenient. The breakfast area is too small and the breakfast itself is mediocre, but this is not why you stay at this hotel. Great access to Disney is why you're here.

Close to Disneyland, about a 3/4 mile walk.  Decent breakfast, but not much of a selection.  They had bagels, cereal, bread, and waffles.  A little bit of fruit.  It would be nice to have something bigger, like bacon and eggs.    Rooms were also okay.  Could use some upgrades though.  Our bathroom had a very bad smell, no other rooms available, so we kept the door to the bathroom closed the whole time.

The housekeepers were so helpful and did a great job on the room. The pillows were worthless and the bed was just ok. The breakfast choices were limited but far better than most. The lady who maintains the breakfast room was so nice and did a wonderful job keeping up with all of us guests. Overall great experience.
The Hotel was nice;however, the parking stalls are pretty compact, otherwise a good place to stay while in Anaheim.

This is a plain motel, but it has everything you need. A fridge ,Microwave. The beds are ok comfortable. The breakfast was not too much to select from. If you like waffles everyday. Good price if your not in the room much. Ask about the pool if its important to you. It was important to us BUT it was closed.

Summary Heading: Not awful, but could be a lot better
Summary: Room was laid out strange, so it was impossible to watch TV from bed. Water marks and damage on walls. Bathroom had dirt in the corners. The phone did not work. The towels had stains on them. The continental breakfast was atrocious. The bed sheets and tub were clean however and the fridge was big, but those were my only positives. Over all this is a decent place to stay for a cheap price if you're willing to lower your standards a bit to save some money. But it definitely wasn't the most comfortable place to stay.
Stayed here one night and have done so many times in the past. Had an issue with check-in as they couldn't find my reservation but the matter was resolved.

Facility recently renovated. Stayed here a few times prior. Customer service has been better on previous trips. Pricing is a little higher than before . Location is good . Will possibly stay here again.

Very nice employees who were so helpful. Gave us two rooms next to each other and upgraded the rooms for us. Clean and comfortable. Allowed us to park at the hotel early and leave the car while at the park the next day. Rooms are very quiet.

My room had to be the worse one I have ever stayed in. The ceiling seamed to low.. I am 5'5". I had to go through 1 door then through my door.. in other words they took a room and constructed it 2. The smell of air freshener was overwhelming upon entering.. Scary..  The coffee maker was right next to the toilet.. I am not kidding.  Who would want to make coffee where yours and other people let go of their feces.  The only plus was that it was within walking distance of Disneyland.

the breakfast need a better section of items to pick from. the only section you have was cold cereal or waffles. other places my wife and I have stayed at had choices hot cereal, eggs, beacon,turkey sausage,  biscuits.

We stayed here in January, 2017.  We were running a bit late so we called the hotel to let them know we would be arriving late.  The gentleman tried to change our reservation from 2 smoking rooms to 1 smoking, 1 non-smoking.  The rooms had been paid in full MONTHS in advance.  He tried to tell me it was because I booked with Hotels.com, I explained that absolutely did not matter.  After a lengthy conversation of trying to explain to this man that he cannot just change my reservations to suit them, he finally got me the rooms I had already paid for.   I was EXTREMELY disappointed with the room I was in!  It was FILTHY!  I was afraid to walk on the carpet, even with socks on as there was a huge white stain on the floor next to the bed.  The room smelled of rotten eggs and sewer
This property has become my go-to place for my Disneyland trips.  A quiick walk to the parking tram, friendly staff and great room rates.  Highly recommended.

Summary Heading: This is my second time staying at travelodge. Breakfast is...
Summary: This is my second time staying at travelodge. Breakfast is very sparse and not restocked very well, Waffle makers need updated. The room I stayed in could use some maintenance. My daughter checked in late, unfortunately it had been raining all week. There was a leak in the bathroom ceiling that covered the floor and the had to move rooms at 1 a.m.  The main gentleman in the office was very pleasant on both visits. The other staff could act less inconvenienced. Overall I would stay again due to the price in February was very fair considering it is walking distance from Disney.

Hotel was close to Disneyland, walkable distance away, which is good. The hotel itself was dirty. My kids feet got super black and dirty from the floor of the room and it was just gross feeling overall.

Summary Heading: Decent for a one nght stay
Summary: The room was clean and a standard in size and cleanliness, the free breakfast was alright, with waffle makers, cereal, bagels, toast, and tea and coffee.  I wish there was bacon or sausage, or even fruit danishes to choose from.

The room had multiple stains on the carpet. The lights in the bathroom were against code (my husband is an electrician). It was convenient because it was close to Disneyland, however; it was not worth $100 a night. You can find better quality hotels for $60-70 in the same area as well. The pillows were so uncomfortable, we slept without them. The cotton in the pillow was so bundled up it felt like soft rocks. I know everyone says this, but I have never written a negative review. I don't usually write them, this was just that bad.

All employees who reacted with were very kind! We also had a situation where the soap dish fell off in the shower and when we returned to our room there was a note asking us to contact the front desk; they very kindly offered to swap our rooms! It was also really neat to stay in a room with "stars" on the ceiling that glowed once the lights turned off. I'll definitely stay here again!

Summary Heading: Great staff, average rooms, amazing location.
Summary: We spent a few days here, and the proximity to Disneyland was perfect. The free breakfast allowed us to save some money by not eating out, and the waffles weren't bad either. The rooms were average but clean. We needed to extend our stay by a day, and the hotel staff couldn't have been more helpful. Great people.
Great quick stop. Nice  to walk over to Disneyland. Great price for a one night quick stay the Jacuzzi in the pool were extremely clean
I stayed during Namm. Really close to disney and to convention center. Staff helpfull with giving directions and tips for moving around. Comfortable room and good quality sleep. Recomended

Cabinet bottom cracked, outdated design, dreary rooms, toilet not flushing, bathtub and sink not draining water fast enough, bedsheets and blanket stained and worn-out looking, elevator squeaky, vending machines out of order.

The family and I enjoyed our stay here. The location was perfect to visit Disneyland. It was a short walk to the tram. The second day, we skipped the tram and walked straight to Downtown Disney. The room was very clean. The only complaint was the pillows. They were uncomfortable. We would definitely stay here again.

The hotel is in walking distance of the Disneyland parking garage, and about a half mile of the Disneyland hotel. I ran the Star Wars races, I wanted to place stay where I wouldn't have to worry about transportation. This was perfect for that purpose. It is not the Four Seasons, so I didn't expect that kind of experience. For the money spent, I got excellent service. If I come back I will stay here. It is next to the major street leading into Disneyland. I did here motorcycles going down the street after midnight on Saturday  ,but I'm a light sleeper.

My husband and I took a quick getaway trip to Disneyland for one night and stayed at the Travelodge. The room was clean and the location is awesome for what you are paying for. They let us park our car before we checked in so that we could head over to the park. It is about a 5 minute walk to the parking garage trams that will take you to the front entrance of Disneyland/California Adventure. Hint: If you're facing the street standing at the front doors of the hotel, the parking garage is to your right at the intersection light of Ball Road where the Best Western Courtesy Inn is located.   When you're paying very little to just rest your head somewhere after a long day in the park, this will do the trick without having to walk a long ways to get back to your hotel or break the
The location was very convenient for Disneyland, the rooms were very comfortable and the service was helpful.
We basically had no hot water. I asked the desk person to look into it, but it was not taken care of. The breakfast has very few items and just not presented well.

I am a student and I had a weekend to be able to go to Disneyland.  This hotel is either within walking distance or a short drive of Disneyland.  My room was clean, comfortable and quiet.  For a weekend it was a great place to stay.  The only downside was the breakfast.  There were no protein sources available for breakfast, only bread/cereal items and bananas.  It would have been nice to have yogurt or hard boiled eggs or something like that to add.

We recently got a king bed room, which was not comfortable at all. We woke up with bug bites all over. The bathroom was dirty, and the ceiling above the bathtub was coming off as if it was water damage with dark staining around the peeled paint. We talked with the employees regarding possible bed bugs, and they ensured us there were none, and told us we did not get our bites from them. Would not recommend this hotel to anyone!! Nor will I ever stay at this hotel again!

Summary Heading: Travelodge Anaheim--good value for your money
Summary: This Travelodge is about 7 minutes walk to the tram station to go to and from Disneyland. Rooms are clean and staff are helpful. Inspite of being close to the freeway, the rooms are well insulated. Parking space are sufficient. Breakfast needs some eggs and sausages. They only serve waffles, bread, cereals and sweet pastries. All carbs, no protein or fruits.

my family and i stayed here for the first time and it was great there were four big adults in this room and we fit all so comfortably. we would definitely stay here again and for you Disney lovers like us the parking structure is very close..
Hotel is very close to Disneyland. "Suite" was one big room with 3 queen beds in row. I imagined 2 beds in 1 room and sofa bed in living room (for family of 4 in one room and family of 2 in other).

I had an issue with the front desk that would not take cash with a credit card as a deposit so I had to leave a cash deposit in addition to payment, and the front desk could not explain why they would not take a credit card as a deposit.
Close to Disney. Decent free breakfast. Great hours. Clean rooms. Perfect place to go in a budget!

Stayed in a recently renovated very nice and clean room.I highly recommend this Travelodge and will book this hotel the next time I visit Disneyland.The front desk staff is very friendly and helpful,The breakfast is good and the walk to Disneyland takes only a few minutes.The hotel parking is free.Overall very satisfied experience.WiFi not so good.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel with Easy Access to Disneyland
Summary: This Travelodge is located across from the Micky and Friends parking structure. This made every morning a breeze getting into the park. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. Hotel employews were friendly and helpful. The price is right for something so close to the park!
Non-smoking room smelled like smoke. Bathroom was dusty & mold in corners of bathroom.  We were early for the breakfast, not much variety and nothing really hot was on the menu.
We like to stay at the Super 8 next door but tried the Travelodge for a change - will continue to stay here. The breakfast includes make-your-own waffles!

We had a great time at this hotel during our stay. The service was very good and our room was excellent. It was a great help that there is now a very short path to walk to the parking garage for Disneyland. It took us less than 10 minutes to get to the trams.
The room unfortunately smelled strongly of bleach. There was also a loud humming noise coming from the central heating unit. The Breakfast was satisfactory.
The staff was not very helpful, as well as the bathroom did not have an outlet to plug in the blow dryer that is attached to the wall.

Convenience to the Disney parking and shuttle was awesome! Centrally located near other restaurants. Accommodating a family of 5 was perfect and parking near by room. Hotel close to freeway on and off ramp so it made it convenient to visit other places in L.A.

Summary Heading: The check in was easy as well as the wLk to Disneyland...
Summary: The check in was easy as well as the wLk to Disneyland.  The room was marginal. Strange black light with bulb exposed and popcorn  ceiling with glow in the dark stars. Sheets were stained...ugh

Most people might not look at this location as ideal for Disneyland, but for us it is! We walk to the park from here and love it! We save on parking expense, enjoy breakfast, and a decent room. Some rooms have been upgraded and some are still waiting for some attention; however, considering we spend all of our time in the park, we do not mind the less than 4 star accommodations. Thanks for great stay!

The location was very good for a walk to Disneyland. Checked into first room, and found multiple dead roaches upside down on the floor. Went to ask for a room change at the front desk, and they were very accommodating. Upgraded us a room, and the new room was much nicer. However, my key cards stopped working for a day, so I had to go down to the front desk and get them recoded. Again, staff was very helpful. Overall, would not recommend. But you get what you pay for.

Room was standard, TV too small and channels were hard to navigate as they were set to hd antenna channels. Route they gave to walk to park was not the fastest. Stayed for one night, bed was comfortable. Would stay again for a short stay

Summary Heading: Great hotel for a great price!
Summary: I think this is a very reasonable hotel.  It accommodated all of our needs, except the slow internet in the rooms, and was a convenient location for Disneyland.  I would definitely stay there again!
We were very satisfied room was clean and breakfast items were good and staff was very helpful. We were very pleased at how close it was to Disney Land. Would stay there again

Summary Heading: Easy access to Disney's tram. Nice comfortable rooms. Hot...
Summary: Easy access to Disney's tram. Nice comfortable rooms. Hot tub was nice for aches and pains of walking all day at Disney. Pool was very cold so unusable during our stay. Breakfast did not offer any type of protein opitions so not real good for diabetic travelers. Even adding peanut butter as a topping choice for toast would help.

Summary Heading: Great for big  families on a budget
Summary: Simple, but comfortable hotel near disneyland. We drove to the park within minutes and were able to get a starbucks on the way :)  We had 8 family members and the adjoining rooms made it easy to keep an eye on the kids and yet have efficient bathrooms and beds. The only thing I would do to approve our stay would be to add an indoor pool and a hot breakfast like many of the comfort inns offer.

Let me start off with this hotel wasn't bad, I wouldn't stay here again unless I had to. But with that being said, the closeness to Disneyland was perfect! You can see the fireworks clearly from the hotel and that was unexpected and a great surprise. The room was ok. Nothing great about it. The Ac worked great. Bathroom was small and one light was out. The breakfast was the same everyday 2 cereals and waffles. If you weren't there early things would run out. You make the waffles your self which wasn't bad, but there was only 2 waffle makers and on 1 day only 1. The staff was impatient for us to arrive. When we needed things and we called to get it they seemed like they didn't know where to find it such as towels or toliet paper and it took atleast 15 minutes before they brought
Everybody was so friendly and helpful. The internet wasn't working but we played cards instead. It was overall a great trip

The particular room I was in had the AC unit at the side add-on room so the main sleeping area couldn't really get the cool air. Also, if the lights in the room were of a warmer color it would make the room a lot more welcoming. Also the Internet is horrible, if you have to rely on  the wifi at the hotel for something, look elsewhere. There is a limit to how many devices you could use (1-2?) and the speed was around 1.5Mbps up/down. Just terrible.
Room was old and run down looking and sink area and bathroom had bugs! We made due for the 2 nights but we will not book this Travelodge again.
Quiet facility, great spot for fireworks, short walk to parking garage (where you can catch the tram to downtown Disney, but terrible breakfast. Bring your own!

Very close to disneyland:) could of walked but after 10 hours in the park I'll pass. ROOM was huge bed was more of a full then a Queen. MATTRESS was New but hard. NO sockets to plug in your straighter. The one on the light had been repaired sloppy but only had one socket for blow dryer. Curtains were thin, but when I checked out she said there were ones in the wall/retractable. ALSO one strange thing there was a black light...LOL to make the stars on the ceiling glow:) pretty cool but strange. OH yeah and the roof felt low. I liked the idea of a enclosed front door. Pool and hot tub was nice

I was disappointed with the quality of service and the quality of the rooms. Upon arrival I felt rushed to check in even though I was the only one in the building at midnight. They talked so fast I couldn't understand. When driving to our room there were a couple of men drinking and smoking outstide of there room and then grabbed something out of there trunk to meet another man for a exchange. I felt unsafe so I drove and parked further away which was a longer distance to our room. Once getting to our room the blankets had stains, one of the lights didn't work, and the tv froze and stopped working. My children couldn't wait to leave and felt uneasy at that location.

You get for what you pay for and this was one of the "cheaper" options close to the theme parks (but it still quite expensive). The rooms were average, we had quite a few flies around the bathroom sink. Location wise, it was good. About a 15, 20 minute walk to the parks and a good view of the fireworks every night. Also the walls are super thin - be warned if you have children as my partner was unfortunate enough to not bring earplugs and be kept awake by the very loud couple close by...

Summary Heading: Great hotel for the price. Large rooms; You can walk to Disney!
Summary: None of the hotels near Disneyland are cheap, but we found this Travelodge Anaheim Inn & Suits to be budget friendly and accommodating. My family and I live in Austin, TX but travel to Disneyland often. The past two years we have stayed at this hotel. The rooms are very large and clean.  It is an older hotel but the housekeeping staff does a good job of keeping the rooms and bed linens clean.  The wall art in the rooms are disney themed and the park is within walking distance.  Its a bit further than other hotels, but my 5 year old had no problem making the walk.  There is a gas station right next door which is convenient for late night snacks and water bottle runs.  The staff were friendly, which is why we have retuned to this property year after year.  They also have a pool

We enjoyed our stay very much. Less than half a mile from Disneyland. Waffles for breakfast, fireworks right above our head...it was great.  On the could be better side - the room didn't have enough plugs... there were 5 of us staying in the room, in this electronic day and age having enough plugs that reach the beds and areas of the room is important.

My family n I had a grear experience at your hotel. The breakfast in my opinion should be more of a buffet style. Continental b fast is extremely light and a family of 4 can't get full of this style of food.

I really enjoy this hotel. The rooms are spacious, it's in close proximity to dining locations and Disneyland, and the breakfast offered is very good (who doesn't love waffles!?). I have stayed here several times over the last few years and the staff have always been gracious and helpful. The rooms are a little older but I find they are clean and in good condition and are perfect for either a quick overnight stay or longer trips. Only downside is Internet can be a little hard to connect to.

Summary Heading: Just what you would expect for the price
Summary: We stayed at this hotel last week for an impromptu Disneyland trip. Although a bit run down in some aspects, hotel was clean, the beds were comfortable, especially after a long day at the park and the price was awesome. We only got to see fireworks one evening, but watched them right from the parking lot at the hotel and felt we had a great view. The hotel seems far away from the parks, but the desk manager gave us the shortcut to the parking garage where you catch the tram that drops you off basically right in front of the security checkpoint for the parks. It took us about 15 minutes to get to the park, only walking at most 1/4 of a mile. Most of that time was spent on the tram. We did walk once as well, and it wasn't terrible, 20-25 minutes. The breakfast room was spacious

Good place to stay if your are going to disneyland, the rooms are cheap and close to the park. Plus the gas station next door is in a very convenient spot if you are staying in the hotel and need any last minute amenities.
Our stay was ok the hotel was clean. The only thing was not enough of toilet paper and when i called to get some they asked me to go get it.

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland without the prices
Summary: This is our second time staying here. We enjoy the quietness of the hotel itself and the pool is hardly used. It's within about 2 miles of Disneyland and there's no congestion, it's a quiet walk before the mayhem of Disneyland.
Overall this location wasn't bad, except that the room wasn't very well lit.  And I still can't figure out why there was a blacklight mounted to the wall by the nightstand.

When we arrived at this hotel, we had problems with our reservation. There was a nice lady up front that was trying to resolve our issue. But then her shift had ended so the new worker was taking over. WOW this guy was a complete JERK!!! I have never been treated so bad in my entire life!! He was yelling at me and not even listening to a word that I had to say. Our group had finally had enough of his rude attitude that we told him that we would figure out the situation on our own and come talk the manager the next day.   Then to top this place off the first night we were in our room my daughter had a bite on her forehead. We then found a weird looking bug on the table next to the bed. We killed the bug took it to the front desk. They said the bug was a cockroach and they would

We very much enjoyed our stay. Good value for money. Pleasant helpful staff at front desk. Clean accommodation and comfortable beds for two adults and three children. A tad dated.Very short walk to Disneyland tram, very convenient. Free breakfast and parking. Stayed here last year, just stayed here in October 2016 and we'll be back again.

We love the location and the ability to walk to Disneyland easily. Having a quiet, clean room to return to at the end of a long day is awesome. Also, the option of parking at the hotel, and saving almost $20/day is awesome! The room was recently updated and smelled very clean. For a non-smoking room, we were surprised at the number of cigarette butts on the ground around the room, on the stairs, and in the grass. Seems like a simple thing to correct.  We appreciate having a breakfast in the morning; however, we were disappointed at the "all-grain" options. There were not any protein choices or fresh fruit. Even if fresh, hot protein options are cost-prohibitive, it seems like some hard boiled eggs or lunch meat might be reasonable.

Summary Heading: One day stay for a fun getaway
Summary: Entire family slept comfortably and overall room was very clean and had more space than expected. Only downfalls were the bathroom sink when turned on splashed all over having us to wipe up all the time and Internet was spotty but maybe it was because our room was in the back. We will definitely stay again though!

Summary Heading: Friendly staff; adequate breakfast; bedding is a bit...
Summary: Friendly staff; adequate breakfast; bedding is a bit uncomfortable. We hated the pillows. The bed was stiff and it was hard to get to sleep. But room was clean.

I enjoyed staying here. It's a neat and clean motel, and about a 20 minute walk to downtown Disney. Bathrooms are newly remodeled and it looks like the hotel is well maintained. I walked into the room an noticed a blacklight and was somewhat nervous as to why. When we sit the lights off the ceiling is painted with glow in the dark paint of the galaxy which I thought was very cool. Check in was easy, friendly and quick. We go to Disneyland in March of every year and I will definitely be staying here again in the spring.

Cockroaches showed up in the bathroom to greet us.  Small insects crawling all over the bathroom floor.  Too scared to look at what might have been on the floor in the room.  We were on the first floor and ceiling was very thin.  Neighbors above stomped around until 1 in the morning and back at it again at 5 am.  Not sure what was going on or if they were even using the room to sleep, but it was miserable.  Wouldn't stay near this hotel again.  Cancelled our last night there.  Paid way more for a hotel elsewhere and had problems finding something, but it was worth it to just get out.

The only reason I am giving them 1 star is because it is a good location. It is 5 minutes from Disneyland and is convenient. Room smelled. We checked in and since day 1 (we stayed 3 nights) it smelled dirty and humid. We went to the CVS to buy an air fresher because the smell was strong. I could not change hotels as Everything near was already booked. Carpet had stains, sofa bed had stains, fueniture is chipped and the hotel is old. Besides that, the free "breakfast" is cereal, waffles, toast and juice. This would have been great but the second day my juice had a fly and I told the lady and she just told me to change my glass. I did not drink anymore juice. Please consider other options before staying here.
Great spacious room.  It was a great experience from check in to check out.  We were there for two events, an Angels game and a concert.  Ubered to both events with ease.

I was a little apprehensive to book at this motel considering some of the reviews.  However, I was pleasantly surprised! Here's the rundown:  Check-in: Front desk clerks was friendly and nice.  Gave me all the info and it was a quick checkin.  Getting to the room: this was the only problem.  We had a room with two queens and a fold out couch.  My 13 year old son sleeps on the fold out. We arrived late (around 11pm) so we wanted to go straight to sleep.  He opened the bed and the sheet was wet.  And smelled like pee! I called the front desk and the man said he would move us to another room right away.  He brought new card keys and i showed him the sheets.  He was really surprised,  I'm really not sure how this happened other than it was probably a lazy housekeeper.  Any way, we

We stayed 3 nights here at the hotel.  Were extremely happy with all the accomodations. Staff is friendly, polite and very helpful. Free breakfast is great. 5 minutes walk to Disneyland, or you can catch the tram right across the street. Prices are extremely reasonable.
This room was ok. It needed an update. One of the beds sunk in the middle, so when sleeping we sunk in the center. It was clean, but seemed like it needed an update.

Summary Heading: I have stayed here many times.   I run the Disneyland half...
Summary: I have stayed here many times.   I run the Disneyland half marathons and this hotel works great for convience. I just walk up the road to the starting line.  Short walk to Disneyland!   I use this hotel to sleep only.  It's clean and staff is friendly.

Summary Heading: Great value depending on the room.
Summary: We arrived around 9 pm.... found the room very clean and spacious.   We were given directions and were able to hike to the tram station fairly easily to orient ourselves to the Downtown Disney area.   You do have to climb stairs and then an escalator to get to the queue and had I been more mobile would have been a great hotel to stay at.  Room was clean, lots of largish towels, very comfortable bed.  The main problem for us with the room is that the window in the bathroom had a outside light that lit it up, which was reflected in a mirror and the mirror redirected the light to the head of the bed and our heads...which had an adverse impact on our sleep.  We mentioned it when checking out.  Other than that, amazing value for being so close to the tram.

The staff was friendly. The shower was cold every time we used it. The coffee maker did not have the correct coffee packets for the type of hotel coffee maker that it was and so hot coffee spilled all over the counter. We were not able to use it at all. There is a refrigerator and microwave which is great for traveling with families. It is a relatively short walk to the Disneyland tram as well. The rooms are VERY large so again great for families who need some space.

Summary Heading: just any hotel looking to make money
Summary: When we got into the room there was hair in the bath tub, i was so very tired with the late check in just snapped a picture just wanted to sleep since so late, also pool did look very dirty and breakfast was so small the room in general for that many people and 2nd day only apples that didnt look that good, otherwise bed room space very clean and comfie

Summary Heading: Good lace to Stay close to Disney
Summary: Its a good place to stay with family. All sort of facilities has been provided. Staff was very helping and proactive.  Couple of CONS : - Room floor carper is dirty, seems they don't do the shampoo as when you walk on carpet without shoe your feet will turn to black. Its not good in terms of hygiene. -For breakfast they have same for everyday, they should add some more menu.

The hotel was pretty nice. I really liked the room my boyfriend and I stayed in. There were stars painted on the ceiling and glowed when all of the lights were turned off and there was a blacklight built in the room which was really fun and cool. The carpet was very dirty but it wasn't too much of a problem with us. The free breakfast was okay. I wish there was a little more variety though. The internet sucked so we had to use our data.

Check in was easy. Got there in the early hours of the morning but I had let them know we wouldn't get there until late. Parking where we were closer to the stairs of our room was a tight squeeze to get in. While we were trying to get our stuff out of the car, one of the other hotel guests parked on the other side of the area and proceeded to pee right there on the wall. Not a great start Although they had nothing to do with the Hotel itself. Room was clean and bed was comfortable enough. Breakfast was alright. I wish there was more to choose from. Walk to Disneyland was easy and took maybe 10 minutes. I could not get onto the internet one night because it said it had reached the limit of guests. Need to fix that since everyone should be able to get on.

We stayed for one night, within walking distance of Disneyland. Very vice for the price; clean and spacious. The tub mat lifted slightly which was kind of gross. Other than that, the location, free parking and breakfast is definitely worth the price.

You stay here because it's cheap, and that's what you get. Between the fridge not working, the main cabinet opening whenever it wanted due to j even ground and the couple next door throwing each other against the wall at all hours this place was just ok. If you're looking for something nice then spend twice as much at the Marriott or 5 times as much at the Disney resort. Oh and the free breakfast is an absolute nightmare. The staff is rude and avoids any question you throw at them.

Summary Heading: Fair price for a room near Disneyland.
Summary: This was a decent place. It is located within walking distance to Disneyland. The room we stayed in could use updating, but was a place you could be comfortable overnight. For the price, it was a good deal.

Summary Heading: On budget? This will do the job
Summary: Great location. 10 min walk to Disneyland tram. We felt pretty secure staying there. Well lit hall ways. Breakfast included. Free filtered drinking water. Microwave oven. Safe deposit box. If you are looking for basics at Disney, this hotel will do the job. Only thing to say was..fridge was there but it doesn't work.
This was an adequate place to stay while visiting Disneyland.  Affordable and convenient to the Disney attractions.

The management let us check in very early which was very nice..... It's a regular hotel and very underpriced compared to other hotels similar in the area and walking distance to the Disneyland gate.... Will stay there again on my next trip to Disney

I love how close this Travelodge is to Disneyland!! When we pulled into the parking lot we could still see  the fireworks display. The check in was easy. Once we got to the room though was another story... the pillows are "WAY!!" to full. There needs to be a variety of flat ones too.  The bathroom door on the inside had paint has been peeled away. It really needs attention. We stayed in room #224. The room itself was nice & quiet though. The pool was nice and cool and refreshing. The breakfast room had a nice display of cereals, bagels and if you wanted to you could make a waffle. It was really crowded when we went though and not enough tables/chairs for everyone. We had to go and find a bench outside. I asked for a late check out and was granted 12 noon with no problem.

Walking distance to Disneyland and even a shorter walk to the Disney Shuttle Trams at the Mickey and Friends Carpark. A bit of a hike to restaurants but doable for adults and teenagers (but not for little kids). The hotel is old but clean and has up to date amenities (all you need for a family holiday if you are spending most of your time at Disneyland). The pool is big and clean. The breakfast plenty (but a bit boring after 4 days). A great location to watch the nightly Disneyland Fireworks.

Summary Heading: This was a nice place. The rooms were a great size. It is...
Summary: This was a nice place. The rooms were a great size. It is conveniently located. The staff was very courteous and responsive.  The rooms could use updating - but they were clean.

I reserved a room with 2 queen beds and a pull over (sofa bed) when we arrived the only one available was those for persons with some desavilities problems, for us it was not good, no counter top in the bathroom, no cover in the toilet, no shower only a handle, it was very dfificult to take a shower water all over, for the money i spend over there I could reserve another hotel, information was not good, I never hear about Wyndham Reward, the price they offer us for the Universal Studios was more expensive, than taking a Uber and buying the tickets on line, we saved 125.00dlls going by ourself and we were able to stay to close
Location was perfect and would stay here again.  Only negative was that the shower would back up.

Summary Heading: most def spot to come to!
Summary: I really liked our stay the kids loved the pool n how close we where to Disneyland. We are coming back the staff was nice front desk very sweet and helpful everyone. Thanks Travelodge for making our stay nice and cozy!!!!

Bathroom fairly clean. Breakfast was standard (cereal, bagels, toast, yogurt, waffles). Rooms were clean, even had a black light in there for you to check the sheets. Loved that they had a mini-fridge as well as a microwave. The grounds are clean and it is in walking distance to the Tram that takes you to Disneyland and California Adventures! I would stay here again.

It was a great stay! The room we got was a bit dark, poor lighting, but it was clean and decent. The pool was great, kids enjoyed it! Staff was friendly. If you want breakfast you better get there fast, they only put out a limited amount. You can also see the fire works from Disney from the balcony/porch walk way! If you are traveling with a lot of kids and need a place to sleep, and maybe burn some energy off at the pool this is a good place!

Summary Heading: Perfect Place to stay if you just need some shelter between days at Disneyland...
Summary: The location of the property is incredibly close to Disneyland... Less than a 10 minute walk for an adult, slightly more for a family with small children... The Pool is nice, but let's face it, if you are there for Disneyland, you probably will not be using the pool much.  THE ROOMS - The rooms are very dated...(Like, maybe last reno was in the late 80's?) we stayed in a room with 2 queen beds and a pullout couch for our family of 6... The beds were rock hard, which didn't bother me as much  because I am a tummy sleeper, but I do know that some of them did wake up sore from sleeping on such firm mattresses. There was also no bedding/pillows provided for the pullout couch (none hidden in the closet), but we had our own pillows and sleeping bags, so my siblings used those.  The

For a 2 star hotel, this place was an excellent value for the price. The staff was very friendly, the room and lobby were cleaned and well maintained, and it was only a 5 minute walk to the Mickey and Friends tram. Overall an excellent place to stay for a trip to the parks!

Hotel rooms were musty, and air conditioner did not work properly.   Called desk for a fan and they did not have one available nor did they offer another room.  Towels are thin and poor quality.  Carpets dirty and bathroom not cleaned well.  Transits camping out at pool, laying on chairs and using poolside shower to bathe. ..no security in area.
Convenient access, close to the park, reasonable rates and breakfast included. Perfect for what we could afford.

Looking for a last-minute place when arriving late afternoon at Anaheim after 14 hour drive to see Disneyland, we called several motels nearby yet only this hotel offered the best price. We found this motel too close to the Park like 4 -5 minutes drive, it's not so fancy like the other hotels but it's clean and met our needs. We stayed there for 2 nights and no complain. I recommend this hotel/motel for those who wants to save a little not compromising the comfort for nights of stay. Who needs fancy hotel anyway when you leave the place on day time and back only at midnight after outdoor leisure?

The location was fantastic! Room was generally clean. We loved being able to watch the fireworks from the bridge and from our window. There was a roach in the bathroom. :-( My real complaint was the breakfast area. It was WAY too small for the number of people. LOTS of screaming moms and long lines definitely made for a stressful breakfast time. Overall, I was happy with this hotel.

This hotel was very close to Disneyland! From our room you could see Matterhorn, and from another spot in the hotel, you could see the Tower of Terror. The fireworks are shot off right across the street, so you can see the fireworks very well. The room was nice! The breakfast was small, but it filled you up! The only bad thing about the hotel was this woman who would sit in the hallway, and smoke something that smelled very odd. The hotel could not control the people who stayed though. I will be staying here when we go to Disneyland again!

The hotel was walking distance to disneyland.  The rooms are old, the bathroom sink leaked and was plugged. Rooms smelt like mold.  Bathrooms could definitely use an upgrade. Had No towels one day for the entire day, no towels offered at the pool.
Comfortable Space for a family of 5. Bathroom needed some updating but not too bad of a deal. Wished it was closer to the park
Staff was friendly, but they also didn't seem interested when I was asking questions. Room was older, but well kept. Super close to Disneyland. I'll definitely stay here again.
Great value. The property is within walking distance to Disneyland. Great value for the money. Rooms were clean and well stocked, i would stay here again
The Hotel is great and breakfast was very great too! I would stay here again and never have a problem staying here.

Close to the new short cut through the parking structures to Disneyland parking shuttles. Staff had no information on how to use the short cut. Internet did not work well. I never was able to use it. Some in our group where able to use it. Beds where uncomfortable. Dirt behind the bathroom door. Sheets scratchy. Some of the "clean" towels had make up on them. Clean towels not left in room, always had to go to front desk to retrieve towels. Over all adequately clean. Although vomit showed up on the small lawn on the second day of our stay and was still there when we left three days later. Some of the rooms that we reserved months in advance were unavailable, but of course more expensive rooms were available for additional charge. Staff was generally unable to resolve problems and

I was hoping for a clean and adequate room for the price.  Nothing fancy but we arrived to was a dirty, musty, hot room.    We had originally booked for 6 nights and left after the first.   Within a few minutes of putting on socks, they were almost black from walking on the floor.   The air conditioner in our room did not cool the room at all.    The staff was at least extremely understanding (I'm sure it's not their first rodeo in guests leaving early).   If they took more care on keeping the rooms clean and in working condition, then it would be sufficient.    I don't recommend this location at all unfortunately.
The room was nicer then I had expected it to be. So was the bathroom. Real happy with the Travelodge in Anaheim.

No complaints!  The staff was great. Continental breakfast was standard and good. Room was spacious and clean. Only had a five minute walk to the Disneyland trams.  We loved the starry ceiling. We will definitely be back.

Not at all like the pictures we saw advertised, phone didn't work, not many channel's to choose from for t.v, shower water choices were freeze or scorch your skin, and they only had two cereal choices along with a waffle maker. The apple juice was ok, the oj was disgusting! Parking was terrible. This hotel looks like something you might pay around $70-$80 a night for, kind of like a truck stop motel. The internet connection was terrible as well. The only convenience was we were able to walk a couple blocks to some parking garage to catch the tram to Disneyland and the staff were quick and friendly... well, with the exception of them not having a room ready for my family when we showed up at 530 am after driving 20 hours from Oregon! Instead of seeing if they could get us in to
Good, the receptionist they were hospitality. But the wifi to slow and the carpet is too grazy..

The Travelodge on Disneyland Drive was better than expected.  It was clean and quiet.  My family has stayed at many of the hotels right across the street from Disneyland and it is comparable- all the hotels within walking distance could use an update including this one, but it was a clean, quiet place to sleep and that is what we needed.  My kids loved the pool.  The breakfast was better than most hotels within walking distance.  It had make your own waffles, danishes, bagels/cream cheese, toast, juice, milk, cereals, and bananas.  It is about a 10 minute walk to the Mickey Trams across the Disneyland employee parking lot.  Not bad at all.  The only thing that we didn't enjoy was having to wait for a Mickey tram at the end of our day.  On our last night, my daughter and her

Stayed here while visiting Disneyland, rooms are clean, beds firm and comfortable, staff very friendly and professional, clean pool and pay laundry. No frills and no complaints, walk 10 min to disney tram.
Really Nice Big clean room - fine pool - ok breakfast ... And Great that we could just Walk to Disney
Everything was ok: clean room, great location, good parking lot, great staff, just gotta have a wider variety of food at the breakfast time.

It was my kids first trip to Disneyland and the next visit we  definitely won't be staying here! At check in I gave my last name and the front desk lady decided to check her phone and text someone back before searching for my reservation. The room was large and had plenty of space but, the none of the outlets worked, the tv didn't work, the fridge wouldn't stay even slightly cool, and the bathroom was gross! I wouldn't let my kids take a bath because I didn't want them sitting in that tub. Every time we asked for towels they had long black hairs in them. The breakfast was really poor, with hardly a selection of anything.

This hotel has a lot going for it. Excellent location and price. Easy walk to Disneyland car park tram. The room we had was mouldy smelling. There were not enough pillows and the staff were reluctant to get more. There were not enough towels in the room for occupants. No towels by the pool. The breakfast was pretty dodgy and basic. However if you are looking for a cheap hotel with easy access and can handle the downsides this is a good choice.

Summary Heading: Good Value - Easy Walk to Disneyland Parking Structure
Summary: Stayed 4 Nights, 2 Queen with Hide-a Bed, Fridge and Microwave. Elevated walkway between East and West buildings has GREAT view of the fireworks. Room and facilities were dated but clean. Not the Residence Inn ;-).  Breakfast: Two waffle makers, two toasters, two cereal dispensers, coffee, milk, OJ, AJ, bagels, bread, and bananas (yogurt would have been a good addition). Most of the rooms open to exterior walkways. One building (East side of walkway) has a hallway down the middle.  Better than M6, but cost was a little more at TL.  Would stay again.

Summary Heading: Front desk  wanted to change my reservation to a smoking...
Summary: Front desk  wanted to change my reservation to a smoking room when I already had it reserve and paid to a nonsmoking toilet in room water was always running  shower head on tub full of calcium.

Summary Heading: Great staff and great location for a Disneyland location.
Summary: The staff were very pleasant and helpful.  Location was great for Disneyland.  We had a quick 4 block walk from the hotel to Disneyland's gates.  Clean room, comfortable beds.

We booked 2 rooms. Nothing special but a place to sleep after visit to Disneyland and Universal. Shower is outdated, ran out of hot water while i am showering! Breakfast is horrible, only hot item are waffles and bagels are still frozen. No fresh fruits, i asked for banana, and the worker said "no supply of fruits" Seriously?! Coffee are nasty, 7-11 coffee is way better. There are trash on all hallways and maggots are crawling everywhere. The only good thing about this place is the bed. the pool water are dirty. We will not come back nor recommend this to anyone, your wasting money on this hotel.
I like this place a lot. They're nice at the desk and have spacious rooms to offer. They're always clean and never any issues with questioning if the sheets are clean.

across the street is the parking Garage that takes you straight to Disney.  Very convenient and the room was large and spacious 2 queen beds and a sofa bed slept 6 of us with plenty of room for everything.

Summary Heading: Good basic hotel for the family
Summary: Budget-friendly, clean, and conveniently located. The Disney tram is about a 10 minute walk.  My only criticism is that the few electrical outlets they have are very loose. There should be at least 2 more outlets that will actually hold a plug in. Overall a good stay for 3 nights.

If what you are looking for is an affordable hotel close to Disneyland, then this is a great option.  It's about a 15 minute walk to the parks, very little hassle to use the Disney tram, and you get a great view of the fireworks though it is very loud (and surprising) if you aren't prepared for them.  The room itself was clean though dark and dingy looking.  The free breakfast consisted of make-yourself waffles, cereal, and bread options.  The staff was pretty friendly and the maid service kept the room quite clean.  There was a towel with a stain but it occurred only once during our four night stay.  This wasn't the best hotel we've ever stayed at but considering the cost, it was a decent stay.

Summary Heading: Good place, decent rooms compared to the cost of others
Summary: Rooms were a little dated, but they served their purpose and were priced accordingly. It had beds, it had a shower, it had cold A/C and a minifridge. Decently clean. I liked it.

This hotel was recommended to me by someone and I trusted them and I was pleased with my stay! The entire time was very quiete and peaceful, like any other hotel you will hear people occasionally but it wasn't the least disturbing. The beds were very comfortable and the room was attended to when we came back for our second stay. It was a bit of a walk to disneyland but I didn't mind it. The parking was easy and the guy at the front desk was extremely helpful and he even walked out to show me where to park. The pool is also very appealing, although I didn't have a chance to go in. I didn't have a chance to try the free breakfast because I wanted McDonalds. I am overall satisfied with my stay.

Summary Heading: The hotel is very clean i enjoyed my stay alot thank you for everything
Summary: We enjoyed are stay alot very clean housekeeping ladys were really nice and the staff from front desk
Very satisfied with our stay.  Very short distance to Disneyland.  Clean rooms, quiet, restful nights, very friendly staff.
The staff were nice and helpful. The rooms were nice and clean. They had a breakfast but we never tried it.

Close to the park. This is our first trip to this hotel. We normally stay elsewhere. I'm glad we tried this one. Rooms are large. Nice pool and jacuzzi. Parking is good. Staff was really nice. Ampm right next door for last minute stuff. I will be coming back to this hotel again.

I got a fantastic deal on staying 2 nites here and I was pleasantly surprised at how much you get for the money and that it was very affordable. The staff was super nice and friendly and helped with whatever I needed. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfy. The pool was a little chilly but jacuzzi was nice and warm. And the hot breakfast was pretty good. It is only about a block away from the Disney parking structure and the tram runs every 5 minutes which makes it worth it. We had such a good time and the location of this travelodge is fantastic
We had a family trip and we enjoyed the stay, the value, the distance to Disneyland, and overall the rooms and everything. We will come back
The room was not adequate for outlets.  could not charge all our phones and laptops, blow dryers

Hotel was perfect. it doesn't compare to the higher end hotels, but you cant beat the location, we walked from the hotel to the Disneyland tram station and back after our Disneyland adventure. I'm so glad we didn't have to worry about traffic leaving the Disneyland parking lot and we also saw the fireworks show from the balcony of the hotel. we would stay here again since we don't spend much time on the hotel anyway.

I have stayed here 3 times and this time had many discomforts.First the A/C kept turning off and wouldn't stay on and it was hot that day.I get that they changed to energy saving units but still if I'm paying for the room I should be able to use the A/C as much as I want to my comfort and then the wifi sucked it wouldn't let me log on and had to keep going to the front desk to reset,so I'll be considering other options for the next stay in Anaheim.

This hotel is located by the Disneyland parking structure and you use the parking lot structure to get into the resort.  It is clean and quiet and a good value.  It is an older hotel but has been kept up and has very comfortable beds.

Location, staff, room amenities, parking were perfect! Even seeing the stars on the ceiling when you turn of the light was amazing. However, the breakfast was a disappointment. The food quality was not good enough and the breakfast room was very small. People had to share their table with each other. Also internet speed was very low and we couldn't use the internet at all. Other than these two things, the hotel was absolutely great. If you are going to Disneyland, this hotel is the one for you!
There were stains on both the chairs and under the black light, I could see a big stain on the mattress by my head.  Also, the breakfast was just breads.

Summary Heading: WATCH OUT HOUSEKEEPERS STEAL AND MANAGEMENT IS USELESS!!!!!
Summary: My family and I were on our first trip to Disneyland with my precious 2yr. old grandson, my daughter and her husband ... we decided to use this hotel since my husband and I had stayed here before when we were on two separate couples trips to Disneyland him and I . We had never had a problem with this Travelodge in the past but  I guess there's a first time for everything.... and well in our case a last time as well!!!!  Well first of all this isn't the "cleanest" place ... it is VERY old and needs major renovations for it to be close to up to date, but you get what you pay for and being hard working people scraping up money to take the baby to Disneyland for a couple days this was within our budget.   Let's start with the desk staff, the day shift is adequate I suppose, I was
The hotel was pretty run down & felt like the staff/management/company didn't care. Disappointed.
Room was clean, but dated.  Bed comfortable. Served the purpose of the weekend. Walking distance to parks.

Summary Heading: Was better then others we stayed at
Summary: The room smells musky my gf and I felt it was the carpets and lack of  ventilation in bathrooms.. After taking showers just waking around barefoot on the carpet your feet would turn black.. They don't have full size pillows.. The bed was a bit hard.. Room was clean bathroom was clean.. There is microwave and frig.. Looks like 90 precent remodel has gone down witch was nice.. Free breakfast but only runs till 9:30 don't wake up that early.. Very very close to Disneyland had a good view of fireworks from the hotel room.. Uber was only 5.45 to the park.. Most part was a good stay.. Would stay again..

The location was great-within .5 miles of the tram that goes to the Park main gate. The hotel was nice looking, and the pool and spa looked inviting. The rooms were comfortable. TVs only got a few channels and picture quality was poor. The carpet was pretty filthy-after walking around in bare feet (after my shower) my feet were dirty. The breakfast was very disappointing. Just 2 types of cereal, a few types of bagels and white bread, waffles with either syrup or bananas in red syrup (strawberry? ) as waffle topping. No fresh fruit, yogurt, or protein. There were a couple of small issues with our rooms that management took care of right away.

We always stay here however because I was using my rewards point I couldn't stay in our usual room the room we received this time was run down and was terrible vs the one we normally stay in!  No safe,  the fridge didn't work right the cabinet was broken with pieces of wood under it so the drawers stayed shut!  Overall wasn't the experience we normally had!  No fruit at breakfast
The sheets were clean & that was the highlight. The carpet was so dirty & gritty it was horrible. Cockroachs were found in the room, the a/c unit didn't work properly.

Summary Heading: The hotel is in a convenient distance from disneyland...
Summary: The hotel is in a convenient distance from disneyland however it is very run down and smells like urine. Breakfast is too plain without healthy options.

I loved staying at this hotel!! Me and my husband stayed at this hotel because we got the 2 day tickets at disneyland. First starters its supper close to disneyland and especially close to downtown disney you can literally go walking there. The complementary breakfast was awesome! The only downside was that the rooms are connected or at least mine was so it was kind off weird you can lock your door of course and they can't open it but still thats kinda weird. But for what you're paying its pretty awesome.

Summary Heading: A lot of renovations going on during our stay, but not bad...
Summary: My family and I stayed here for a quick weekend Disney trip. There was a lot of renovations going on and a lot of construction on the property. Overall the room was decent, a little dated but decent. We slept comfortably at night and enjoyed the breakfast in the morning. Overall, it was an average place to stay. It may be better now that renovations should be completed. I may book here again to see how it all turned out.
We stayed here twice when we went to disneyland from washington, air condition is cold, friendly staff. The only thing is they have old furniture and appliances
The room is pretty ran down just a dirty feeling the carpets are.pretty old the tub paint is chipped over all not very satisfactory actually did not work properly

Summary Heading: My go to place to get away. Comfortable, reasonable pricing
Summary: This is my go to place every time I need a break from the hectic reality we call life. I always check this spot first when looking for a place to go for the evening. I can relax here and that's my biggest need when I want to get away. I like the hustle of the Disney area here. I enjoy hearing people around me and this is the best of both worlds. Relaxing, but not so quiet that it can be depressing :)

They had poor wifi that has a user limit that is easily reached. The fridge froze our food and drinks. They did not clean very well and did not change the sheets, they only fixed the bed. Hallways to rooms were not clean. Washer and dryer damaged our clothes. Laundry room was disgusting. Pool was not kept clean. The breakfast was bare and ended early. They didnt make breakfast. You had to make it for yourself. They had frosted flakes, Raisin Bran, bagels, and had to make your own waffles. They had coffee, milk, and apple juice and that's it. The employees do not act or appear professional. They gossip about you behind your back. We woke up in the middle of the night to screaming children that weren't being quieted down. Overall very poor experience.The only upside was that you

I've stayed in many, but this room happened to be a bit larger. The staff was nice, the only problem I had was the grounds could have been much cleaner. The trash cans were overloaded and the wind had blown leaves around the motel doors.

Summary Heading: Great Location for access to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed at the hotel in December 2015, there were 5 of us in total, room was big enough to accommodate us all comfortably. Hotel is in a great location for easy access to Disneyland. Just a short walk and then catch the free Disneyland tram. Hotel staff were friendly and polite. Room could have been a little cleaner, we found empty beer packaging behind the fridge and beer bottle tops under the beds. Both of the hotels dryers were broken which made it difficult to get washing dry. Included Breakfast was very good, and my children enjoyed being able to make their own waffles each morning. Not a lot of seating in the breakfast room, so arrive early or be prepared to take your breakfast back to your room. Can see some of Disneyland fireworks from hotel balcony.

Summary Heading: Pool, 5 minute walk to Tram, and Free waffles OH MY!
Summary: This hotel is conveniently located 5 minutes away from the Tram to Disneyland, the pool was clean, and the waffles were great! Even the staff were very nice. We will definitely be staying here again soon when we plan another trip! :)

Summary Heading: The hotel was an ideal location for Disneyland, which was...
Summary: The hotel was an ideal location for Disneyland, which was the main reason I chose to stay here. There are no restaurants or stores nearby, however. The breakfast was less than ideal, consisting of Raisin Bran, Frosted Flakes, bread for toast, apples and waffles only.  While the orange juice did not taste good (and I overheard a small boy say "Mom, this is not apple juice.  It is apple water"), I must say it was very cold and the perfect temperature! There was never any room to sit at a table, so we had to take our cereal back upstairs to our room.  The room was decent, the front desk staff were nice enough, and the price was reasonable.

Summary Heading: Over all it was really good for the price. 6 people fit...
Summary: Over all it was really good for the price. 6 people fit comfortably in the room. The rugs left something to be desired. We make the kids keep their socks on because they were so dirty.  Should have a disclaimer about the nightly fireworks. We had didn't realize how close we were to them...it shook the hotel room. Loved the onsite laundry, it was great for the emergency load.
I let my 1 year old crawl on the floor and immediately I noticed his knees and hands were black. I don't know how often carpets are deep cleaned, but I recommend it should be done often.
The room Was a good size. The bed was not as comfy as I would have liked but everything was ok .

The hotel was just ok. Walkable to Disneyland, gas station right next door, friendly staff, and free parking which is a plus. My room was up against the parking lot so there was a lot of light which made it hard to sleep. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. Nothing fancy. The ceiling stars were a fun added addition.  Came back late one night and people were making a lot of noise in the pool after hours. Called the front desk and they took care of the problem promptly. Would stay here again.

We go up to Disneyland on a regular basis. We find this motel the best bang for the buck. if your looking for a good priced motel while your staying at Disneyland I highly suggest you take a look at this one.

For the price I guess it was okay. The second we opened the door I spotted a spider on the ceiling above the dresser and we had to kill it and of course I searched the room up and down for more critters but found none, second the smell was funky and the AC was not on so the room was very stuffy but we survived. The best part was the view of Disneyland's fireworks from our balcony was amazing, better than the view we got from the park :) down side to the balcony was our neighboors hung out until late at night which made it hard to sleep and wake up early for our long day ahead at disneyland. Another bonus was the refrigerator and microwave , the gas station right on the corner had some evening munchies we were able to heat in the room and keep drinks cold. Con- they had 2 bottles

This hotel is within easy access to Disneyland which was great. The room was large with two queen beds and a sofa bed. perfect for a family of six. Staff were friendly and dealt with any queries. I would recommend this hotel especially for families.

In the room my wife and I was the is a window and there was no windows curtain everyone working on the passageway could see us. The only decent things was the bed.I believe this hotel makes enough money to remodel.

I've stay many times at Travelodgee off of ball RD. I Love the fact you can just walk across street no more then a 5min. walk to board on to tran into Downtown disney and if you forgot anything or need something to munch on am pm next door thats a plus

The only person in the room besides my family was a Hispanic lady from house keeping who stole my 4year old sons IPAD!  When the manager confronter her she lied and said she never saw it.  We used to stay here all the time but will not be back and will make it know to EVERYONE to STAY AWAY unless you want you stuff stolen!!! SHE SHOULD BE FIRED

you know this hotel has always worked for me and my little boy who is disabled. Its right across the street from Disneyland, rooms are clean and the people who work there are nice. I like the fact that I can stand outside of hotel and have the best seats for the fireworks, it even better then being inside Disneyland watching them. I don't have to worry about the people running into or siting on my son while in his wheelchair. the room I get for my son and me works, nothing fancy, but then I get to keep the money for fancy and spend it on my son. I'm happy with that.We stay here all the time.

Hotel Room was very big. Bathroom a little small but that's okay:) Continental breakfast felt like a full mea breakfast. Had waffle maker and cereal, bagels, oj, coffee. we went to Disneyland and that hotel was super convenient, getting to Disneyland from that hotel was a breeze :) sadly the wifi was super slow, only inconvenience there :/

This hotel is not luxurious, but we had a large, clean  room with 2 queen beds and a sofa bed for $99 a night.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  The queen beds were comfortable, but the sofa bed was not.  We had an air mattress with us because hotel sofa beds are usually not comfortable, so we were fine.  The free breakfast was good, with waffles, 1 kind of fruit, toast, bagels, cold cereal, juice and coffee.  For a family of five, this hotel is hard to beat.

We travelled to Anaheim to take the family to Disneyland.   Positives -  1. Walking distance (10min) to the free Disney shuttle (every 5 min) that takes you to downtown Disney (less than 5min rid) (also very close to the security entry to Disney) 2. Value - using our Wyndham rewards points on the Easter weekend was tremendous value. Rooms have a microwave, a fridge and a flat screen TV. 3. Very good continental breakfast and eating area for the family.  (Waffles-make your own, bagels, toast, cereal, coffee, juice, milk)   4. Great hot tub for soaking in after a long day of walking and riding at Disney.  Negatives 1. Carpets could use a deep cleaning. 2. Swimming pool was cold.

Beds were very hard and uncomfortable, and when I asked for a mattress topper the first person I asked said to try asking tomorrow because it was too late in the day.  The next day the person said they didn't have such a thing.   Also, the warm water was very limited and felt more like luke/cool water most of the time.  When staff were notified they said there was nothing they could do about it.  Breakfast had just cereal, bagels, and waffles that turned out doughy inside despite being browned on outside--must have used a weird mix.   On a good note, there was a cool black light in the room that made it look like there was a starry sky above you if you turn all the lights out.  If you run the fan in the bathroom and in the AC unit, you won't hear any outdoor noises which is also
Generally very clean, staff exceptionally helpful! Entire facility, however, needs to be upgraded.

Summary Heading: Great room size and location to Disneyland
Summary: Modest amenities, but you can't beat the location to Disneyland (walking distance to tram to Downtown Disney) and the room size.  The pool and hot tub are an added feature for the kids, and the rooms were basic but clean.  The WIFI was hit or miss, but most of our time was spent in the parks.  The breakfast waffles were a huge hit, but I think fruit and maybe a yogurt option should be added.  Only carbs were offered; waffles, cereal or bagels.  Overall though, we were well fed to enter the park.
I stay here every time I go to Disneyland. Hotel is about a 5 minute walk to the Disneyland shuttle. Rooms are always very clean when I stay there.

Everything was great. Was at Disney for two whole days, slept at night. Only complaint is that I reserved a room for two queen beds, and the beds in rm 127 are for sure not queen beds!
