They are full size. I called front desk and girl assured me they are queen. I know for a fact they are not because i have a queen bed at home. Other than that everything else for the time we were there was great!

It wasn't glamorous, but it was a clean, quiet place to sleep within walking distance of Disneyland. The room was awkwardly large with little furniture and dark. The continental breakfast left us health-conscious Seattleites in want of some oatmeal or fruit.
It is a great family room. Easy 5 min. walking to the Disneyland tram. Breakfast was okay, waffle maker line was long. Comfortable beds. WiFi spotty with I-pad. Overall nice hotel. Will stay again!

Room was fine. Bathroom fan/light cover missing. Looked bad. Pretty clean, comfortable. Nice pool. Could use some soundproofing. Could hear people above into the night. Called WELL in advance for joining rooms and didn't get them. Realize it's not guaranteed, but one of our rooms was in the suite with random people. Just seemed odd. Disappointed in that.

Hotel was average, rooms were not as clean as we expected, tv and channels were distorted half the time, we had a HBO guide in our room but no HBO channel?  and no channel guides what so ever. Beds were comfy, and the staff was amazing !!
Cheap, clean, friendly, and some hidden surprises. This place was awesome. Can even walk to the tram to the parks.

We stayed at this hotel in September of last year and were quite happy with it. We usually stayed at the Eden Roc Inn & Suites because we would get a good deal for our budget but couldn't get a good rate last year. So we then had to look for another hotel that was in our budget and found this place. We were a little skeptical because we saw a few bad reviews online but thought we should go with it because it was in our price range. We called and got a great rate that was cheaper than what we have paid before. When we arrived the desk clerk had rooms available with three beds for our family of six instead of just two and a sofa which is what we expected. The room turned out to be a newly remodeled room with new everything. The carpets were clean, bedding was new, shower was new,

The reception area is probably the best area of this hotel but this does not reflect the rooms at all. We had three rooms booked for two nights and the two on the rear of the hotel were very dark, tired and not very welcoming at all. They were clean, but it felt like we were staying in an old style motel from the '70s. There was also a rather perculiar aroma in our room which we failed to identify. The breakfast facilities were adequate, but again the area was clean and well looked after.
Overall a good stay, close to the park, clean room, staff friendly and helpful and price was great too!

Our stay at Travelodge in Anaheim was going well until my daughter ran barefoot in our room. Within 5 minutes the bottom of her feet were turning black from all the dirt in the carpet. The carpet looked, felt and smelled dirty. I imagine they vacuum the carpets every day but perhaps they should be deep cleaned more often.

Good hotel, very reasonable price, and they were accommodating to my needs. Clean, spacious rooms. Working microwave and refrigerator. Close to Disneyland, can either walk to trams or drive to parking structure. Good breakfast, waffles were delicious! I'd stay here again.

I've been coming here to this place for the last 10 years every January for the NAMM show.  What can I say, the only reason to stay is the price. Under-kept, under-rmaintained and generally in poor condition. You can generally count on the windows not closing correctly, the refrigerator not to work at all or barely keep cool and problems with the shower, etc.   One year the entire toilet was not bolted down and moved every time you sat on it.   All this being said it is very quaint, and very close to NAMM and very very cheap.   And Denny's is right next door.  If you are looking to go to the convention center or Disney on a tight budget- this is your hotel- you get exactly what you pay for.   the staff by the way- are great and very helpful.    all in all.. you CAN get a good
Manager Response: We are located on 1057 W Ball Road, if you said "the Denny's is right next door", I am sure you stayed at another hotel.

Summary: if you want close to disneyland this is it ! if you want close to freeway this is it ! this is a no frills hotel although i think they have renovated since my last stay, WiFi was decent i just wish more places would have more outlets to charge devices.

The reason I gave it a 5 is because of the location. It's literally across the street from the Disneyland parking lot. It's also within walking distance of the trams that take you to downtown Disneyland. It was also very clean and they attended to our needs.

We stayed here for our family disneyland trip. We checkin a day early thinking we could relax and swim... however upon checking in I heard one of the cashiers telling another guest the pool was being worked on and no one could swim. I was  disapointed I had to overhear it and my clerk did not discolse the same information to me. I thought well it looks like we are staying in and watching movies/TV.... however the tv stations choice was horrable.. NOTHING worth watching.. my next thought was well I guess we are going to bed early and get up eat breakfast and head out.. However breakfast was MIN... Im talking a bowl of ceral juice and a waffle.. needless to say we left hungry. I dont think I would stay here again   oh and I forgot to mention the tolit.. everytime you flushed it
The staff was very helpful.  Rooms were not up to par.  There was an odd smell in the room and carpet was filthy.  Convienent to the Didney Tram.

The hotel was clean.  We could not get the wi fi even when we were given the user and password.  We did not need anything from staff.  The breakfast room is somewhat small and even when the staff was cleaning constantly, there were some members who were messy and would not care about it.
About 6 min. walk to the tram so didn't have to worry about paying parking at Disneyland. Room was clean except for molded coffee maker and the free continental breakfast wasn't all that.
I loved how close it was to walk to the park.the room was clean and sufficient to meet our family needs. The breakfast was simple and sufficient. Its a great value.

Room was adequate but the drapes did not cover the entire window and presented a real privacy issue. Position of the tv was fine from the bed but stand did not rotate for viewing from the couch. Staff was courteous and helpful.
Pool and jacuzzi closed did not disclose at time of booking did nothing to try and accommodate

Check in was great, staff is friendly and helpful. Once we got to our room I was not happy, the room was dark and uninviting. The walls and carpet were very, very dirty. I did not walk on the carpet without my shoes on. Continental breakfast has very limited choices and is in a very small, cramped area. This hotel is very close to Disneyland and within walking distance. We will never stay here again. Overall, our experience with this hotel stay was mediocre, it is in dire need of a renovation.

We stayed at this hotel just for the night to make the most of a full day at Disneyland the following morning.  On the plus side the distance to the park was great, front desk staff was friendly and polite, room has a starry sky scene on the ceiling after you turn off the lights however the room itself could really use some TLC.  The carpet was so filthy my husband threw his socks away the following morning because they were literally black.  There was a bit of a musty smell in the room like it hadn't been aired out in days (or probably from the carpet) and one of the chairs had large stains on it.  The walls and the bathroom area were not filthy but they could use some new paint considering the hotel must host travelers from around the world.  Thankfully the bed and pillows

Summary Heading: Why do I look the way I do.
Summary: I was asked to pay in advance.  Even before I saw the room.  Maybe it was the way I looked to the receptionist.  My son stayed there and he didnt have pay in advance.  Now I know how African Americans feel when they are asked to pay in advance.

Our room smelled terrible. Like the chemicals they Use to clean up vomit. Rooms appeared old, dim and run down.  The pool and spa were also closed for remodeling while we were there. The kids were very disappointed.  The rooms are spacious however.

Summary Heading: Tub was dirty, coffee was lukewarm, pool was closed for...
Summary: Tub was dirty, coffee was lukewarm, pool was closed for maintenance and we stayed there partly due to pool. Staff not overly helpful.

Clean rooms, plentry of hot water and towels.  The front office staff accommodated our request for ground floor and upgraded us to a bigger room since we were staying 6 nights.  Breakfast is good, one more waffle station would be helpful.  Bonus is this place is right across the street from the walkway to the trams, just ask the front desk where that secret entrance is.

Summary Heading: Disappointing start to our family vacation
Summary: Not sure what happened because the room we were given did not look at all like the ones in these photos.  The pool was shut down for maintenance (which we weren't told on booking), and our room smelled like it had been very recently fumigated.  There was a sticky film on the carpets and floor, and we had to sleep with the windows open due to the chemical smell.  There was also a limit to the number of guests who could use the wifi at one time. We checked out after one night and moved to another hotel.

Stayed at this hotel because of the price and proximity to Disneyland. It was a great stay for the price. The walk to Disneyland took about 15minutes which wasn't bad, one day we took a cab from downtown Disney since we were tired and it only cost $6. The breakfast was nothing special, but I was enough to hold us over until lunch time. If you are on a budget and going to Disneyland I recommend it.
Great location for Disney. Room was clean, nothing fancy. Not many healthy choices for breakfast.

The location was great for a special event at Disneyland.  The staff was wonderful and helpful with our special requests.  The room was spacious compared to other hotels in the area but there were ants in the bathroom.

Room 344.  Dated but clean and comfortable.  Smells like strong commercial disinfectant, but I find that oddly comforting in an older motel.  No bugs.  Fridge is actually a freezer...can't adjust temp...annoying!  Pool and hot tub are being refurbished (out of order).  New TV, stars on the ceiling, full view of the fireworks, pull out couch that you can actually sleep on, edible free carb breakfast and walking distance to the parks.  5 year old thought it was great and that was all that mattered to me.  I don't go to Disneyland to spend time in the room.  Recommended for the budget concious.

Travelodge was located very convenient to the park. After a friendly check in we were shown where to walk to reach the FREE train to the Main entrance, no more than 10 minutes walk, our room was comfy, breakfast is simple but met our needs.

Hotel was clean, needs room remodeling. Good walking location to the parks. It is on the side OPPOSITE garden walk and Harbor restaurants. That didn't matter to us, but it is something people should be aware of.

Great room, great location, breakfast was good.  Spa and pool where down, kinda a bummer.  The rooms could of been a little cleaner esp the carpet.  Over all I would defiantly stay here again and would recommend it to others.

I was surprised of how good this hotel is ... it's a bit old, but it was ok because it fitted perfectly with what we were looking for: it was clean, the location was great (just a block away from the parking lot where you can take the tram), it has breakfast included, and after the cold december nights it was warm ... I loved it!!!! I'm pretty sure I'll go back to this hotel on my next Disney trip :D

We were just looking for an inexpensive place to stay while visiting Disneyland. Rooms were nice, clean and did the trick. It was close to Disneyland, very close. Hotel wasn't too scenic but we weren't worried about that too much. Stars in the room were an awesome touch. The free breakfast left much to be desired. They had two kinds of cold cereal, a few pastries and bread for toast. No bagels or muffins.

With the 30% off holiday deal via Wyndham it was a good value.  The room was clean but rundown and dated.  Walls need paint.  Awful pillows. Mattress ok.   The Tv/fridge cabinet drawers wouldn't stay closed until we propped the cabinet up with a folded towel under it.  Breakfast was average with all the usual high carb stuff.  Fireworks seen from the hotel were great. So close the ashes were coming down on us.  Arco mini mart is next door which was convenient.   20 minute walk to the Disney parking lot tram.  Staff were nice and courteous.

Nice sizeable family room. Clean. Staff very courteous. Great free breakfast. Amazingly close 6 min walk to Disneyland tram. The property is older. Very good value for your money with Triple A discount. Yes we'll be back.

Summary Heading: Everything was good really all we wanted was a place to...
Summary: Everything was good really all we wanted was a place to sleep and shower in the morning get ready for the next day at Disneyland and was just what we got to do beds were fine clean customer service was good

Our flight got cancelledand they wouldn't let us cancel one of the two nights we were spouses to stay.  When we did get there the room smelled bad and was outdated.  People in the room above us you could hear like they were in your room,  hot tub had a really bad smell, and then we found a roach in our room! Not a good experience and glad we only stayed the one night instead of two!

I really enjoy every stay here. The people are friendly and accommodating. The property is nice and big, close to Disneyland. Perfect view of fireworks! I really like staying here when I'm in the area.

The price here is usually very reasonable, the rooms were clean, and it is a short walk to the Disneyland tram. The AM/PM right next door was convenient and the free breakfast was very good, my husband loved making his own waffles. The staff was very friendly and check-in an out were a breeze.

We went up to Disneyland and stayed at the Travelodge, We liked the backlight stars in the room that was nice touch to go to sleep to. I still feel the travel lodge is the best bang for the buck in the Disneyland area.
Our room was clean & smelled fresh, the continental breakfast was very good and with just a six minute walk to the Disneyland tram our stay was great!  We would definitely stay there again.

The best feature of this property was its location to Disneyland, Downtown Disney and California Adventure. Just across the street is the entrance to Disney employee parking. From there you have to walk the length of the parking structure to board the trams to the theme parks. I found it safe even after midnight for myself and my 2 young girls. We also were able to enjoy Disneylands fireworks from room. The fireworks are very loud in this area around the park, setting off car alarms and dogs barking but I felt it just added to the excitement of he show.  The breakfast was good for your standard all carb breakfast. I was disappointed that peanut butter wasn't available at breakfast and the coffee served was Folgers. The WiFi was disappointing at best. I ended up using my own data

Summary Heading: Ok but wouldn't stay here agin
Summary: Based on my budget, I know not to expect much from the lodging I choose when I go to Disneyland.  Most of the 2-3 star places I've stayed at in the past were not bad at all, and in fact pretty decent.  I thought this place would be the same.  The only thing going for this place is location isn't too bad as it's walking distance to the park and the staff is friendly and accommodating.  My deal breaker is that they didn't sell ART tickets or Disneyland tickets.  Most other lodging close by that I've stayed at sell these tickets.  AND, their bed was the most uncomfortable bed I've ever slept on in all of my travels.  It was just the absolute worst!    I would recommend staying at Stanford Inn & Suites instead.  It's slightly further down from the park but with ART it's not a big

Summary Heading: Perfect for Disneyland on a budget
Summary: This is your typical hotel. Nothing fancy. But if you're going to Disneyland, this place is awesome. Save money on your hotel and use it at the themeparks is our motto. The hotel has all the normal amenities. It was clean, friendly and helpful staff and a five minute walk to the Disney tram, which takes you right to Downtown Disneyland. It is close to dozens of restaurants, many of which are your typical fastfood franchises, so you can save on dining as well. When we go to a theme park, we want to splurge on the themepark, not the hotel. But we also want to be comfortable in a clean room. Add the close proximity and this hotel goes from okay to awesome!

Summary Heading: Ok but we found a little surprise!!!!
Summary: Stayed three nights here and on our first night my husband finds a meth pipe in the light fixture in the bathroom. Besides that the room was ok. Bed was a little to hard for me.

First the pros:  walkable to Disney (half mile to tram, mile to park gate), nice exterior, great price, small breakfast included Cons:  not up to my personal standard of clean, beds hard and pillows lumpy, bathroom old and poorly maintained, could hear guests above, beside and outdoors, and fireworks were so loud they set off some car alarms Moral:  if you aren't fussy and are seeking low price, this is for you. Otherwise, I'd recommend elsewhere.

Summary Heading: Second stay here in past 60 days
Summary: The price for the room is great plus you get free parking and breakfast. We have stayed here twice in the past 60 days and really like it. The AC didn't work during our last stay so we were very hot at night but other than that our last stay was good. For families on a budget this is a good clean place and it about 205 mins walking distance to the theme park.

I was not allowed to pay with a Visa Gift Card which I received from my employer.  I don't understand the logic, but it is their rule at this location.  In the room, the counters were dirty, a hairpin was left on the bathroom floor (not cleaned?), the toilet ran ALL night, there were no local tv channels, only CNN, Disney and HBO, wifi didn't work, and the shower never warmed up past a cool luke warm.  Although i was unhappy with my experience here, I decided to return the room key and let them know about the toilet (only).  The woman at the front desk took my key but never looked up or acted like she cared.

We had a double bed room with a pull out sofa sleeper. The room was ok, the sheets were dirty which made us never want to stay there again. It was midnight when we got to our room so too late to have sheets changed. Our kids ended up sleeping on the floor on top of towels and using their own blankets. The restroom door looked like some had torn all the paint off and did a lazy sloppy paint job over the torn off paint. The fridge looked like it was from the 70's and there was no way for us to change the temp causing all of our sons milk to freeze. And no where on the website for this specific location does it state that Disneyland fireworks are set off less than a football field away causing it to sound like a war zone at 6 & 9 pm!

This hotel while very average is so close to Disneyland you could touch the back wall. The decor is dated. the room comfortable and basic. Very close to Disney land; you walk to tram. You can go to Downtown Disney and into entrance of Disneyland. Vey cost effective.
I have stayed at this property a few times and what I enjoy most is it's inexpensive, has comfortable beds, clean and close to Disneyland.

Close to Disney parks. Room spacious and clean.  Two queen beds with fold out couch. Air conditioner kept turning off even though   Rrom was still warm. Breakfast consisted of waffles, toast, bagels, bananas, cereal, juice, milk and coffee. Plenty of room to sit in breakfast room. Would stay again.

First time staying here. We usually stay on Harbor right across from the park. This place was cheaper so we tried it. The walk to the tram was short and nice. Taking the tram was fine unless you stay till the park closes, then you can get stuck for a very long time in Downtown Disney. It was CRAZY!! Not enough blankets or towels, he breakfast was ok to just tide yourself over until you eat at the park.  Weve stayed everywhere from the Hilton to a dump. This is average. You get what you pay for. Staff was nice and we had no problems. If you are super picky then pay more and stay somewhere else. Dont choose the cheapest then complain about it.

Summary Heading: Nice room, great free coffee and breakfast but rowdy party-goers on our floor.
Summary: We enjoyed our stay. And the management did send someone to "control" the noise and loud music from party-goers who decided to have a PARTY on our floor--even after 10 PM.

Summary Heading: First time stay at Travelodge Inn & Suites Anaheim
Summary: The room was clean, the beds comfortable. The pillows lacked any useful purpose. The decore was dated and I feel could have used a face lift. The bathroom had been remodled which was nice. I appreciated the grab bar in the shower/tub combo.

My family and I stayed here for 3 nights.  My only complaint would be that the breakfast was all carbs with hardly any choices.  Other than that, it was a nice place to stay.  I thought the staff were extremely friendly and helpful.  We asked for extra blankets and towels and it was brought up right away.  We had heard that you could walk to the trams and I have to say, that it literally was about a 5-10 minute walk from our hotel until we were waiting for the trams.  This saved quite a bit of money for parking.  I would recommend staying here.  I would just remember, that it is definitely a budget motel.

Enjoyed the great service and comfort of the room. We didn't hear a peep from any of our neighbors throughout our three day stay.   Only negative was the few stray hairs we found on the sheets.   Also, Room # 220 could use a little TLC - but was in pretty good shape.   We will come stay again @ Travelodge at this location our next trip down.

I have stay at almost every hotel around Disneyland. from high price to prices I can afford. My family is coming in from England and I had made a reservation at Travelodge. they read the reviews, not happy. I explained to them that I go to this hotel all the time and it isn't close to being some of the reviews stated. they know me and I would never put my son in a hotel with roaches. My son is serverely disabled and have to be carefull where we stay. I really like this Travelodge on ball rd. No its not fancy with fancy foods. I don't have to pay for parking and all these other fees that go with the fancy hotels. Every room I have had has be desent. No roaches, confortable beds, hot water, plus great fireworks, wont find a better spot for that. Id rather have the extra money I

They started out by putting us in a crap hole dungeon in which the shower would not drain. Told them I was not having it and they moved us to a normal room which meet my expectations. Think maybe they put people in room 101 in hopes that they will get a taker  to occupy it?????

Summary Heading: staff were very nice. Rooms were very clean, beds...
Summary: staff were very nice. Rooms were very clean, beds comfortable pool area  clean. Able to watch  fireworks from balcony. will use again.

Summary Heading: It is very close to Disney and it's a great rate! Limited...
Summary: It is very close to Disney and it's a great rate! Limited options for breakfast for me since I can't eat Gluten but all in all it was a great value!

Summary Heading: I was very unsatisfied  with my stay at this hotel. The...
Summary: I was very unsatisfied  with my stay at this hotel. The people at the front desk were very rude specifically  one named Isabel. My friend and I stayed in rooms next to each other and we found cockroaches in both of our rooms. When we told the front desk, they did not seem to care. I was very unsatisfied with my stay.

I booked this room last minute for a current overnight trip to Disneyland.  I had read reviews for other hotels in the area that honestly left me somewhat concerned.  We arrived at the hotel and there was plenty of parking which was nice.  We found the front desk easily and the people who checked us in were friendly and welcoming.  They explained to us where our room was located and gave us information about the continental breakfast.  The hallways to the rooms are open which makes it seem as though anyone can walk up to your door in the middle of the night.  But, the plus side about that is being able to walk in and out to the car quickly instead of having to go through the front desk.  Also, I didn't see anyone questionably hanging out around the rooms.  The room was a nice,

Based on other reviews, I was expecting a smelly, dingy room.  We had no smell, everything worked properly, the room was humongous for the 4 of us and easily could have had 2 more people join us. Slept great for 4 nights and enjoyed our days at Disneyland in walking distance. No problem to walk, even for my 5 and 7 year olds and the tram in the Mickey parking garage is also accessible.  The fridge and microwave were helpful to make our daily sandwiches/snacks for the park.  The breakfast room was small and awkwardly layed out but once you prepared your food, trays were provided to take it back to the room.  Waffles, cereal, coffee/juice, bagel/danish/toast, apples and occasionally small packs of oatmeal.  Nice to get something in your belly before the start of a long day and
Everything was average, but the room's carpet was so dirty, they didn't pass the vacuum prior our occupancy. The staff was rude and impolite.

The hotel was so close it was literally a five minute walk.  Travelodge made it so easy, booked online, checked in in less than 10 minutes, checked out in less than 5 and everything in between was perfect. I will be staying at this hotel for my future visits to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: 2nd stay this year - clean, quiet and comfortable
Summary: We stayed here in March and were very satisfied so booked again, and our experience was just as good the second time! This hotel is located on Ball Rd and to enter Disneyland you walk into the employee parking lot and through the parking structure to get to the trams. The breakfast is basic but sufficient, the beds comfortable, the pool and hot tub clean, and the front desk staff always kind and helpful, for example we needed extra bandaids after running out of our own one morning and they were able to provide. We'd stay here again!

We stayed two nights at this hotel and we pleased with it over all. No, not your high end hotel amenities. But you can pay a lot more around Disneyland in Anaheim. This was within walking distance. And when you consider how little you are actually in your hotel when you go to Disneyland, why pay more? The pool and hot tub were kept up very nicely and we enjoy a couple of swims while there. The included continental breakfast is sufficient. We did bring a few other eats for breakfast but not necessary. Staff was very helpful and courteous. All in all, a good experience!

Summary Heading: Great location to Disneyland ...  Room was spacious for a...
Summary: Great location to Disneyland ...  Room was spacious for a family of 5... We were only in the room for sleeping so it was fine.  Had a funky moldy smell in the room.  But over all was fine for the price and location

I have stayed many times before at this travelodge and I have never been so disappointed. The shower curtain in the bathroom was hanging from the plaster, the hair dryer didn't work and was sealed up into the wall in what I can assume was the only outlet access because there was no outlets in the bathroom to plug in flat irons/ curling irons/ charge electronics. The coffee maker was missing the drawer you put the coffee into as well. As for the bed room there was trash stowed under the edge of the bed. All the outlets were old and loose so you would have to prop your charger against something else to stay in the wall. The microwave was clearly out of date and the timer dial was busted so you had to time it yourself or rush burning whatever you were heating up. The fridge made a

I had never booked a room at Travelodge until this trip. The hotel was right were I needed to be so I gave it a try. Overall it was a good choice. The room was not as clean as I would have liked; (sticky residue on a night stand). Fortunately, I only needed the room to take a couple of quick naps as I was working all night at Disneyland, so I was not bothered by the lack of a shower curtain and the lighting was lacking in the main room. If I had been there to work in the room on my laptop then I would have had an issue with there being a shortage of electrical outlets. None at the desk and I had to unplug a lamp to charge my phone. They are not set up for business travelers obviously. However for the price and location, I would book again.
Room was average, carpet needs to be replaced. Bath/shower was terrible, showerhead was to low and there was a high wall to step out of the shower, very dangerous when wet!
Very roomy 3 Queen Suite, great value for the price. Great location and fireworks view from DL.

Summary Heading: Super close to Disneyland's parking garage so you can take...
Summary: Super close to Disneyland's parking garage so you can take the tram easily. Great value for cost

Summary Heading: Not the most glamorous of hotels but a great location for Disney
Summary: The accommodation here is basic but our room was spotlessly clean if in need of a little decorating update. Staff were friendly. Rooms had a fridge, flat screen TV & air conditioning. Beds were really comfortable. Swimming pool & hot tub. Breakfast was basic but appetizing enough. For the cost, and the location to Disney it's well worth staying for the duration of your visit to the Parks if you are on a budget. Fantastic views of the Disney fireworks overhead

The Travelodge was perfect for our family of 6--two queens and a hide-a-bed slept everyone comfortably.  The sink being separate from the shower and toilet helped us all share the facilities, and having the pool and hot tub was great.  The breakfast was all sugar and carbs, understandable for the budget price, but if you want to eat more healthfully you'll need to supplement.  We also used the combination safe in the room for our computers.  The safe could have been easily carried away, but we felt it was more secure than just leaving the electronics sitting out.  We toured the lobbies of the pricey Disneyland hotels, and the atmosphere was really fun, but the rooms, I understand, are no bigger than what we enjoyed at the Travelodge, and we appreciated the value.

This is one of the less expensive hotels around the Disneyland district. We booked it due to good reviews and the fact that we knew we wouldn't be in our room much as we planned on being at Disneyland from open until close, so just wanted something clean and comfortable within walking distance to Disney. We didn't expect a lot but were pleasantly surprised! The hotel is basic but clean. The beds were very comfortable and the air conditioner worked great which was important as it was in the high 30's (near 100F) while we were there in September. The reception staff were friendly and helpful, giving us a card with walking directions to Disney on it, however, we discovered an even quicker way there. Walking across the road, through the Mickey and Friends car park, directly to the

Summary Heading: Was a good place to sleep
Summary: Other then the hotel phone not working having to walk to the office to get more towels and the TV remote missing, everything was ok. And over a safe place to stay.

An ideal place for Disneyland. Clean tidy but not modern. Staff were beyond helpful which was greatly appreciated. Would definitely stay there again.  Fireworks can be seen every night. They are loud but absolutely spectacular.

Summary Heading: The carpet was soaked near the air conditioning unit when...
Summary: The carpet was soaked near the air conditioning unit when we got there. Almost none of the electric outlets had power including the one for hair  dryer and coffee maker. We had 2   adults needing to charge phones. If we were staying more than one night we would have complained.

Overall very good experience.  Staff was friendly and helpful.  Breakfast was good, but very busy for staff to keep up with food items.  WIFI was very poor at end of main building.  Very hard to log on, indicated at one time that there was no available space to connect, very, very slow when finally did connect at end of second day.

Summary Heading: Inexpensive hotel walking distance to Disneyland
Summary: The room was fine. The mini fridge was too cold though and froze any food you put inside it. The outlets were a bit wonky. The bed was comfortable. Breakfast is alright. They had waffles, toast, bagels, danish, juice, and some fruit. The wi-fi connection was horrible and we never got it to work. We were able to walk to the parks in around 20 minutes. You can also walk to the shuttle at the parking garage, but this doesn't really save you much time. The hotel is almost directly behind Disneyland so be prepared to hear the fireworks show.

This is definitely a value hotel and you get what you pay for. Biggest issue was that the parking spaces were pretty tight. We had 2 vehicles for a group of 6. We stayed 4 days and when we left we both had scratches on our cars from other people scraping them when they parked, plus door dings!  The next thing I had a problem with was the gap under the door. We stayed in room 106 and the gap under the door was literally big enough I could put my fingers under it. It let in a lot of light and noise and bugs could definitely get under there though I only saw ants.  The free breakfast was lacking as well. Usually there is an option of fruit or yogurt or something but the options were carbs. Bread, bagels, pastries, and waffles. They did have bananas but they were cut up and soaking
Stayed here while visiting Disneyland with family.  Walking distance to parking tram.  Room was clean.  Furniture dated. We were only there to sleep so it was fine.
Close to Disneyland, good price, clean. The breakfast and wifi were lacking but not very important to my stay.
Good value most of the time depending on the time of the year.  The rooms are clean and quiet and the staff is very accommodating and interested in assuring that your stay is a good one.

Summary Heading: While the hotel was in a great location (walking distance...
Summary: While the hotel was in a great location (walking distance to Disneyland), we were very disappointed by how outdated the rooms were. The rooms are definitely in need of some remodeling!

The hotel was in need of updating pictures depicted on the website aren't exactly as expected. The staff I had personal dealings with was a little unprofessional in my opinion. They have some cleaning up to do, whether I stay there again or not is questionable.

This hotel was fantastic for the price!!  Super clean and comfy beds! Nice pool and adequate breakfast!   But beware, it is NOT close to the parks, especially if you have young ones or handicap in anyway, the walk killed my back before we even got to the parks.

Summary Heading: Location and staff are the only reasons to stay here!
Summary: If, for no other reason, you decide to stay here, it will be because of the staff and location. The property is not clean, and I'm not talking being able to eat of the floor clean.  Upon check in, the room was as clean as a persons house when they just can't stand to not clean anymore.  No vacuuming had been done in between me and the previous guest.  We found allergy medicine, vitamins, and wrappers on the floor in between and under the beds.  Then, came the blood curdling scream from my 16 year old daughter in the bathroom.  Yup, a big, fat, juicy cockroach crawling on the toilet!  I am by no means a neat freak, I clean my house once every two weeks but this is different.  And I am a realist; I know I booked a two star motel but still....

waited 10 min for someone to come check us in at 1230 am banged on the window rang the door bell and called five times she was apparently sleeping cause she walked in frantic and had to put her glasses on it was ridiculous and we were tired from being at disneyland and just wanted to sleep

Cheap and so close to Disneyland. You can see the fireworks from the hotel. The breakfast is very basic, but how much do you need if you are going to spend the day at Disneyland? The service station next door is quite handy.

The hotel was inexpensive as expected with no frills.  The walk to the Disney trams was 5 minutes and the fireworks from the hotel were awesome!  Our room was not very clean.  A black light should NEVER be in a hotel room as it showed dirty spots on the sheets.  Ewwww!!!  There were 4 of us staying in the room and we were never left enough face cloths and hand towels even after asking.  No towels for the pool either unless we asked.  The breakfast was very minimal, but that was expected.  The desk staff did not give us good directions to Disney nor good information about the bus to Knott's Berry Farm.  They did let us use the computer to print some tickets.  No restaurants anywhere close by.  Overall it was a cheaper hotel just to stay at, expectations were low so it was fine.

Summary Heading: first off when we open the door there was a ball of hair on...
Summary: first off when we open the door there was a ball of hair on the floor and then in the bathroom on the so call clean towels there was also some loose hairs. When we took off the top blanket and the sheets had some large stains that were disguessed.  We did get clean sheets. When we ask to speak to the manager the front desk clerk said the manager well be coming in the morning around 10:00am.  When we came down to speak to the manager he or she was not in yet. Never talk to a manager,  When we got home we called for 2 weeks and kept getting the run around. So we never speak to a manager and we well never stay at that Travelodge Inn again

Summary Heading: Good price for a few night
Summary: No it wasn't the ritz Carlton but for the price and the assecablity to things and everything it was very nice.  The front desk will take care of your problems if you had one.  The breakfeast is enough  to get you to the next meal.  All in all it was pretty good for the amount paid for and what we needed it for.

The rooms are old but clean. I had the room with 2 queen beds, sofa bed and patio over looking the pool. HUGE room and patio. It would be nicer if the bathroom was bigger (even if it took some space from the room, that's how big it was). Even though rooms here are old, they were clean and staff is nice. Carpet was a little sticky, I kept socks on the whole time.

I stayed here this week to take my grandson to DisneyLand 😊 When we first got there we could see It is an older Inn and is not very fancy, but the price is right! On the second day there I noticed a blue light, it worked, and if I wanted I could fully investigate the cleanliness of the bedding, floors, and counters. This is comforting with all the nasty news available on how unhygienic many lodges can be.  We did not spend much time in the room, but we had a good sleep when we got to our home away from home. TV worked, water worked, room was cleaned everyday without having to ask. We tried the free continental breakfast on the last day and it was a simple layout of choices, with raisin bran and frosted flakes cereal, assorted bagels, breads for toast, OJ and apple juice,

The room was clean but the shower water was bothersome.  When I took a shower the water temperature kept fluctuating hot and cold. Had a hard time to adjusting the water temperature while taking a shower. Towels were not soft, hard and rough.  Bathroom hook on the back of the door was TOOOO high to reach to hang clothes. Also for some reason there was a puddle of water on the floor near the tub.  The curtains were in the tub while taking a shower.  Curtains maybe possible old and soaks up water and leaks.  Parking was not accessable.  Noticed people park in the hotel parking lot and walking away from the hotel.  Not sure if they were guests, that leads to me that when i came back from Disneyland there was no parking or parking space big enough for my van.  Need more parking

Although this property was older it was perfect for what we needed during our stay.  The free internet was a nice surprise and the Beary Bites breakfast was adequate.  The hot tub water was lukewarm with little bubbles.

Decent breakfast, cereal containers looked like they could use a good scrubbing, need more fruit options, not just miniature apples. Room was spacious and clean.  Close proximity to Disneyland Resort,  but on the far northwest side of the property and therefore arguably not as convenient as staying on "Hotel Row" on the eastern border of the main entrance. Had a slight, and ultimately temporary issue with shower water temperature,  and the manager was quick to respond and come up with a couple alternatives.  Stay here, it's fine, you're spending all your time at the parks anyways, right?  Don't pay for the Travelodge and expect the Ritz, and you'll be okay.

Summary Heading: Excellent options for a budget stay while enjoying Disneyland
Summary: The best option for a budget stay targeting for Disneyland. We reserved  two nights - to enjoy a full day at the park. our 2 queen room was big, had a MW, refrigerator and a good quality of WIFI. Bath room and mattresses quality was good. Breakfast was too continental, but free. The staff was very friendly and assist us with every issue. Parking was free, and it is about 10 minute calm walk from Disney tram. the later facts are highly important for us - as we could enjoy the park from 8:00am till midnight. BTW, on the night of our arrival we could watch a spectacular play of Disneyland fireworks! and the price was great! Highly recommended - Don't miss

The room felt a little dirty, no bugs or anything but the carpet was really dirty! It was a very old hotel... And the lighting was weird! The staff was very nice... I just felt like I couldn't walk on the carpet without socks or shoes! Also was a big Booger on the wall witch grossed me out from the start... Over all I wouldn't stay again be its not that bad if you don't care about feeling dirty

Summary Heading: Breakfast could have been better. Not all rooms had a safe...
Summary: Breakfast could have been better. Not all rooms had a safe. Room was clean and a good deal for the price.
Close to Disneyland. No shuttle. Clean room. Very spacious. The bathroom was a little tight. Staff professional and friendly.

Summary Heading: Hotel is clean and it is very near and walk-able distance...
Summary: Hotel is clean and it is very near and walk-able distance to the Disneyland parking lot(Mickey & Friends lot).You can save $17/day parking if you are visiting Disney parks ! I am happy with the breakfast that has been provided in the hotel.Front desk is very helpful in answering any questions !I would strongly recommend this hotel if someone what to visit Disney parks.

the location of the hotel was good close to Disneyland resort breakfast room small and breakfast minimal ie cereal, toast, bagels, waffles, juice, tea and coffee room had microwave and fridge and TV but no safe deposit box there is a swimming pool small and refreshing could not get wifi in the room no coffee jug had to use cup

Summary Heading: Great view of fireworks at Disneyland!
Summary: This hotel was just fine for our visit to Disneyland.  The room was very clean.  The TV was the new flat screen kind and worked very well.  We could see the fireworks at Disneyland every night from right outside our room. (we requested a room on the back side of the hotel so we could see them.)  The air conditioning worked great.  It's an older hotel, but the room had been nicely remodeled.  We love that the sink and big long counter is outside of the bathroom so it could be used while someone was occupying the bathroom.  Our only complaint was that the WiFi internet was very slow and reception very spotty in the room which made using our laptop computers a little difficult.  But overall we had a good experience at this hotel!  We did think it was a little too expensive for how

The location is great,  you are a little less than a miles walk from Disneyland. There were cockroaches along the side walks and in the parking lots, but none inside.  The room was clean and spacious. Our room had a balcony that overlooked the pool, that was a nice bonus. It also had stars on the ceiling,  which the kids loved.  The kids enjoyed the pool and "hot" tub. The hot tub was colder than I care for,  but our vacation was for the kids,  so it was ok.  The free breakfast was dissapointing. It was over crowded and not a lot to choose from. There is an am/pm right next door with better choices.

Summary Heading: Older property. It was clean but could use an update. Close...
Summary: Older property. It was clean but could use an update. Close walking distance to Disney. Worked great for what we needed.  Very limited breakfast.

Got the handicapped room which was larger to accommodate wheelchair in shower/ no tub and the room was smelly but we could open all the windows and bought Lysol!  Bed was comfortable! Breakfast area insufficient for crowd!! Never got more towels...
Hotel is very outdated...carpet was extremely dirty. .my kids feet were black by walking on it..microwave and refrigerator very old.air conditioner was not cooling room at all.

We arrived early from the airport and the wonderful desk clerk tagged our luggage and stored in a back room of the office.  We were then allowed to hang out at the pool until our room was ready.  Breakfast was great.  The staff who worked to keep things stocked was always smiling even though she was going non-stop to keep up.  The location was good, just a short walk to the parking structure and then up and down to get to the tram.  It worked really well for our visit.

We stayed one night at the Travelodge. It was what we expected - clean room, very average. We were able to walk to Dosneyland, 20 minute walk. The only negative was the shower. It really never got hot. Overall, average room for a reasonable price?

Summary Heading: I am surprised by your email to find out this was a Wyndham...
Summary: I am surprised by your email to find out this was a Wyndham property. This hotel was pretty terrible. I guess, as they always say, you get what you pay for. We tried to book a new hotel room and leave upon entry to our room, but at the height of summer, everything was either booked, or well over $300 a night.  Upon entering the hotel for check-in, we noticed the hotel was already run down, paint chipped, decades old carpet, worn down and damaged signs. Staff seemed friendly enough.  Getting to our room we noticed a used band-aid on the astroturf around the stairs. We stayed at this hotel for 4 days and sure enough, the band-aid did too.  The room was run down. Worn off and peeled off paint. A tilting bathroom vanity, a tissue dispenser that popped off when i grabbed a tissue,

disgusting room, not taken care of by any means. non smoking room that smelt like smoke. dirty carpet, floors, and bathroom sink. door hinges looked like it had been modified or pushed in a few times.

Our room was spacious and very conveniently located for Disneyland - just a 20 minute walk from the entrance. There is a nice pool and the breakfasts are good. Unfortunately the room was quite outdated, very dark and not especially clean.  The air conditioning was extremely loud, as was the fridge - loud enough to wake people during the night. The toilet became blocked and we were given a plunger and told that no-one was available to fix it. The Wifi was very poor. We would probably look for another hotel in future.
Walking distance to the free shuttle from the Disneyland parking garage to the park. Clean room, lots of space but could use some upgrades. Staff was courteous.

this hotel was the only available on short notice overall was pretty decent hotel breakfast was ok, rooms were pretty clean and seem like they have been updated about a 15-20 min walk to Downtown Disney

NQQ1 rooms were nice and quite large. Pleasant stay except for loud guests in room above us at 2-3am. Called front desk and they handled the situation promptly. Didn't have disturbances rest of night.

Nice room with microwave, refrigerator, and coffee. It had good access to Disneyland, by either walking to the Disneyland garage ( about 2 blocks, to second floor stairs, and down escalator to tram ), or around the north end of the motel to Disneyland drive using the center lane, and drive in. There also is a small gas station store to the east.

Stayed here on a solo trip to Disneyland.  It was cheap, and I got what I paid for.  The location was an easy walk to the Disney trams.  I didn't spend much time in the room so the quality of the room wasn't an issue.  The glow in the dark stars on the ceiling and the blacklight were a weird touch I wasn't expecting.  Breakfast was a hot mess.  Too many people, too small a space, and zero protein.
Good location fairly short walk to the tram to downtown Disney. Room was clean. However, needs updating. Not much Hot water could use a larger capacity heater. Overall average value.

I was happy with location and room setting but the floors were disgusting! My feet are clean I have perfect clean feet and after walking bare foot on the floor my whole foot was black as if I walked outside on the road! I was disgusted the whole time I wore socks to take off when I got into my bed and my white socks were completely black from the bottom. Please clean your floors. Immediately after stepping out of the shower and then walking on filth makes you feel disgusted!

The staff were very nice and the hotel was average. The drawbacks were that the towels had stains and the a/c barely cooled the room.The pluses were that it was super close to Disneyland, the room was clean, and the beds were comfy. Overall it was worth the price for our one night stay.
When in need of a comfortable bed, clean room, and Coventry location, this is the place. Family being bound to a wheelchair, they are very accommodating.

Breakfast OK. Rooms were fair. Older style but clean, beds comfortable. The thing that makes this place special is that it is in walking distance to Disneyland tram. A half block walk across the street and through the employee lot. A little treat is you can sleep under the stars with the black light trick. Desk employees very nice and helpful.
Hotel was okay, not top of the line but at least we had comfortable bed to sleep in.  Pillows are way too high.  WiFi really bad.  Hard to connect and stay on it.

I was very pleased with the cost and location of this hotel.  The room was satisfactory kind of small for a family, as fold out couch was right up next to one of the two beds.  The carpet was sticky and left the children's feet black when they walked on it.  Parking was terrible.  I made the reservation stating I needed two beds and fold out couch.  When I got there I was told I only had two beds in the room.  I asked if they had roll out beds and the answer was yes at additional 10.00 a night.  I asked if they had another room with the fold out couch and was told yes and it was additional 10.00 a night, which I accepted.  I would consider staying there again if I was planning another trip to Disney land.

Me and my wife normally stay here with my 2 kids and we love this place. We have our Disney annual passes so we stay frequently, out of many hotels we've stayed at this one is by far the best and is always our first choices. One of my kids favorites features is the starry night effects this hotel has in each of the rooms helps with the whole "Disney Magic" feeling.
Clean rooms. Clean pool and jacuzzi.  Excellent value! Within easy walking distance to Disneyland. Breakfast was very light with no protein.

Ok I get you pay for what you get.  The place is oldish, and smacks of the 80s at times but once you get past that first part the place is fantastic.    First of all super close to Disneyland, a  short short walk and you are there.  The staff is super friendly,  and the free breakfast is good too! Best part of me is that the ac gets the room super cold! !! I love it cold and normally I get roasted out.  If the wife asks me to get up and turn it down in the middle of the night because she can't get warm I'm a happy guy.
I had a great time with my son and walked to Disneyland to save gas. Clean and nice roms and great tasting breakfast.

Stayed three nights - the room was clean, very basic, although we didn't have enough towels for all of us and I had to go and ask for more.  No amenities to really speak of, but not surprising either.  Hotel staff was courteous but not friendly.  I asked if a visitor would be able to park their vehicle in their parking lot while visiting us and we were told it would be no problem as long as the visitor notified them when he arrived.  We made sure to do that, however the staff was rude to our guest and that was a great disappointment.  Breakfast was terrible.  I've had "continental breakfasts" (read no eggs or meats) before, but dried bagels and pastries with cold cereal? No thanks.  The only half-way decent breakfast item was waffles you made yourself.  One morning I came across

Summary Heading: Perfect location for Disneyland. Room was clean and the...
Summary: Perfect location for Disneyland. Room was clean and the service good. The breakfast could be improved.
Hotel is nice and clean.  It's not new however in managable shape.  It's easy for me to switch from a king bed to another 2 beds room.  Nice and clean swiming pool and hot tub.  Friendly service.

Summary Heading: Great location. Helpful and friendly front desk staff.We...
Summary: Great location. Helpful and friendly front desk staff. We stayed in a room with two queen beds - room appearance,etc disappointing. We've previously stayed at Travelodge Santa Monica which was excellent value from room decor,breakfast,service,etc. - hence chose to stay at Travelodge Anaheim.Pretty disappointed with travel Lodge Anaheim.
Everything was great But you didnt keep us with enough towels,we always had to ask for more,But the rest of your service was great!

I stayed at this property before last year and it is the same as I remember it. I booked the room with the hotel directly and the guy who took my reservation didn't put the correct information on my stay with the number of adults/children which isn't a big deal to me but I know from working at a hotel that it is important to know the number of people in the rooms. I had requested my rooms next to eachother, which they did give us and the same rooms I had last year. However I did also request an early check in around 12-1230 since we were driving all the way from Vallejo (near San Francisco) and needed to relax and put our bags away to go to Disneyland, but when I called to confirm when we were almost there the desk told us we couldn't check in until 2pm. I would understand on
I was very happy with the room. Enjoyed my time in the Jacuzzi. The biggest reason for staying there was the reasonable price for being in walking distance  of Disneyland.
Simple and nice. Super close to Disneyland also which is great! It was literally a minute drive. The beds are extremely comfortable as well.

I stayed here for the weekend with my family to visit relatives and Dysneyland,  both within walking distance.  It was well worth the stay. We checked in and relaxed at the pool after a 6 hr. Drive. We were left alone, not bothered by staff nor other guests. The room was comfortable and clean. I will be returning in August.

Hotel is in a great location (right next to Disneyland) the Hotel itself is ok with a pool (which the kids loved) the breakfast promised was not that good though, which you have to serve yourself. Otherwise you get your money's worth with this hotel

The room had a strong pinesole smell, which was OK. However, the rug was sticky, the bed had hair in the sheets, and cover blanket. Bathroom had dirty towels, mold on the ceiling, and hair. Paid $ to be unsatisfied with my room.

Summary Heading: Good relative value for a wornout hotel
Summary: The staff and service was excellent, the food was adequate (cereal, waffles, toast, pastries, milk/juice), the hotel rooms are in various states of up keep, the internet connection was unusable. One room had a non functional refrigerator, another had the safe missing, and a third had a falling apart water logged A/C unit. The best things about this hotel was the service and staff, value (up to 6 occupancy per room), followed by its location which has easy pedestrian access through the employee parking lot to the Mickey & Friends tram (about 4 blocks total, west on Ball street, then south on Southwest Place through employee parking lot, up one flight on parking deck, Daisy Duck, then through structure, down escalator to the tram) saving $17 per day on parking. The problem with
Rooms are dirty and appearance is rather slummy but location is excellent so we stayed. Customer service is also great, they take care of you. Just wish the property was in good shape.

Upon arrival the front desk clerk told us we requested the top floor of the hotel but that the room they were going to give us was on the bottom floor. He wasn't very friendly and rushed me out. The room didn't look as nice as the pictures online. It was ok, average. Beds were not that comfortable. The pool area was pretty and had a nice hottub. Breakfast definitely needs to be upgraded...it was a joke! Wifi wouldnt let us on because it was too full apparently? And they need to offer some sort of transportation to the Disney Parks.
It was a good time.  The hotel was comparable to others in the area.  The only complaint that we would have was that the faucet needed to be replaced.

My girlfriend and I stayed at the Travelodge on a disney vacation. The room was very nice. Our arrival flight arrived pretty late, but late check-in was very easy.   The hotel is maybe a 10 minute walk away from the front gate of disneyland. There is a pathway that takes you directly there. All street crossings have elaborate and safe crosswalks.  I would definitely recommend the Travelodge for a trip to Disneyland.  The only thing that was not ideal was the continental breakfast. It was just coffee, juice, and bagels/toast. This was the only shortcoming in an otherwise great stay.

Summary Heading: Good customer service. Walking distance to Disneyland
Summary: Comfortable and affordable. 10 minute walk to Mickey and Friends Tram. Good for families with small children. Plenty of free parking and let us keep vehicles in lot after check out so we could enjoy downtown disney. Need more washcloths in room. Great service at front desk, would stay here again.

Although this hotel is old and showing it's age, it is actually within easy walking distance to the Disney tram.  The carpet was worn and uneven, the toilet continued flushing slightly and the shower head left something to be desired but the room was clean and seemed freshly painted.  The beds were comfortable and seemed fairly new.  We would stay here again.

We loved this hotel! It was in pretty good shape (obviously no Marriott or anything), but for the price and location, my husband and I will stay there every time we go to Disneyland! The breakfast was good and it's within walking distance. The rooms were great too! We loved it!

There are no frills but its not horrible. If you are on a budget, then this place works. Its close to Disneyland, walking distance from the parking garage (enter near Cast Member Parking and its a much quicker walk but there is no wheelchair or stroller access to the 2nd level, which you need to get on to cross over the road vehicle enter the parking garage from).

When you go to disneyland here is where you want to stay, the hotel is half mile to main gate wich means you can go walking, or even better years ago you can enter trough the employee parking lot wich is just crossing the street. The hotel offers free breakfast, free wi fi, friendly staff and is very clean and nice. Without paying the high prices of any maingate hotel

This was a very nice hotel with a great staff.  The Hotel is within walking distance to the tram parking garage or even a walk to downtown Disney.  The breakfast was very nice and filling.  There was plenty to go around.  We would stay here again for sure.

Summary Heading: Quick access by car to Disneyland
Summary: Pros: I really like this location due to easy access to and from Freeway, also to and from Disneyland parking structure. Love the microwave and refrigerater.  Cons: No pets, no fitness room. Also if window is close to the road you do hear the traffic
very clean and quiet..    :)

I have stayed here several times as it is very close to disneyland and is usually reasonably priced. It does show its age but is very clean and the staff is great. The free breakfast in the morning is decent. At night the ceiling displays a starry night sky when the lights are turned off which the kids love.
Good place to stay close to Disneyland and Knotts Berry farm. Good price, overall clean. Carpets in room has sticky stuff on them. Beds were comfortable.

Summary Heading: We just planned for a weekend stay and it was pretty good...
Summary: We just planned for a weekend stay and it was pretty good. The staff was nice and it was a great distance from Disneyland so we could walk there. The room was clean but it had the same smell when they just clean a public bathroom....its clean but funky smelling.We bought some air freshener and it was fine after that. One thing that was upsetting was their breakfast...it would be better if you went out to eat somewhere. There wasn't much variety of food, mostly bread. The only fruit they had was chopped up bananas with strawberries in syrup and they had only a few cups of waffle batter so you can make your own waffles. Overall it wasn't too bad.

This hotel and staff were amazing for my husbands and I recent getaway. After a extremely horrible almost desaster of a stay with the Ramada South (motel) we were very happy and surprised with the clean, nicely furnished and whimsical room that included pics of Mickey & Minnie and our ceiling that sparkled when the lights turned off. The continental breakfast was as expected and the free WiFi a little ify, but otherwise great, since our short brisk walk to get on the tram to Disneyland park was only a 10 min. walk away and the midweek AARP room rate made this vacation inexpensive, enjoyable, and Amazing. Can't wait to come back again to visit soon from Vegas.... Great place and worth the money. 😀
We enjoyed our stay, friendly,  helpful staff, clean rooms, comfortable beds.  The kids and i both loved the uniqueness of the night scape painted  on the ceiling with a black light to let them shine

Summary Heading: I would not recommend this hotel.
Summary: The room was very dark, it was very difficult to see in the closet. The internet didn't work at all. The bathroom smelled like pee and the water took about 5 minutes to heat up. One of the days we didn't receive towels at all.

We needed to stay in Anaheim a few more days and this we all we could find last min at a decent price. I was disappointed from the first phone call when they couldn't tell us the best way to get there from Disneyland besides "take a cab". That's the area they serve, the should be able to give that information. The lobby seating was stained when we arrived which did not give me high hopes for the room. However the room was clean, although very run down, as was the rest of the hotel. The neighborhood around the hotel was a little scary sirens night and day. No easy access to Disneyland without taking some sort of tram or bus. Also one day we forgot to take the do not disturb sign off the door and they refused to send someone up with the coffee for the machine. If we wanted it we

The hair dryer caught fire in my hand. The bathroom light was flickering badly to the point we couldn't have it on. The air conditioner didn't work good at all. It was so muggy and miserable in the room. We told the front desk about it all. They replaced the hair dryer and light but nothing was done about the air conditioner.

The room I reserved was a king room... I was alone with my daughter so I was nervous about staying in the back so far from the office but it was really nice... The room was very spacious and the bed more than comfortable. Our trip to Disneyland was perfect. The staff is very helpful, especially the lady in the breakfast area. Will definitely be back
I choose this hotel because of the pool and it was closed all the time the breakfast area it was duty all the time
Breakfast was awful!!!  The windows didn´t have any curtains!!!! Our room 336 stank like piss!!! Not a nice stay!!!! I would not recommend this hotel ever!!!!!!

We've stayed at this before and loved the fact it is close to Disneyland.  everything was fine this trip except for one thing, we could not find the guide for the TV channels we wanted.  We did see other channels from around the world.

Summary Heading: Clean, comfortable & walking distance to Disneyland!
Summary: This is an older hotel however very clean, comfy beds and it was great that it's about a 5 minute walk to the Disneyland tram. Breakfast was limited but it is FREE...Always had a nice clean room made up to come back to. Only complaint is my whole group had trouble connecting to the free Wi-Fi.

Me and some friends stayed here and we loved it. Breakfast was decent. The staff was so friendly. Our room was clean and roomy. We spent most our days in the park and took a cab back for about $10 well worth it after a long day. I will definitely stay here again!

Close to Disney, the I-5 freeway,and reasonably  priced, my family and I were pleasantly surprised  at how clean the rooms were maintained. Check out the night sky ceiling!  Continental breakfast consisted of the usual light fare and several waffle makers with handy premeasured batter.  Staff was courteous and attentive.  I would definitely stay here again if ever I return.

Summary Heading: The room should be cleaner and overall remodeled. And the...
Summary: The room should be cleaner and overall remodeled. And the towels should be larger and newer. For the amount that I paid it is not worth it.

Summary Heading: Great stay for a large school group!
Summary: The rooms were clean, everything was ready when we arrived.  Staff was friendly and helpful.  Our students would have liked to have a choice of hard boiled eggs or yogurt or some type of protein with breakfast.  I would book this hotel again for our large group or personally.  The kids loved the pool too!

Life's twists and turns finally took me to Disneyland - despite my general lack of interest. The group I was with booked this hotel and I found myself pleased that it was much better than I anticipated. SUPER close to Disneyland so you can walk there and back easily. I enjoyed a room opening up to the walkway just above the pool. But those walkways are full of kids early in the morning, bouncing to breakfast so they could go get their Mickey Mouse ears...

We have been to Disney a lot and were completely surprised by how great this hotel was. Staff was over the top accommodating. The view of the fireworks is better than you get in the park. The walk to the trams is faster than anywhere else we have stayed. Gas station next door. Breakfast had lots of options (although some protein would have been nice.) Seriously our experience was exceptional and we would totally stay here again and again.

Stayed for a week leading into returning home to Australia we had 2 queens and a sofa bed, room was large, on arrival room wasn't ready (we were early), which was fine but found front desk staff to be not very friendly, however this was the only time. 5-10 min walk to Disney via mickey and friends tram at the parking lot. Service station next door for basic food etc if required. Walmart and target around 5 mins by car. Room was clean and comfortable beds good, for size of the room found bathroom to be a little small but adequate. They kept only leaving 4 towels when we had 5 staying, which was a hassle but not the end of the world as they would give more when requested. Also they don't have pool towels so you use your bathroom towels so you really end up needing 2x the amount of

We stayed 4 nights here, overall it was a nice hotel and we stayed on the 3rd floor in room 310 (it faced west) I'm normally not a nit picky person, but the handle to the faucet seemed it needed to be replaced, the outlet right by the door as you walked in needed to be replaced.  My kids enjoyed the stay so that's all that mattered, continental breakfast was okay it had your usual (waffle, cereal, bread to make toast, fruit, pastry, orange & apple juice, coffee) you need to get there early or else your not going to get much (breakfast runs from 6:30-9:30).    Loved how close it was to Disneyland, (Disneyland fireworks are at 9:30 pm everyday) it is walking distance which we saved $20 from parking,  I did hear you can walk through the parking garage to access the Tram, but we
Great hotel, close to Disneyland, exceptional service, and beautiful rooms! The rooms are georgeous inside and very comfortable. Loved my stay like all the other times. I recommend it to anyone!

I won't be staying at this hotel again..it was me my daughter and a friend..when we were checking in at the lobby their was a prostitute checking then when we were entering our room on the 2nd floor we looked over and their was a guy getting stoned in the parking structure. There was no hot water  and the rooms are very outdated and the bedding is nothing you'd want to sleep on!

I thought this was a great hotel for the price and location.  If we wanted a better hotel experience, we would have had to pay more. The breakfast was nice, but always the same and we stayed 7 days, so some deviation (besides two types of cereal) would have been nice.  The rooms were clean and maintained.  The housekeeping was great.  The hotel is older, but works for those who want to save $.  We were able to see the fireworks in the pool PERFECTLY!

It's was nice however the breakfast was not very good and the room was very small. Not very comfortable for my family. The room picture that was shown to us was not even close to the room we received.
Private but close to freeways lovely pool friendly staff, I really enjoyed it. Boyfriend thought it was perfect too. Very spacious rooms vanity was beautiful fridge microwave tv. All were enjoyable.

Stayed close to the park without the big crowd and our hotel was excellent from free hot breakfast to the clean room and pool. My kids loved it and so did my wife. Happy wife happy life thanks again for the great stay

We really enjoyed this room and will be certain to use the hotel again. We reserved the room for two nights while we celebrated out anniversary at Disneyland. If you are a member of NRA, you'll enjoy the member rate here.

Travelodge Inn and Suites was perfect for our family of six.    What we liked: 1. Location:  Are there closer motels to Disneyland?  Yes, but all the other motels that were closer to Disneyland were substantially more expensive... (at least when we were looking to sleep 6 people) especially when staying for 4 nights as we did.  As others have mentioned, to get to Disneyland, walk west down Ball to Flore St./Southwest Pl to get to the trams.  It is  shorter than the Disneyland Dr.  route.  The walk to the trams was about 7 or 8 minutes, through a couple of smaller parking lots and through the second level of the huge Mickey and Friends parking garage.  The walk to the trams was probably only very slightly longer than those who paid to park in the garage and ended up parking at

Summary Heading: Rooms were clean and nice, although the room with 2 queens...
Summary: Rooms were clean and nice, although the room with 2 queens and fold out couch was a bit crowded with bed pulled out.  Breakfast was sufficient but they did not refill the fruit or sweet rolls.  If you didn't get there early, foget it.  Staff was pleasant and efficient!

This hotel is always clean and well kept. The only difficulty I find is sometimes it's hard to park as their garage is a little outdated and it's a tight squeeze for larger cars. Luckily this last trip went well, but in January we stayed there & my daughter had a fever & threw up all over the roll away we got for her. We called the front desk and they were very quick to come to our room with fresh bedding & help us clean it up- which went above & beyond their call of duty- believe me. Also, their breakfast is more than just danishes like many of the hotels in the area that include "free breakfast". It's no Denny's or anything, but they have waffles, toast, cereal, danishes & a variety of coffee, milk & juices. It's a decent spread for as affordable as this hotel is. They are

Overall this hotel is good for what it is, a place to stay.  It is a decent walk from the tram (about 10 min) if you follow the "approved" route, if you go through the employee parking lot, its much less.  During my stay if you didn't get to breakfast once it opened, it was picked clean.  I can't fault them really for that, just something to be aware of.
Good location for price bed was a little hard, everything was clean and the black light that showed the milky way on the ceiling was a nice touch

Summary Heading: Great location.  Rooms clean but LOUD!
Summary: Could not ask for a better location within easy walking distance of Disneyland & California Adventure.  Rooms were clean, but very loud.  We could hear everything going on outside our door and in the rooms above/beside us. Every step, every door shut, every voice.  Breakfast room could use a bit more staffing, cleaning and overall attention.  Fine when you get there at 6:30, but a madhouse at 8:00.

We arrived before check-in and were able to leave our car on site while we visited Disneyland on Day 1 of our trip- very accommodating. We stayed four nights and found the room comfortable and clean. The pillows seemed new, the AC worked well (although a tad noisy), and the breakfasts were decent enough for the price. Tip on the breakfasts- figure out the waffle iron early and bring your own cutlery unless you're okay with mini plastic forks and knives!  The pool and hot-tub were clean and fun to swim and soak in. The staff were all friendly and helpful.   To get to the Park the easiest route is to walk through the parking lot on Flore Street, across the second level of the parkade to the Disney tram-a five minute walk.  I would definitely stay at this hotel again!

Worst stay in a hotel EVER. Roaches, blood stains on sheets, hair on sheets, toilet wouldn't flush, dirty, dingy, hole in door, door alarm kept going off. Manager/owner REFUSED to talk to me, gave us lousy $40 discount.

Summary Heading: Long walk to tram on busy highway
Summary: Room fine, typical TravelLodge. Breakfast sparse, cream cheese smelled bad. Bed very comfortable &shower great. Sink slow to drain. Walk to tram half-mile on VERY busy highway, with no barricade or protection most of way, must cross busy highway 3x. Not for out-of-shape, elderly, handicapped, excited or small children unless restrained or in stroller. Very disappointed in this aspect as was main criteria for choosing this hotel over a more upscale hotel for same price a little further away. LONG checkout process; staff too busy & not all well-informed. We feel that price reflects location & that alone not enough to justify daily rate.
Good, reasonably priced motel that is about a 15 min walk from downtown Disney. They were able to get my 3 rooms together, two even connected. Nothing fancy, but we were very satisfied!

Summary Heading: Huge room, huge bath, great deal!
Summary: We loved the family suite! Huge with gigantic tub/shower. Nice breakfast. Walking distance to Disneyland tram. Great stay!

Summary Heading: We went to sleep each night with a black light produced...
Summary: We went to sleep each night with a black light produced ceiling galaxy which was magical. The Disney fireworks went off right outside our door every night. That was a wonderful surprise It was a great motel, great rates and right across from the Disneyland Park...

It's a great place for what i paid for. Super cost effective and the rooms were not bad. The beds were pretty comfortable for the price. They had breakfast available and it was OK. If you want to save some money on breakfast before you head to the park then you wouldn't mind eating there. We walked to the shuttle area of the Disneyland parking lot. Took us about 15 mins because we had kids with us. But we saved about 20 bucks for parking. The staff was friendly and helpful with questions i had. They advised the best way to get to the parking structure so that we can ride the tram.

We did have an incident with the room we were given BUT it was immediately taken care of.  Though there was construction going on at hotel, the earliest it began making noticeable noise was at 8:45 am.  TV had a few connection issues, but appreciate the variety of channels. Double beds were very comfortable, hide away bed was not.  Disneyland parking lot was extremely easy to access along with great freeway access. We will stay there again.
The hotel is clean and generally in good shape with slight signs of its age. Easy access to Disneyland. The staff is friendly, and the beds are comfortable.

The water smelled and tasted like rotten eggs/sulfer. I had to use bottled water to brush my teeth. My service dog wouldn't even drink the water. The chairs in the room had a ton of stains on them, carpet left my socks black, the microwave was extremely old and the TV cabinet wouldn't stay shut.
It was nice to find a motel close to Disneyland that was reasonably priced and clean.  The people at the front desk were friendly and very helpful.

Summary Heading: Ok Stay If On A Budget
Summary: This property was clean and had the same amenities as most motels in the area. The staff was pleasant and always available. We really liked the complimentary breakfast served in the breakfast room which included fruits, cereals, waffles, bagels and other pastries, and of course, coffee, juice and milk.   On the down side, the rooms appear outdated. I was particularly upset that I couldn't close the curtains. They only have a sheer curtain that is very see-through that closes. So, we had no privacy and no way to darken the room at night!   It is about .7 miles to Downtown Disney, so it is quite a hike to the parks.
