We were told by the motel staff that we could walk 15-20 minutes to the tram station, however, once you walk to the tram station, you are just a few minutes from the

The room was comfortable and big enough for 5 people. Quite,safe and Great location to Disney, easy to hop on to the freeway to head to Hollywood. Close to Anaheim plaza and the Orange oulets for shopping. Will definitely stay here again.

Stayed 1/22 - 1/26. The goal was to have a room to sleep in since our days were going to be spent at the parks.  The hotel is about a 15 minute walk to the tram, easy walk, area fine. You could walk all the way but probably about another 15+ minutes. Not bad at all, just remember how exhausted you will be at the end of the day and you do have to walk from the tram.  Ok hotel was fine for the price. Our room was clean, etc.  we had room 204 which when Disneyland did have the fireworks you could see them from the balcony which ended up being an extra bonus since the two nights we actually did Disneyland they cancelled them because of the wind so we did see them the one night.  We booked this hotel for price and the free breakfast which was fine, cereal, Danish, bagels, waffles,

I wasn't expecting the Hyatt but I expected the TV to work and clean not stained sheets on our bed. Also the shower head squirted every where but your body.The phone apparently didn't work so in order to get any service I had to use my cell phone or walk downstairs to the front desk . I did ask for extra pillows and towels they brought me an extra blanket and towels . So I had to call to see what happened with the pillows no answer. So I went down stairs to ask two hours later. By then they were out. So I was to happy. Continental breakfast was ok not to bad,but i don't think We will be going to the same hotel next time.

The location and price were easy enough to live with. But rooms 217 and 218 are directly above the housekeeping laundry area. This normally isn't a problem, unless you come back and nap in the middle of the day, but when the washing machine started going at 1 IN THE MORNING, I have an issue with that. Terrible.  Internet was spotty at best, and the pool and hot tub were closed half the days we were there. It's an easy walk (twenty minutes?) to the park though, which is great for the price.  But what hotel lets housekeeping do laundry at 1am?!?!!? Crazy.

We stayed for a single night and did not take advantage of any amenities (pool, breakfast, etc.)  Pros: - The location was convenient - right off the Disneyland Dr. exit from I5. Quick exit from parking lot right into Disneyland parking. - The room was spacious - we had two queens plus an unexpected fold-out sofa. - Beds were sufficiently comfortable - Room was equipped with a refrigerator  Cons: - The carpet was DIRTY! Our kids were running around the room for perhaps 20 minutes and jumped on the bed. We noticed the bottoms of their feet had become filthy. We wiped them down and kept our socks/shoes on after that. Left us uncomfortable with our choice until we left the next morning. - Its location to the park is next to the fireworks war zone - the cannons that launch the

Summary Heading: Liked the fact it was so close to Disney - very easy walk...
Summary: Liked the fact it was so close to Disney - very easy walk down the sidewalk. Ample parking on site at no additional charge.  Internet was a little challenging as it was at max users most of the time.

The hotel was clean.  A little outdated but met our needs.  The refrigerator was a bit loud, TV quite small.  Had family in from out of country so they needed something that would not break their checkbook.  This hotel offered convenience, great location for their plans, at an economical cost.  I would recommend it for anyone staying longer than a couple of days who is on a budget.

Perfect if you just want a comfy place to sleep. The hotel is older and in need of minor repairs in the bathroom. No light covers so you stare into a blinding lightbulb. Missing grout. Cracked toilet that didn't always flush well. Breakfast was carbs, and more carbs.   No protein. Day 1 there were green bananas and sticky apples. Day 2 no fruit. Day 3 sliced melons were available. Staff was very friendly and helpful! Gave easy directions, called a taxi for me (which arrived in about five minutes).

I stayed here for 3 nights for the sole purpose of visiting Disneyland and it was great, the rooms were clean and decently furnished, the breakfast was fine and the staff were very helpful. It is a short, simple walk from Disneyland about 20 minutes to the Downtown area. This is a great value hotel without compromising on the basics, planning on staying here again this summer.
Have stayed several times. Great location for short drive to tram parking lot for Disneyland. A walk to Downtown Disney takes about 20 minutes

Hotel was close to Disneyland parking garage / Downtown Disney.  Room was spacious, beds were comfortable.  Fridge and microwave were a little outdated, but still worked. Free breakfast was limited to cereal, pastries, and waffles.  However, breakfast room was full at times.    Housekeeping and staff were great. Only complaint was the cleaning products used to clean room left strong smell/odor which we had to air out or turn on fan.   Overall, good place to stay if you just need a place to sleep.
The service is great, the room had enought space for my family. The personal was helpful and discret.  However the Internet speed was low, but for a vacation it was not a big deal.
Our stay was alright but didn't get our roll a bed on the first night. When I made reservations i requested a roll a bed

when I stayed at the Travelodge the hotel was neat and clean it was very spacious for a week 1 queen size bedroom it had a great window view it was easily accessible and it was only a five minute walk to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: The motel was clean and comfortable.  The staff was...
Summary: The motel was clean and comfortable.  The staff was helpful.  Appreciated that the breakfast included Belguim waffells.

Summary Heading: Awesome little place for the price. We've stayed here...
Summary: Awesome little place for the price. We've stayed here before and will certainly come back! They offer clean rooms, big showers and comfy beds. Quiet parking lot with plenty of parking. Short walk from Downtown Disney. Although there could have been some fruit or something for breakfast, it was still good quality, especially considering it is complimentary. Overall, no complaints!
Perfect location for disneyland with a good breakfast included for the price. the room was a great size, very large. The staff were accommodating. It has a great view of the fireworks.

This room is comparable to it's affordability; clean, quiet, staff is courteous & helpful. The location is a hop, skip & a jump away from Disneyland. Less than 5 mins. away to be precise, & the breakfast was decent enough.

Granted it's the Travelodge and not the Ritz Carlton but we had a great stay. We got there early in the morning, and even though we couldn't check in ye,t the did give us a parking pass so we didn't have to spend the ridiculous parking fee Disneyland charges. Room was clean and comfortable. Check in/out was easy and the continental breakfast was good. A great plus is if you aren't going to stay at the park for the fireworks, you can see them great from the motel. BTW...don't do what we did and walk all the way to the park. The people at the front desk can tell you how to get to the Disney's parking structure and you can take their tram in from there. We'd stay there again.

i am very disappointed in the recent down fall of this hotel. This is the 6th time we've stayed and will never stay again. The rooms were gross- sticky, dirty carpets, holes and water stains in the roof, ear wigs in the bed and pee on our bathroom floor after being gone for the day. We will never stay here again and I will never refer this hotel to my family and friends again.

Summary Heading: Our stay at Travelodge was very enjoyable.  The three queen...
Summary: Our stay at Travelodge was very enjoyable.  The three queen beds in our room were perfect for our family of six staying there.
Nice and close to disneyland.  Continental breakfast was good.  But the room is small and not enough room to move around or sit.
This hotel was a step up from a budget hotel. The room was clean. The fridge did not work properly and our food was ruined. Staff was nice. 10 minute walk to Disneyland tram.

Summary Heading: Enjoyed our stay at this Travelodge near Disneyland...
Summary: Enjoyed our stay at this Travelodge near Disneyland.  Unfortunately the refrigerator wasn't working, but we didn't discover this until 1:30 am, so reported it on check-out.
Everyone was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was good and everything seemed to be kept very clean. The walk to Disneyland trams was easy and we had a wonderful time.

Summary Heading: Good for a quick trip to Disneyland
Summary: Perfect place to stay if you just need somewhere to crash the night before and/or after disneyland. Clean linens,  had fridge (that worked well!) and micro (the micro in our room, 217, was pretty ancient but the one in my sisters room was newer) comfortable beds and is in walking distance to the mickey and friends parking where you can take the trams into disneyland. However, do not follow the direction you get at the front desk to go to Disneyland!! Instead make a right out of the hotel parking lot and walk up to Flore st. and go left on it across the crosswalk. Walk all the way down the street to the employee parking lot, you will see signs that lead you to the tram. Once you reach the parking structure you have to take the stairs up to the 2nd level, walk to the front of the

We couldn't fault our stay here, we found the location to Disneyland parks and restaurants fantastic (about a 15min walk), the room and facilities were very clean and well presented - you also have the added bonus of microwave and fridge which we found extremely helpful with kids. Staff were friendly and very helpful no matter what the question and time.  We stayed in a double room with sofa bed for extra space for the kids. We found this hotel great value for money, family friendly and with the added bonus of breakfast including freshly made waffles!

Summary Heading: Stayed at this property for one night for a day at...
Summary: Stayed at this property for one night for a day at Disneyland.  The website says it is 1/2 mile to Disneyland/Tram.  The front desk gives you a card telling you to go left out of the hotel to the light and cross over and then walk to the tram.  By doing this you are half way to the Disneyland entrance, so we walked the rest of the way.  Other reviews mentioned that they walked through the employee parking lot which is a more direct way to get to the trams, so that afternoon we decided to give that route a try.  If you go out of the hotel parking lot to the right and cross the street at the light, you can see the employee parking lot which is behind the main Disney parking garage.  On the left of the entrance on the sidewalk is a painted sign that indicates "Walkway to Tram."

the room was clean, when i booked the room i had to get a smoking room. when we got there the front desk person said he could change it and gave us a non-smoking roo.  the breakfast room was clean and the breakfast was good. we also got to use the pool and spa. i would stay there again.

Summary Heading: The rooms on the side by the freeway were terrible but they...
Summary: The rooms on the side by the freeway were terrible but they switched us to a room on the inside and it was like night and day.  It was way better which I appreciate. Break fast wasnt that great but worked.

This motel was very clean.  It's a 5-10 minute easy walk to the trams to Disneyland.  The pool and spa were sparkling clean, and felt wonderful after a day at Disneyland.  The breakfast was adequate and filling.  It was a great value---parking was free!

This is an old hotel, the room felt lopsided and the carpet felt grimy, but the room seemed well cleante. I didn't expect much considering it was a last minute booking for us and that it was a Travelodge. I would stay here again if I did not have any other options. It would also be nice if a shuttle to Disneyland was offered.

Summary Heading: Your Review     The hotel was ok for the price. The check...
Summary: Your Review     The hotel was ok for the price. The check in desk had some great people and some that were rude. This hotel is a little confusing as far as walking to Disneyland. It looks closer on the map than it actually is. Overall this hotel is average.

Summary Heading: Stayed at Travelodge where you couldn't close the curtain...
Summary: Stayed at Travelodge where you couldn't close the curtain and NOT let the sun in when up.  Suggest it needs a curtain to NOT let in sun!!

Summary Heading: Great Location, no parking or elevator.
Summary: *Before you fall in love with the price and location, make sure you are aware that this hotel is 3 stories and there is not an elevator. Make sure you book a room on the first floor if you cannot go up stairs.  *Also, there is not enough parking! There are about 180 rooms and only about 50 parking spots. The hotel "accommodates" guests by providing you a parking pass to park at the Denny's next door. The annoying thing is you are on a one-way street, which requires you to drive down, u-turn, drive back, & u-turn. To make matters worse, you have to MOVE your car by 8 IN THE MORNING OR YOU WILL BE TOWED! So now, here you are, trying to find parking at midnight, and now you have to get up at 7 and pray to God that someone has left and that there is a spot for you. I pretty much got

I was really excited to stay here my aunty had stay the month before and side it was great stay! but when i got there tired from the crazy traffic off the 5 freeway as was not really welcome happily when I first walked in that put a damper on the rest of my day. the room was ok smelled like bleach, the Curtains dont close woke up to the bright sun, plus was not told that they where working on the pool and the time they started and the parking was very limited.

It's clean and reasonably priced for the location, but my beef is that one of the hotel desk clerks gave me the wrong directions to walk to the nearest Disneyland entrance.  As I intended only to drop off two persons from my car, I got stuck in the vehicle entrance queue causing a delay of about one-half hour.  The only reason to stay at this hotel is to visit Disneyland, so I would expect the desk clerks to be experts at directing guests to Disneyland.

My family has been staying at this hotel longer than its been a Travelodge property. It has recently gotten some improvements, however, in one respect its more of an updated issue than an update.  It looks like they are trying to save money by setting the air conditioners so they won't stay on. When we checked in, the room was quite warm due to the AC being off all day. We turned it on, as cool as it would go, and spent a very warm night not getting a good nights rest. I don't think the room temp got below 80 degrees.  I complained to the front desk the next morning. When we go back to the room the next evening, it was a little cooler, but it was obvious they didn't change the AC at all. The only reason it was cool r is that it was "on" all day.  If they are going to be chintzy

This was our first stay at this hotel and everything was as expected, although I was disappointed with our "starry ceiling" that was not so starry.  Call me silly, but that was one of the main reasons, aside from price, for me to pick the hotel.  From the photos I'd seen other reviewers post, I thought it'd be a nice, fun touch to the room.  Unfortunately, there were less than a handful that we could see.    The walking distance to downtown Disney was 15-20 minutes, which was as expected, and when we didn't feel like walking, we utilized the ART shuttle station across the street for a $6 ride to the front gates of Disneyland (the walk to the station was a max of 5 min).    The room was a little dated, but clean.  You could see through the top of doorknob on the bathroom door,

Overall the room was just fine for the price. NOT within comfortable walking distance of Disneyland but the parking structure is close. The free breakfast was sparse; no donuts, no bagels, no edible pastries, just time consuming  do-it-yourself pancakes, cereal and juice-we gave up after the first day. The refrigerator works fine--bring your own food. The beds were comfortable the linens were fresh the room was cleaned well everyday. The towels are old. We would bring our own towels next time.  The glow in the dark, UV ceiling art of the night sky was fabulous--one of a kind--very original, very cool.

I booked this place because it was a good price. I was told it was 0.3 mile walk to the parks which it wasnt. Its more. There was 2 front desk employees when we checked in. The gentleman was nice. The older lady was rude. The room smelled. The iron was broken. Called front desk to bring a new one. They did. But when opened the door to them they just walked right into our room without asking and my husband was in the restroom changing with the door open. Someone's car got broken into one of the nights we were there. The price was good to us because we would only sleep there and spend most of our time at the parks. They do not offer a tram to the parks. We didn't even bother to check out the breakfast offered. Next time we'd rather spend more money to get nicer employee, unsmelly

This place wasn't bad at all. Our purpose was to go to Disneyland and it is like 10 minutes walking distance so that was awesome. The rooms aren't anything special simply beds and showers. Everything clean regardless and neat.

The hotel is good if you are staying to go to Disneyland,  since your never in your room. The 10 minute walk to tram is not bad, easy and convenient,  the room had a black light which made the ceiling glow with stars. The gentleman that checked us in was awesome, we needed toothpaste and they had some to share with us for free. Our tv wouldn't turn on , and within 5 minutes the maintenance man came and fixed it and walked us through all the channels that were available. We Stayed for 2 nights 3 day's and it was exactly what we needed. We will stay again. The price fits the type of hotel

The rooms have a little patio and the neighbors talked untill midnight. I have stayed at other travelodge locations and this experience was bad..the mattress had  a uncomfortable plastic and also the mattress is very worn out. Room 305...check it out. I wish I could leave a diferent feedback.... The girl on arrival was very rude, the one on departure was really nice....
Overall the motel was average. The location was good. The room was large. The best part was the milky way starred ceiling that glowed at night.

Summary Heading: Perfect for the price and more!
Summary: My husband and I went to Disneyland and searched Priceline for a decent price hotel being that we wouldn't be there all day. Our original check in time was at 3 PM which shocked me but I was allowed to check in early at 8 AM with no extra charge. That was pretty cool. Upon arrival I selected a non-smoking room when I walked into the room the room smelled pleasant it was very appealing I got a king bed bedroom which was very spacious. It had a refrigerator nice sink space to lay out all our belongings, a microwave and they even had plenty of menus in the room for late delivery food service as late as 3 AM with decent food at great prices. The had your average complimentary breakfast as well. It even came with black lights in the room and when you turn off the lights the ceiling

The room was nice, clean, and had great cold A/C. The staff was very friendly and catered to our needs. We had the best view of Disneyland's fireworks, almost right on top of us. The room we had been given couldn't have been in a more perfect location, right next to the office, the ice and vending machines, the pool, breakfast, etc... If I had any complaints, it would be that the pool and jacuzzi could have used a cleaning and the parking was a bit scarce, but I suppose that was because we did visit during the Labor Day holiday weekend(Beach Day), and the hotel was booked solid.

Summary Heading: Great location for Disneyland and Fireworks
Summary: The hotel was a great location from Disneyland with the Tram about 10 min. away that takes you from Mickey and Friends Parking to Downtown Disney at the gate of Disneyland. The fireworks could not be better . They were over our heads. Being able to sit and watch them after a long day was great. The hotel service was excellent with the staff right there to help within minutes of any problems like more towels. We asked to have the laundry open early and right on time they opened the door for us. Great staff. Food was wonderful and just enough with waffles, fruit, cereal, milk, coffee, juice, toast, bagels, and more. The pool was used by our family every chance they could find time. Although the hotel needs renovation, it was very clean. We saw new carpet arrive so many rooms are

Was there with my wife for a getaway night and we had a great experience at this hotel. The room was very clean, it had a refrigerator where We put the wine in. Very quiet. A very convenient location, close to our house. But the best part of all is the stars on ceiling that you can see when you turn off all lights and turn on the black light. It looks like you are outside and looking at real stars, it was very romantic for my wife and I, we were celebrating our anniversary. Great experience. Thank you.

Summary Heading: Not much on the outside, but....
Summary: Right in the middle of the busy streets around Disneyland, looked a little battered on the outside with worn pain, etc, but the inside was super clean! The room was comfy and very quiet, even with (literally) a screaming parent ranting at their screaming kiddos in the outside hallway. We stepped into the room and couldn't hear them at all. There are cool glow in the dark stars on the ceiling that you can see if you use the blacklight on the wall. My kids loved that. The continental breakfast was good. We could see the Disney fireworks from our balcony and it was within about a 5 minute walking distance to the Disney tram. We stayed for 2 days and would stay again. It's NOT a fancy hotel, but a good clean motel for a cheap $79 bucks a nite.
First hotel is good location to disneyland,food centers and shopping stores. Second hotel has a good location going to hollywood and shopping mall

There's nothing fancy about this hotel however the location is excellent.  It is a quick walk to the tram which takes you right by downtown Disney.  That makes this a perfect location for us. The free breakfast is adequate, all carbs though.  We arrived on a Sunday night and the pool was dirty. Otherwise for a brief stay it was good.

Excellent value for a family room for one night. Spacious, clean family room. Good breakfast. Parking free for two days in Disney and an easy walk in and out of the parks. Perfect for a Disney stopover.
Their room that offered 2queens and a sofa had way more space than other hotels! It fit 6 of us comfy

Honestly this place wasn't amazing but it also what I expected for what I paid. The room decor was nice, very spacious. The hotel is right across from the entrance to get into Disneyland; however it is a little walk. It's worth not paying for parking though for however many days you're there. If you just walk from the hotel to where the trams are it won't be that bad of a walk.   The breakfast was very basic since they follow the Wyndham breakfast standards. The thing I didn't like about it was that there was only one type if milk and it tasted watered down (probably low fat) which made me a little sick. Also i was disappointed that they had bagels one day I was there but not the other day. I did like however that they had a TV set on Disney channel instead of the news like most

We stay at travelodge all the time this was the first time at this, and all i can say is first the parking sucks, second the room wasnt that great, and third we had Nooooooo hot water what so ever, so all 4 of us didnt get showers and when we went to complain the man and lady looked at me like i was crazy or something and had to beg to get some money off the room for no hotwater i got awhole 20 bucks off wow really?? and i still payed over 100 bucks for the room the most i have payed for a travelodge and it was the worst hotel, then was told because i got the 20 bucks of that i wouldnt get my reward points for this stay,also the breakfast at this hotel also was crappy and ive never had an issue at any travelodge before only this one there is no one watching the breakfast area

The location has great walking access to the Disneyland Resort,  but you may need a vehicle if you plan on dining elsewhere. The rooms could use some upgrades including fresh paint, flooring and appliances.  More comfortable beds and pillows would be nice as well. Finally the wi-fi was spotty and needs to be addressed.  But I guess you get what you pay for.

The AC unit has got to go! Way to old and disturbingly loud! Carpets very old and in poor shape stains everywhere. The shower door was missing a handle water was everywhere on the floor after using the shower. TV ancient hardly worked. Front desk attendants snooty not friendly or helpful when asked questions or recommendations around town.

I'll give it a 4 based on proximity to Disneyland. I wouldn't walk as it isn't that close especially with all the walking you will do already at the park. Rooms were ok....musty smell however but the AC took care of most of that. Easy to see Disney fireworks. We stayed 3 nights and the breakfast was ok but could have been a little better. Staff was friendly and they did a good job cleaning the rooms. I don't necessarily like the vanity with the sink NOT in the bathroom however. Can't beat the price and it is close to places to eat. We just really needed a place to sleep so that is all I can really say. It was good value for our needs.

I always stay on this hotel. it is very convenience on price and location. The staffing are very friendly. You have wifi, continental breakfast, laundry room, for a great price. I like to spend less money in hotel when I am going to Disney because we are all day out, we just come back to sleep, so this hotel is perfect.
very close to tram station to disneyland, comfy room, excellent air conditioning, large bed, good price

We stayed here for 3 nights in April 2014.  We were in a room that was right down the end , furtherest from reception. Probably why the wifi didn't work much and was very slow. Easy walk to disneyland which is approximately 1 kilometer away. Doesn't take long to walk and pleasant enough amble. Breakfast was ok although not many tables and lines can take a while. Staff were helpful when asked various questions. Pools were good and spa hot. Air con was a but noisy and blows on you during the night. Probably stay on the other side of the parks when we go back next time.
My overall experience was not so great, poor customer service, 1 bathroom stall for the lobby, low water pressure
Travelodge Inn & Suites Anaheim was a really good hotel. Really clean. I liked that there was a couch too not to mention a mini fridge! Would defenetly go there again!

Being next door to Disney was awesome! But also very busy. The carpets were very dirty and the black light in our second room was burned out. The front desk staff was very friendly but slow in responding to requests. People in room above us very LOUD after midnight
The location was perfect.  The front desk personal were friendly and helpful.  The room was what we expected for the price.

Overall very satisfied.  Staff at check in and check out  competent.  Night staff very friendly.  We were very happy with rooms and location..  My family had adjoining rooms and one of the toilets didn't drain properly and the water pressure was low in that bathroom.  The janitor didn't show up until they were preparing to check out and last they saw, there was used toilet water all over the bathroom floor. Didn't feel like janitor knew what he was doing..

Summary Heading: such a great front desk staff!
Summary: We arrived really early for our trip and the two people at the front desk were amazing. I think one was named Isabella? She was really nice about checking us in early so all we would have to do later was get out keys. She told us she'd give us one of her favorite rooms. The room was great! It had a balcony and a PERFECT view of the fireworks at night. Other than that our stay was great. The room was big and spacious. If I had to say any cons is just the location of the hotel but not in respect to disneyland. it was actually the best and easiest walk I've had to disneyland at a hotel. you just had to walk a few short blocks and then you were able to get on a tram that took you right into downtown disney. or if you felt like driving it was seriously a 2min drive into the parking

Summary Heading: Everything we needed for our family vacation and a two...
Summary: Everything we needed for our family vacation and a two minuite drive to the Disneyland parking structure

Hotel was great! Had an issue with room booked smelling like cigarettes, but the man at the front desk took care of the issue and switched us to a non smoking room quickly and made sure our stay was comfortable. Great service from the staff member at the front. Also very close to disneyland about a 15 minute walk so made experience even better! Highly recommended!

We stayed at the travelodge Anaheim. It's a steal for the price and the breakfast. You get what you pay for so don't expect 4 star amenities - the rooms were clean and the staff pleasant! The location in proximity to Disneyland parking structure is ideal!!! I give the place 4 stars for conscience price and overall stay :)

Got a great rate for this hotel 9 months on advance from a third party booking site.  If you're expecting 5 stars.. You'll be disappointed. If you are looking for somewhere clean and close to disney, then this place will be suitable.  We had a room with one queen bed, there was an option of adding a rollaway for around $11 a night.  Our room was bottom floor and we had some noise from the upstairs rooms and some from the carpark too, but it wasn't too bad. After big days, we'd almost sleep through anything.  Breakfast was ample. We bought some packaged cold meat from the am pm next door to add more protein.  Our room had a fridge and microwave... Perfect to store and heat up leftovers.   This hotel is not on the Anaheim Resort route, but bus 11 stops at the Days inn which is

Summary Heading: Not bad, you get what you pay for
Summary: Staff was very nice and helpful.  The rooms were OK.  We had the room with two queens and a pullout sofa on the ground floor. Ithe had a small odor but once you turned on the a/c it was ok. The light in the bathroom would not always turn on and the swith was connected to an air vent that was really loud. The really good thing is it's really close to the tram that takes you to Disneyland, probably a 10 minute walk.
Will return to this property in future trips.  Good service, clean and no problems.  Breakfast was deluxe continental and very satisfying.  We could walk to Disneyland.
I liked the ceiling people were friendly. We were close everything my daughter and I had a good time.

First of all, people who complain about this have, I think, way too high expectations. It's Travelodge, known for it's basic rooms and decent prices. Ok, this one was a little more expensive due to the location. And the location is perfect. It's literally a ten minute walk to the Mickey and Friends Tram which will take you straight to the park within five minutes. If you want to walk all the way it will be twentyfive minutes I guess.You have to cross the street and then it's straight ahead. It's also close to the Interstate. There's a gas station next door. What else do you want.  The room was second floor and tidy. Don't expect luxury because it's still Travelodge. It's basic and clean. There's a big TV and our room (room 203) was big enough for two people. People at the front

Though the hotel was only .53 miles from Disneyland, walking to the park and/or the tram, is a bad idea. After walking all day and standing in lines all day, this hotel is not as close to the Park as it seems.  Hotel is in desperate need of a renovation. Caulk in bathroom is peeling off, shower curtain is ripped, mold between tiles, bed mattress is stiff, carpet is sticky, two inch cockroach surprised us on our last day. Free breakfast is the best part of the hotel but electricity kept shorting out. Again, hotel needs a renovation.

This hotel/motel combo is a short walk (about 1/2 mile) to the Disneyland Parking Garage. The walk back is even shorter if you cut through the staff parking lot at night. At the garage, grab a free tram to Disneyland! The hotel itself had easy in/out access and sits next to a gas station. Our room had 3 queen beds and did not feel cramped at all with 6 people in it! The air conditioner seemed to have fan issues, but the room did eventually cool off. Our tub had a very high wall, meaning you had to sit on it and swing your legs over to get in, but it had a nice pad on one end to sit! We really enjoyed our stay here!

We had six people in our family visit this hotel.  We got a room with 3 queen beds and there was plenty of room.  It is within walking distance to the Disney Parking garage where you catch a trolley into the main gate.  Only problem we had was the limited drawer and storage in the room.

Excellent location, within walking distance to Disneyland. Clean, comfortable room, adequate parking, friendly staff.  The only problem we had was that there were no closable curtains in our room, only sheers.  But since our room was  upstairs in a back corner or the property it didn't really present a problem, except that it was very light during the night.  Luckily we were exhausted each night and the beds were very comfortable.  Slept like a log.

Summary Heading: Overall the experience could have been better.  The bed and...
Summary: Overall the experience could have been better.  The bed and location were good.  Internet, breakfast and a closure of the pool due to bees made the experience less than pleasant.

This hotel is located a short walking distance from the Disneyland Parking Area Tram, which was very convenient for getting to/from the park. Not needing to pay for parking was a huge bonus for us. The hotel offers a complementary breakfast in the morning, but it is definitely on the skimpy side (basic cereal, bread, waffles, and occasional fruit or bagels).  The hotel staff was very friendly and the pool was a bonus for the kids - plus the pool had long hours (8am-10pm), which we really enjoyed. The rooms themselves were fairly standard for this type of hotel, although they did seem to be a little larger than other rooms I've had.

Summary Heading: OK, but we'll probably stay elsewhere next time.
Summary: We stayed in a 2-queen w/ pullout couch. The furniture barely fit in the room. The room itself was fine. Location was too far to walk, even to the parking garage to catch the Disneyland tram (which is what we did, but I wouldn't do it again). Breakfast room was too crowded, they had a wafflemaker, but we ended up with just cereal because of the crowds. We liked the blacklight in the room and the stars painted on the ceiling.
I brought a small group (18) to attend Disney Grad Nite and the management/staff did a great job of getting the reservations set and attending to our 2 night stay.

This hotel was great for my trip to Disneyland! The location was excellent and was great for walking to and from Disneyland. The room was very quiet and clean and we were able to see the fireworks from Disneyland right from our room. The continental breakfast was very convenient and had a large variety of food. I definitely think I got a great value for my money at this hotel. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Disneyland with friends. I wouldn't really recommend it to families with small children because the hotel is located on the corner of two busy roads. Great experience!!

I booked thie hotel and was kind of nervous at first. I called and asked a ton of questions and the girls were super friendly!  We arrived way past the estimated time I had gave and they were so friendly! Our key worked the first time and parking was close to our room. When we got to the room I was suprised!! It was big and exactly what we wanted- 1 king big super comfortable and affordable.  The walk to disneyland was easy we took the tram on the way back, did not know about the employee parking short cut. Wish i did!! For everyone complaining about curtains- there is a smaller curtain behind the sheer ones. Haha- we didn't figure that out until the second day. All in all I will def be bookong again.
The building looked very old but the room is good . Breakfast service was not bad. The front desk people were very good. They gave me free upgrade .

Since I have had bad experiences with hotels in the past, I was very nervous to book again. This hotel was exactly what I needed. My sisters and I went for a quick getaway and wanted somewhere within walking distance to Disneyland. It was excellent and very easy to navigate to. Everything was very clean! The best part of the room was the glow in the dark stars on the ceiling at night. Words can't describe how awesome that was! It was a perfect surprise at the end of our day. My only complaint about this room was that the shower seemed lacking in water pressure. Other than that, everything was as it should be!

May 2014 booking:  Booked online (see previous review for preferred website address) this time using additional discount code through my union.  We saved $15/night using this code.  I suggested if you belong to a union, organization etc. find out if they have a discount code available.  Check in: We arrived early as we normally do, so we stowed our luggage in their back room.  No receipt this time, just stow and go?  We were advised to check in a little earlier than normal; 1:30.  Room: Two queen beds(comfortable with decent sized pillows and a bolster), corner room 304 lots of space for two people.  Flat screen TV with limited number of channels, refrigerator (able to freeze bottle of water to use in park during our hot stay), microwave, safe+, dresser, table with two chairs,

We spent 6 days here.  For the money this was a great stay.  Walking distance to Disneyland. Pool was a good size for the kids. The rooms are starting to show age.  We were in one of the rooms with the star ceiling.  My girls loved it plus you can confirm the bedding is clean with the black light. Breakfast was better than i thought it would be.  Waffles, cold cereals, fruit, ect.. It was nice to use the laundry on site.  Staff was very nice.  We would stay here again.

Summary Heading: The hotel looked nicer from the pictures that it displays...
Summary: The hotel looked nicer from the pictures that it displays on its website. However, it seemed to be in a safe enough area, and check in was quick and easy. The rooms are very modest, bathrooms & carpets old and outdated, but what can you expect from a Travelodge? The proximity to Disneyland is the main pull here. Breakfast was less than desirable.

1) Perfect location if all you wanna do is go to Disneyland. It's about a 10-15min walk to the Disney Tram and about 25 mins to the Park gate. 2) Very big Rooms. we had 2 queen beds in the room and we still had alot of space to walk around, eat inside the room.

Nice and close to walk to Disneyland, clean and tidy, only thing we wished it had was air conditioning as it was such warm weather and we are not used to the heat. Loved the waffle machine! Good selection for the continental breakfast and was nice to see fresh fruit amongst the selection too. Our room was always left perfectly while we were out and about during the day. Would definitely recommend it to others. Was great having the little gas station next door for junk food trips. Nice and close to the buses that use the ART system.
Friendly professional staff, Clean rooms, good breakfast we had three rooms for our family and we all enjoyed our stay very much
It's great if you want to save some money and do not want to get ripped off by the greedy Disneyland Hotels.  Clean, good service and within 35 min walk from the parks

We booked this hotel for many reasons including: distance to Disneyland, free parking, free breakfast and we were able to book this at a decent rate.  Upon reading the reviews prior to our visit I began to worry we had booked at a horrible location and we were going to be sorry but I enjoyed my stay there.  We called ahead to see if we could check in early and since they had a room ready we were allowed to.  They honored our requests of a king bed, away from the staircase and we got lucky and had no one above or below us.  However, the laundry room was right underneath us and we could hear the dryers but it was only during the day and we weren't there much at that time.  Also, they have "designated" smoking areas and, unfortunately, one was right by our room so we had the not so

There were no pillows available for our hide a bed. Also, the toilet clogged and maintenance wasn't available until after 9am the next morning. We weren't told that until the next morning she. We called for the third time to complain.  The pool area was not opened during posted hours (closed very early).

Summary Heading: Front desk employee's were friendly. The room was very...
Summary: Front desk employee's were friendly. The room was very close to disneyland. The room was clean the beds were comfortable overall a good place to stay.

I was kind of hissinatant booking but the room rate was super affordable being just a 15 min walk to Disneyland. Free parking was a plus, we didn't try the free breakfast. Clean room. We got lucky with an early check in! Seamed that there where people living there as well. First night there was a loud group afew doors down but no problems the other 4 nights. Will stay again.
the beds were not the most comfortable, but we were there for Disney and after walking the park we just passed out on them anyways. but not bad for a cheap room to sleep in.
The king bed we had was old and lumpy, but otherwise a good property and location. If they replace the mattress, I would stay here again.

Checking in was easy. We were put on 3rd floor so we had to lug or suitcases up stairs. Didn't see an elevator. The curtains were sheer which would be OK if the heavier curtains to the side would pull over. So unless you like the sum shining in your face at 630 in the morning I'd look.elsewhere. Bed was comfortable, shower was fine. I just felt the place was dirty after I found garbage stuffed in the ice bucket. Will not stay again.

Every time we visit Disneyland we stay at this Travelodge. Its very close to the park and love the AM PM right next door for our late night snacks. We have never had a bad stay. We love how big the rooms are and everyone that works here is very polite.

Summary Heading: I enjoy staying here.Its close to disneyland and convention...
Summary: I enjoy staying here.Its close to disneyland and convention center. The rooms are comfortable and clean for a really good rate. Parking can be a problem especially in the front of the building.The breakfast offerings can be improved but the waffles are great. Can be improved by providing more waffle makers, toasters, food trays, and additional food choices. Maybe some hardboiled eggs and muffins. It would also be great if another attendant is made available. There is only one person there to clean and restock. The poor woman is overworked. Even though we had a pretty good stay I was disappointed by the problem we had. On the day before we where leaving, the bathtub from the 2nd flr flooded into my 1st flr bathroom. We had 1/4 inch of water cover the bathroom floor and part of

I have been to travelodge in the past and have a good experience. This particular one is older and out dated. The service was good. If I had questions or needed something staff was willing to help. The room was cleaned daily, fresh linens and towels daily. The jacuzzi was kind of dirty but the pool was good. I did find a few spiders in our room and bathroom. Not sure why? Breakfast was OK. The beds were comfortable. Loved having a balcony. The kids enjoyed the fireworks at night from the balcony. It was so close to Disneyland and the location is easy to get to. I would return here and would recommend it.

For the most part I was satisfied. Having stayed on the north side of the property it was very dark the lighting was not sufficient. Know better next time. Except for a mishap over making waffles with another quest-apparently her food handling card was in good standing and wanted to be in charge of making the food her way-ugh, the stay was satisfactory. The staff was helpful and very pleasant. Also there were issues with the internet but if you report it the desk will reset. Travelodge is a good value and great location for Disney vacation. Heads up in the morning don't  waste your time going to the employee gate but at night ride the tram to the parking complex crossover on the second level to the stairs and out the gate 5 minute walk ;).

We always stay at Travelodge when we vacation at Disneyland. It is a relatively good price.  I noticed the last time that we stayed there that the rooms are not as clean as they could be. (The walls need to be wiped down more often.) The breakfast is okay. There is cereal, toast and pastries. They used to offer boiled eggs but have done away with that. I would prefer a little protein in the morning instead of sugar... The reason that we usually stay here is that we are not organized and usually can find a room here last minute at a decent price.

Summary Heading: Just o.k., you got what you paid for!
Summary: It is just o.k motel for the money we paid. It is a low level motel so good surprise was that spa and pool were heated and usable in fact. Location is so, so - you need 20 -25 min brisk walking to get to free  Disney shuttle from parking structure. Rooms are dark and smell bad. Most  guest were Spanish speaking and they smoke and drink in public everywhere and also in supposedly smoke free rooms. I kind of felt I was in Tijuana rather than LA. Breakfast was decent for such places. Do not expect to get a Sheraton for a price of  Motel 66! If you are sensitive to smell and noises do not go there. The hotel staff was just o.k for such places. Wi - Fi was fine as well. We're were just o.k for our  three days Disney trip. Atanas G  Santa Clara , CA

We enjoyed this hotel, we had stayed at other hotels in the area and always had trouble with one thing or the other. We came back from disneyland and were glad to see our rooms clean and we didnt need to ask for anything. The staff were very friendly. It was very close to the parking at disneyland, and was nice to be so close after a long day there. We will be staying here on our next trip to disneyland. It was a great place to stay.

Summary Heading: Acceptable, convenient and accessible for the cost.
Summary: This place meet my expectations.  I loved the fact that this lodge was complete, 2 queens, non smoking facility, bed was comfy, updated extras like flat screen and upscaled bedding.  Disney portraits were a little old, but it added charm.  It also had a pool and spa that were of decent size and enjoyment for the fam and also had the very desireable mini fridge and micro.  Very convenient for keeping snacks on hand and extra food if you have a budget for Disneyland.  The walk was not bad, 15 minutes to the park if you walked to the tram station by the Disneyland parking structure and took the tram to Downtown Disney to the main entrance.  Only bothersome thing is walking should be limited to only 1 time a day back to the hotel because it does get quite tiring when you do all that
The location was great for walking to Disneyland.  The room was clean and staff were friendly.

Was very surprised. Clean and nice sized room. Plus every thing worked. Refrig. Micro ac even had hot water at night when we came back from disney. My little boy is disabled and it was nice that he could watch the fire works at the window. Had the best seat in the house. The fire works were right there. Plan another trip in 2 weeks will definately stay there again.

I have to say that the staff was very helpful. we arrive a bit earlier than our check in time and they did their best to prep the room and allow early check in. Over all appearance of the place is clean and well kept. minor issues with pesky fruit flies near the bathroom area and dying light bulbs. but besides that, nothing bad. for the money that you pay and the close distance to disneyland, this hotel is a great deal. it has exactly what you need for a simple stay in a hotel with plenty of room to eat and sleep. the fridge was pretty well sized and even had a small freezer section. I would recommend anyone who is on a tight budget to stay here, because for the money, the room is pretty nice.

It's a mixed bag with more positives than negatives.  Front desk service showed exemplary customer service allowing my mom to check in before my arrival due to me being late and the room was under my card. Fair rates. Not too far from Disneyland. And clean rooms although very outdated.  My negative review is the amount of noise you hear through the thin walls. But, most troubling was the rust in the shower water. A pleasant shower becomes unpleasant when you realize you're washing your face in brown water. Fix the small things and I'll cone again.

iT was a very bad experience the room stinks so badly like   Pe with ammonia the whole room.        plus we all got  so itchy on our bodies they supposed to contact me and they never did they said I was going to get my refund back in they never called me

We enjoyed our stay, nice pool and hot tub.  Room interior was dated but spacious, staff was great.  Twenty-five minute walk to Disneyland but we handled that fine.  We wished the breakfast was a bit better.  We mostly ate Raisin Bran and alternated between bagels or breakfast pastries depending on availability.  We would stay there again but we might try to find something closer to the park entrance next time.

This was an interesting place to stay. The hotel is just a 5 minute walk from Disneyland. The breakfast was pretty good and the pool and spa were clean. Appearance wise the room was very nice two double beds with a pull out couch. But we all know the famous saying we get what we pay for... The sliding glass door only had a sheer curtain (so don't plan on getting busy unless you like people to see your butt.) your on a pretty busy street so if your a light sleeper probably not the place for you. The most exciting part of the room had the wonderful smell NOT it smelled like a cat lived there with you and we all know cat piss is sooo pleasing to your nose. (I strongly suggest if your broke like me to invest in a bottle of febreeze.) over all not to bad. Great price.
Good services, environment, location, and breakfast. Definitely I will return soon.
The front desk was very friendly and helpful check us in very quick. The room was ample , clean , and conveniently located close to Disneyland. Only thing needed is a shuttle to and from the park.

This was our second trip to this hotel its very clean service was great they were very nice & helpful. My kids also enjoy going downstairs to make their waffles for breakfast & it's very close to Disneyland and we are able to watch fireworks out our balcony. We plan on coming back very soon.

Summary Heading: Quite close to Disney, reasonable rates and free parking.
Summary: The room was a good size and was clean and quiet. Comfy beds too. The walk to to the trams at disneyland parking was about 6-7 minutes over two busy roads. It's interesting someone mentions the black light, because I had trouble working out what that was for. It turns out the the ceilings have the milky way and planets painted on them and you need to use the black light to make them glow. This was a cute touch which we appreciated. We weren't expecting much as this place was cheap, so we were quite pleased that it was an acceptable hotel for the price.

We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights while we played for a day at Universal Studios, attended a wedding and played for 3 days at Disneyland/California.  6 of us stayed in our room.  It was nice to find a room to accommodate all of us that didn't cost a fortune. The location of the hotel was very good.  We walked to and from the park each day.  It was about a 15 minute walk to the Disney trams, however in 5 more minutes we could walk through Downtown Disney to the front gates, whereas the tram took 15-25 minutes. Those were the best things about this hotel.  Here are the worst things about this hotel: 1)the smell of the rooms after housekeeping--sort of like A Dollar Store cologne 2)the internet was HORRIBLE.  We rarely could get on because it would say the capacity was filled.

The price was good, and we were a 15 minute walk from the park.  The room was clean and decently sized.  They do have laundry services but it is 2 pay washers and dryers with no change machine.  So it's tedious to drag all of your things to the laundry area to find you have to walk all he way back and get change. We did have noisy people above us but I was the only one of the group bothered by it.  For the price, overall we were pleased with the hotel.  The waffles in the morning really pleased my kids and the husband. :)

It was the cheapest hotel I could find within walking distance to Disneyland I stayed 6 nights it had a fridge a microwave and enough room to make us comfy and to be honest you don't spend allot of time there anyways so for the price it's great.

Check in was crazy He tried giving our room keys to another guest. Once in the room all we could smell "Gas Station Bathroom Cleaner" it was so strong it gave us a headache. There was also a hole in the floor. After we complained they switched us rooms which was better but not great. We had to check the wall a few times due to it looking like a camera in the wall. After checking it turned out to be hole with blue lining for hanging pictures it was creepy! On the second room there was hairs in the bath tub and stains on the pillow "good thing we brought our own."  Overall Id rather pay a lot more than save a few dollars. Oh and Breakfast isn't that great not even the bagels smothered in cream cheese helped. I wish we had stayed someone else. Ive stayed in a lot of hotels and by
Grounds are nice . room  dark and stuffy. gumny bear on wall & a ball of chewed gum on carpet
This hotel is an average, but very close to Disney 0.5 mi, but for sure you dont want to walk a step after spending a day un Disneyland. Breakfast needs an improve but its ok. Enjoy
GGood kids enjoyed it. I enjoyed your own coffee in the room along with refrigerator and microwave comes in handy and how close it it is near theme parks.

Summary Heading: Great hotel!! 15 min walk to Disneyland. Housekeeping was...
Summary: Great hotel!! 15 min walk to Disneyland. Housekeeping was great!! Showerhead was pretty low but besides that it was great

We love this hotel, We are Disney annual passholders from out of town and we always stay here! Simple hotel but you can't beat the location it is right by the parking structure,and they also have a very nice breakfast in the morning. Depending on the location of the room you can have an awesome view of the fireworks on a good night. Pool is nice however on this stay we did not use it but there were many people who did that night. (it was raining) We always enjoy this property and highly recommend.

I haven't had very good experiences with Travelodge in the past, but this location is definitely the exception! I was pleasantly surprised at how much went RIGHT with this trip. Great room for an even better price. I will definitely return!

I was apprehensive to book this hotel at first after reading some of the reviews on Trip Advisor.  My husband and I were quite pleased with our stay overall.  We are annual passholders, and normally we stay on the other side of Disneyland.  The staff was helpful and courteous.  The location to the park is better than some places we have stayed.  We did walk to the parking garage and use the parking tram to get us closer to the park.   The room itself was "good enough."  We, like other reviewer were somewhat weirded out by the black light in the room, but on the up side it wasn't picking up any "evidence."  The room we booked was a Queen, but we were upgraded to a King and stayed in room 203.  I think it is important to list which room so that people know not all rooms will have

The hotel is decently clean. Hotel staff is friendly. Hotel is north of the parks and away from the congestion of the hotels on Harbour Blvd etc. Easy 15-20 min walk to parks, depending on your pace. Breakfast is ok, waffles, toast, cereal. More fruit and yogurt would be nice. If you're looking for a place to crash after the parks then this will suit your needs. It's not a 3 star hotel, probably a 2 star. But the location, price and breakfast make it pretty good for a family of 4.

Of course any lodging is expensive near Disney, but I was expecting more for the inflated price. The walls are thin. All night you could hear people talking and being loud, which made for a terrible nights sleep. You could hear the guests walking upstairs which was loud. I'm use to not hearing foot steps at all. It's a short 15 minute walk to the Disney tram, so location is good. They did have a blacklight in our room with glow paint on the ceiling that looked like a galaxy; so that was cool. The lobby had an over empowering stench of cleaning chemicals. It wasn't the worst place I've stayed at but way overpriced.

Very happy with service.  Room was nice for what we needed and close to the park.  I have never seen a hotel with such a nice continental need help breakfast and breakfast room. I would stay here again for sure!

I love how close we were to the Disney parks! We were able to walk there and avoid paying for parking. The free breakfast was nice and the waffle bar made it great! You make them yourself but it was very easy to do. The alarm in the un-occupied room next door went off the first night at 12AM but we called the front desk and they came and turned it off fairly quickly. The "heated" pool was cold but the Jacuzzi was nice and hot. The building itself could use a touch up. We had a great stay.

the room that I stayed in was dirty. The remote control was greasy so was the hair dryer handle. The common wall from the bathroom to the bed was dirty. I did like the fact that there was a black light in the room to check to see for stains but it actually made me feel more uneasy to think that they needed it. My room is in need of a renovation. I also had to set the clock before I went to bed. I think the most frustrating thing was there were no blackout curtains.

We've stayed at this Travelodge many time and have been very pleased in the pasted.  This time we feel the staff was a little slow and tired from the holidays.  First, we arrived about 1:00 pm (1300) two hours early then the official check in time of 3:00 pm (1500).  The Desk Staff Member stated it was company policy that we could not check in.  We found that odd because in the past this was not a problem.  So, we left and went to lunch and used money we didn't want to spend.  When we came back and checked in we got into our room it was to our liking.  But, the staff left us with no bath towels and we had to call down to get some delivered.  Once that was done our time was better and we got ready for our dinner date at Disneyland's Club 33.   The king bed was not really
This hotel is conveniently located to the Disneyland and DCA parks.  The hotel is well-kept with good service and cleanliness.

We got to the hotel late and as soon as we check in I find a dirty Q- tip behind toilet. I pull comforter off the beds cause we all know how clean those are..:) to find a big yellow stain on the underside and a dried crusty booger. After a terrible night sleep due to a old heater that never stops running and thin floors and walls so I can hear absolutely every little noise going on above me and through the halls, a sinking bed that makes you roll towards the middle, having to use the third pillow they provide to cover my face from the noises, I get up in the morning to a clock that has been set wrong, off by 20 minutes and ants living in the door frame of the bathroom. The continental breakfast was sub par. the waffles gross, the fruit sad, even my kids didn't want to eat it. It

Summary Heading: Keep the motel as you have we have stay there varios dates...
Summary: Keep the motel as you have we have stay there varios dates in the past eight years you have good service, location and Price.  Thank you and happy 2014.

We enjoyed our stay.  The room was clean, beds super comfortable, used the fridge and micro daily, the room was spacious even for a family of 5.  The jacuzzi was perfect after a long day at the theme parks.  After a long drive from OR to CA we arrived late and tired, we turned off the lights for bed, and the whole ceiling lit up.  My kids were thrilled with the star covered ceiling, great touch.  The breakfast was simple and efficient for our needs.  We were very close to Disneyland parking and took the free tram from there.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for an a comfortable, affordable and clean place to stay.

I stayed one night with my family during our Disneyland trip. It was ok. Staff we're very friendly rooms were cleaned. The only two bad things I didn't like we're 1.) when we entered our room it smelled bad. Like the room needed some ventilation or old carpet and 2. ) they give u plenty shampoo but NO conditioner. That sucks for girls with long hair. But I guess it's my fault for forgetting my shampoo and conditioner at home. Overall I would stay here again

Summary Heading: We love this place for Disneyland
Summary: We got an awesome rate, a clean room with a good layout and really comfortable beds.  It was a double queen room for 3 adults, and it worked out great. This time it was the one right over the check-in desk. It must have been painted recently too, because the usual glow in the dark stars on the ceiling were missing. BUT, that was a tiny disappointment, compared to the value of this room. I have stayed at this place when visiting Disneyland about 6 times, and I always feel like I got good value for my money. The breakfast is pretty basic, and meh, but I love the pineapple(canned) and coffee. For kids it works out really well, as they get to choose foods (if their parents allow) and play with the dispensers. Even though there were three adults this time, I have used this place with

Summary Heading: Travelodge Inn & Suites Anaheim is a Good Option on a Budget
Summary: Travelodge Inn and Suites Anaheim, California is an older but clean and well maintained facility with easy access to Disneyland and the Convention Center. Free parking, free Wi-Fi, free breakfast that included fresh fruit and waffles. Staff was friendly and professional. In my opinion a better fit for a no frills business trip than for a family or celebration.
Very comfortable.  Plenty of food for breakfast rush. Helpful staff. Very close to Disneyland.
was a very good experience, is a nice place near of everithing that you need for a good trip. congatulation

Summary Heading: Everything was clean, quiet, and friendly...shower preasure...
Summary: Everything was clean, quiet, and friendly...shower preasure wasn't great and  breakfast coffee was a little flat...the usual Holiday decor was missed...the refrigerator was barely adequate...my room was pleasant and comfortable...
Excellent hotel staff.  The standard rooms were overbooked, front desk upgraded my room at no charge.

Stayed three nights to visit Disneyland and was pleased with the location and general appearance of the hotel. Room was comfortable with excellent - and much appreciated - amenities for budget accommodation (fridge, microwave, coffee-making). Very comfortable bed, clean room, efficient staff. All-around good value.
although the room was ok, we had A LOT of problems with wifi. I informed the staff, but nothing was done. I was there for two days, but never did wifi work right. VERY slow... VERY poor:(

it was a decent hotel within a short walk to disneyland. clean enough,staff was friendly. only complaints are small things. 1)really stinky room spray that was used when the room was cleaned. 2)really sad that the beer bottles and empty water bottles we left neatly by the door were thrown in the big garbage can by the staff instead of recycled. 3)heater was broken in the pool for the whole week.

Summary Heading: I have stayed here before both times have been pleasant...
Summary: I have stayed here before both times have been pleasant, its a good spot for a budget style vacation and great view of the fireworks at night
GREAT price & stay! Friendly, clean, spacious, star lit ceiling & make your own waffles a HUGE HIT!!

As most people probably looking at this review I spent a long time researching the right hotel for our visit to Disneyland so I will hit the important points.  Location- Awesome, you can easily walk to and from the tram stop to the parks.  Price- On the lower end compared to some of its competitors but too expensive for what you get.  Room- As I walked in to the room my first thought was this room is big! The bed was also comfortable, and the microwave and refrigerator were an added bonus. But, that is about where the positives end. The room included a black light to illuminate the glow and dark stars, which on first thought is pretty cool. However, the thought of having a black light in a hotel room is not a good idea in my opinion, I would rather be ignorant to other things it

I should have listened..but we'd stayed here before...a few years ago.  This hotel has fallen on some hard times yet carries the Wyndham name?!  It may be "close" to Disneyland...but if we walk over 10 miles between parks, who wants to walk another mile to a shuttle? We were just expecting a clean room and decent beds/linens for the economical pricing offered over Veteran's Day Weekend at Disneyland. The room wasn't too small, bed wasn't too hard, but the toilet took 3 flushes...every single time.  The housekeeping staff wasn't too bright...left 1 one bath towel for a room occupied by 3 people.  The bathroom had peeling paint and 5 different colors that didn't match in the least?  We took pretty short showers and still the water wouldn't stay warm (not hot) for a quick 4 minute

We enjoyed our stay here. The only problems were minor. The blacklight (that show the glow in the dark stars on the ceiling) was broken.  The bed was pretty hard. Also the toilets were extremely low low flush. you had to hold the handle down for a while to get it to flush

This hotel has rooms with 3 queen-size beds, which was perfect for your family of 5.  It's close to Disneyland and a couple of shopping plazas with restaurants. Clean and friendly. Great choice for budget-minded travelers.

Summary Heading: The room was very large, pool right outside are back door...
Summary: The room was very large, pool right outside are back door. Just outside the back door we were able to see Disneyland's fireworks right over our heads. We could not hook up to the internet the phone jack in the room did not work.

Great deal - very clean, staff was friendly, breakfast was okay, could easily walk to Disneyland.  Our only problems were that the toilet ran and the shower temperature was inconsistent, but these were not major issues.

When we stay in Anaheim we always use this Travelodge.  The location to the parking structure of Disneyland is perfect for use to use.  This Travelodge is clean and easy to get in and out of when your plans require you to meet family or friends.  We will come back again.

Summary Heading: Breakfast fruits and bread perfectWe walked a few blocks for Disney trains! Internet wireless and can use a computer too.
Summary: The room was upstairs and for kids it was complicated... But breakfast was very good and the hotel was very close to Disney Park!!!! Easy to fine because is near exit of the interstate highway I5... Only few blocks to Disney tram and se can walk!!!! Free parking in the hotel!!!

Summary Heading: Very close to Disneyland, front desk was very courteous...
Summary: Very close to Disneyland, front desk was very courteous.  Only concern was the humidity/ac in room.  Not a comfortable sleep night, but will return.
Very nice staff, excellent location, and very reasonable rates.  Already booked my room for next year. Love the room with 3 beds!!

Summary Heading: Was only there for Disneyland. Spent very limited time at...
Summary: Was only there for Disneyland. Spent very limited time at the hotel.  Was Okay for the time we spent in the room.

Summary Heading: Room comfy location ok but got shocked outlets unsafe, had iPhone stolen
Summary: Stayed here 10 nights room was perfectly fine. Location perfect  The plugs were loose and unsafe ended up getting shocked and reported to desk but still no one fixed it so we checked out. Upon checking out left cell phone on night stand. Called hotel a couple hours later and desk girl adviced me housekeeping said no cell phone was left so I told her that I know it's on the property as I have the app find my iPhone. She's like no no I said we'll its moved from bedroom to housekeeping area so someone is being dishonest. ( app shows building and areas in shaded box so I could see where it was) i called her back again and threatened to call the police and my lawyer.  She said I will check again. Not even 2 minutes later she called back and said she had it waiting at the desk for me.

We stay here every year Labor Day weekend as we are "Legacy runners" for the Disneyland Half Marathon.  It is clean, convenient, affordable and about a half block from the sgtart and finsih line of race. The staff is ALWAYS friendly and the rooms are very clean. It meets our needs and thus we continue to stay there for that weekend  going on 5 years now.  Sincerely, MIke and Nancy Mitchell Loma LInda, CA

Summary Heading: The room rates were very affordable and the location was...
Summary: The room rates were very affordable and the location was very convient to Disneyland walking distance

Stayed here during the D23 Event last August.  It is walking distance to the Anaheim Convention Center and Disneyland.  Wifi was slow and breakfast was simple (mostly breads) but free.  The room was spacious but look tired.  Bathroom was just ok.  They clean your room everyday so that's a plus!  If you just need a room to shower and sleep/rest rest, this is for you.

You get what you pay for here, rooms are spacious albeit dated. They are comfortable and air con works well. Pool is great as is the jacuzzi.  The staff are friendly and helpful, i got a put-u-up bed for $10 a night so the room could sleep 3 seperately.  Free breakfast is simple but its free so i got what i needed! Within walking distance to free Disney car park shuttle too.

Summary Heading: Clsoe to Disneyland and Good breakfast
Summary: The overall room was spacious.  We were supposed to have a non-smoking room but it smelled a bit like smoke.  The bed spread was stained.  The manager did switch it out but I felt uncertain about the cleanliness of the room after that.
I just want to say thank you guys for hospitality at Travelodge. I had a very good time staying with you guys!! I will be there again next vacation!

Summary Heading: The hotel was adequatete as we just needed a place to...
Summary: The hotel was adequatete as we just needed a place to sleep. It was very near Disneyland parking. However, the rooms do need an upgrade (bathtub was stained and looked dirty), carpets are thin and worn out.

Summary Heading: I liked the place, close to Disneyland parking lot ( half...
Summary: I liked the place, close to Disneyland parking lot ( half mile). I reserved one room for four people and they upgraded  the room for a family of 6 free. The kids love the room it was just infront of the pool and jacuzzi. They offer continental breakfast.

The hotel was comfortable.  The carpets definitely need to be cleaned or replace.  At night when you turn the light so you can see the stars on your ceiling, lots of stains showed.  Probably water stains from the upstairs room. We were only here at night because we were here visiting Disneyland.  The beds were comfortable. The fridge and microwave sure came in handy.  I would stay again.  Very close to Disneyland and a convenience store. The WiFi didn't work at all even though it said we were connected.

Summary Heading: The beds should be updated, a little uncomfortable.  And...
Summary: The beds should be updated, a little uncomfortable.  And there were little bugs but both the sink and tub.

The best thing about this hotel is it's close to the parks. Rooms also have a safe. Rooms are older, carpet pretty dirty & breakfast slim. Our room wasn't made up for two days & when we called the front desk we were told hskping was gone for tne for the day (4pm). Luckily we found someone on our own & were able to get towels & the room a quick clean. Good for short stay.

We needed a place to stay for our quick Disney trip and we chose this spot because it was within our budget. It was very dim lighting.. the walls were thin.. The air conditioner was very loud all throughout the night. My husband and I hardly got any rest. I could hear tons of kids running down the halls and people talking/yelling in the early morning.. We woke up very frustrated as we needed sleep desperately. I had to tell the family of 6 in the two queen room across the way to quiet down.  It was clean at least. And it was an excellent location for Disneylanders.  I feel it was overpriced. I wish we had spent just a little more money and gotten a better spot to get some quality rest. The walls were just too thin for my taste.

Stayed here for 7 days.  Stay was good.  not too much outside noise except Air condition in the room was very noisy.  Staff is good and helpful.  Best thing is its close to Disneyland resort. Only 10 mins walk to the trams to Disneyland.  Also can see fireworks from of this place. Car parking no problem.

We stayed at this motel because it was close to Disneyland.  The walk there was long but the walk back was great because all we had to do was walk through the parking garage and through the cast parking lot.  Couldn't go in that way or would have done so.

Summary Heading: average, but walking distance to Disney Resort
Summary: We chose this place because of its availability and walking distance to Disney.  The outside looks decent, but once we saw the room we were a bit disappointed, that it was dark and needed some maintenance (paint touch up).  The popcorn ceiling was recently touched up and some had already fallen (and continued to fall) on the bed.  The AC wasn't very cold but it works.  Outside is a bit noisy but bearable.  I was unable to get on the hotel wifi; even when I could get on, it was slower than molasses.  My cell also didn't get good signal.  I am not a light sleeper but for some reason it was very hard to sleep, and my kids were scratching all night.  Beyond that, no major issue.   Free breakfast is a plus; you can make your own waffles.  The housekeeping staff was nice and friendly.

They were nice. The rooms were tidy and presentable. My issue was the first day we were there we caught a huge cockroach in our room. They were nice and did switch our room to the floor beneath but I was concerned for the rest of our stay. Loved the pool.

Don't check into the Travelodge with Hilton expectations. You get what you pay for. This was close to Disney and had spacious rooms and a pool that you can watch the fireworks from every night. The area felt safe and the AMPM next door provided me with reliable coffee every morning. The water temperature was luke warm and inconsistent but it was never ice cold. Breakfast lacked protein but what do you expect for the price? The rooms come equiped with black lights and glowing stars on the ceilings. Interesting.

I enjoyed my stay  at Travelodge.  It was a large room and nice continental breakfast.  One complaint.  Getting in and out of  the tub/shower was too dangerous.  Nothing to hold on to and the floor of the tub was slippery.  Someone said I should have had a handicapped room but every tub should have safety  bars.  the room was quiet.  the help friendly.  Thank you.

The Travelodge we usually stay at was booked up, so instead we got a room at this one. It was extremely close to the Disneyland parking structure and other amenities. The room was clean (though housekeeping forgot us one day). The pool was nice as was the hot tub. The grounds were well kept as well. The only recommendation I would have would be to offer more food options at the continental breakfast.

Staff is very good and accommodating. The only deduction is that the rooms are getting very dated and old looking - particularly the bathrooms.   Special kudos goes to the woman who was hostess for the breakfast. She worked so hard and did such a wonderful job keeping the place clean and stocked. I've been at other hotels where it's taken two people to do what she was able to do by her self.  Food was really really good. We later went to San Francisco and stayed at a Hampton and the food there was not nearly as good at all.  One other thing noted was that there are big gaps under the door and around the door so loud people in the hall can be heard clearly in the rooms.  Another thing poor was the quality of the TV reception. Channels were good, but no HD and reception was very

Summary Heading: ok nothing special.  ac unit at least in our room did not...
Summary: ok nothing special.  ac unit at least in our room did not work very well.  did not cool off room at all

Summary Heading: A good location close to Disneyland Parking Garage.  The...
Summary: A good location close to Disneyland Parking Garage.  The free breakfast was pretty decent.  We liked the pool and hot tub area very much.  The beds were comfortable and the room smell clean and fresh.

Summary Heading: Overall very average. The location to disney was unbeatable...
Summary: Overall very average. The location to disney was unbeatable for the price. My only complaint is that we found a spider in our bed and my husband was bit. When I went to the front desk the girl didn't know what to do! I had to ask to have my room switched, had to ask for a number to a doctor to get the bite checked out because we didn't know if it was poisonous or not.
