The front desk clerk said that the manager wasn't in but that she would inform him of the situation, no one even got back to us or even checked on the spider bite for the 2 days after the incident that we was there, that was very disappointing!

Summary Heading: Not a bad trip at all.
Summary: Just a few things were irritating a bit.  The water kept fluxuating from hot to cold in the shower.

Hotel served it's purpose, clean room, close to Disneyland and helpful staff. However the breakfast could be improved by adding protein foods such as eggs,  peanut butter and bacon/sausage. Waffle maker could be replaced it is not working properly, (waffles are not cooked properly)

The rooms here are big enough for a family of 5, there is a convenience store right next to it, I love the bottom floors especially the ones facing the pool my kids were able to play outside.  This is definitely a good place for families we were travelling as a party of 10 and had no complaints at all.  Would definitely stay here again

Breakfast room was dirty. The personnel at the breakfast room was very rude not polite at all, she was worry more about her schedule than providing excellent customer service. She was extremely rude with my granddaughter who is 6 years old. My granddaughter was waiting for her bagel at the toaster and the service lady pushed her aside saying "haste" (Spanish word) which is a very rude form  of saying get away.The rooms might be clean and nice,and the location might be excellent but if I am paying for something I deserve to be treated with respect. After all that lady is receiving wages because of the customers that stay at Travelodge.

Summary Heading: A Good Stay For the Family
Summary: The location was the purpose we choose Travelodge, but the experience is why we continue to come back.  Walking distance to our destinations, it was nice to come back to the room any time. The pool was a relief. the rooms were cleaned promptly but towels were short the 2nd day. I will continue to stay at this location every time I come

This "motel" is a great place to stay if you're going to Disneyland as it is a 15 minute walk and you are there.  There is gas station next to this hotel which is quite well stocked and they too offer good service. The staff were fantastic the only downfall was our bed had a torn blanket and torn sheets but we advised management who advised housekeeping as they had purchased all new blankets according to the manager anyway she though we had a new blanket on our bed after we told her however they turned the blanket around but we found this quite funny. I would stay again.  Breakfast was included and it is was very nice.

We spent three nights here. The rooms were a little run down but the beds were comfortable, the bathroom clean and well stocked and we experienced no noisy neighbors at all. The continental breakfast had what we expected. We walked the one half mile to the shuttle to Disneyland. Nice place at a reasonable price, we would say there again.

For a budget hotel that is situated close to disneyland, we thought this Travelodge was great! We stayed for 10 nights in May 2013, in a ground floor Queen bed non-smoking room. I was a bit worried at first as the room was located right next to the laundry and I had previousy read here that the noises from the laundry wake you up in the early hours of the day, but this wasn't the case at all.  The room was small and old, but functional for what we wanted and very clean. The cleaners did a wonderful job each day in servicing the room. There is a safe, TV, air conditioner, single cup coffee maker, hairdryer, fridge and microwave. There was only coffee supplies for two cups of coffee, powdered milk and no tea provided - if you are a tea drinker I would recommend bringing your own

The hotel location is great, right down the street from Disneyland. The free breakfast was average, but a great money saver. The staff was friendly.  Considering we spent most of our time out and about, the hotel room was suitable and spacious. I would bring my own bath towels and wash cloths.    My one complaint was the cold showers. My husband and I both experienced fluctuating water temperatures. The shower was unpredictable every time, and went from cold, to lukewarm, and briefly reaches "hot". Annoying.

Summary Heading: We had a great time. The room we were given was great.  It...
Summary: We had a great time. The room we were given was great.  It was large and very comfortable. The only problem was that the covering for the tv remote kept falling off and the refrigerator kept tilting over since it was missing a leg. Otherwise we had a great experience and the do it yourself waffles were delicious!

Summary Heading: This hotel is great1 We love to stay here when we go to...
Summary: This hotel is great1 We love to stay here when we go to Disneyland. It is walking distance to Disney and the staff is always very nice. The only problem is there is alot of noise early in the morning with families getting ready to go to Disneyland and heading to breeakfast but that is to be expected

Convenient to disneyland only a 15 minute walk.A bit tired all the rooms could do with a coat of paint the furniture in our room all broken chairs,table and fridge,I asked for a bath plug to take a bath but they could not supply one.Breakfast average need to eat early as dining room fills up fast too small.Staff friendly.This hotel is ok for budget limited families i would go elsewhere next time.

Summary Heading: I loved the room! Quiet and clean!! I just would have liked...
Summary: I loved the room! Quiet and clean!! I just would have liked better blankets rather than the foam. But other than that I totally enjoyed my stay!! Loved my room and the bed was totally comfortable, except for the foam blanket. I would stay there again!

This place is really broken down.  It was clean, so i can't say it's disgusting, but the room -- and the hotel generally -- was old and broken.  Physiologically, it even triggered a little fear response, though there was nothing really to be afraid of.  Nice and close to Disneyland, though.

First off, it was very hot both days we stayed there. I informed "Olivia", the night person that the A/C was not working very well. She logged it into a book. When we got back to our room, the A/C had not been fixed. Two hot sweaty nights made for little sleep. Then we discovered that the cold water in the vanity sink was very hot, and not cold at all. Try brushing your teeth in "Hot" water.
The staff was very polite and very helpful. The hotel and grounds were clean . All inall a great stay

After reading reviews we were really worried, but this place was great the service was better than most hotels and the breakfast was pretty decent (cereal, bagels, waffles and fruit!). The room was a little run down looking but nothing gross. The curtains close all the way and the air was loud but cold! The bed was a little hard but that's a first world problem! Will stay here again during next visit.
Great location for Disneyland. Room needed some upgrading but not bad for the price. We would stay again at this location.

Summary Heading: I was pleasantly surprised with the rooms and the great...
Summary: I was pleasantly surprised with the rooms and the great breakfast provided. For such a great price it was well worth the amount i paid. The staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel was also close to many locations in drving and walking range. There was also complimentary parking which is a huge plus in Anaheim.

Summary Heading: It is a little outdated, but overall not a bad place to...
Summary: It is a little outdated, but overall not a bad place to stay. I brought a air mattress to sleep on and I am so glad I did, the beds we ROCK hard, and the carpet was way dirty, so don't walk barefoot. Other than that I felt that the rooms were clean enough.The breakfast was nice, if you arrived early. The swimming pool was nice, and my kids had fun. The location was nice, we came through the back side of Disneyland so the crowds were not too bad, however be prepared for a walk, they said you could catch the parking lot tram, but even that was a walk, and rather unload everything, it was easier to just walk to Disneyland. My only compliant would be that there aren't any restaurants within walking distance, you have to drive..

Love how the "stars" illuminate the room at night when the light are off.  The only bad thing we encountered was that someone had smoked right outside the room and the scent came in the room.  Perhaps posting signs to not smoke within x amount of feet from the non-smoking rooms would be good.
Nice and clean...with one exception..we had to switch rooms. They should have just given us the room they moved us to...in the first place. The AC unit in the first room was noisey!!!...
Comfy bed-no Free breakfast-yes Free wifi-yes Disney shuttle-no Loud-yes clean-ehh value- ehh average

Room was average, not sure why you don't have curtains that shut all the way. My room was in front of the pool and wanted to shut the curtains but the rail went only half way.  I had to use a pin to close them.  Also the chairs and table were falling apart. We couldn't sit on them.

Summary Heading: Room is Clean and Staff are friendly
Summary: My family and grandkids had a Great time at the hotel and we love the starlight and the breakfast they offered!  During the spring break, my family wanted to go to Disneyland. So we decided to book the Travelodge Anaheim to spend couple nights there.   Upon arrival at the property, we parked in the parking lot went right up front to check in.  We were greeted by a lady that was very friendly.  She was smiling at us and greeted us. I felt a warm welcome to the hotel and she check us in and spend few minutes to explained where is the near by restaurants and where we can take the tram to Disneyland.      When we first walked into the room. The room was Clean and Better than we expected. And first we didn't know what was the "black light" is for, so we asked the front desk and she

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland, but that's about it
Summary: This hotel is close to Disneyland, but it's old, dirty and run down.  Our door didn't close "flush" with the door frame - so I felt nervous all night that someone would try to open it and come in.  The hard bed made it difficult to sleep.  We turned on the air conditioning, but the covering on the beds is REALLY light.  The "bedspread" is a thin piece of cotton and the "blanket" is vellux.  So it makes you feel hot and sweaty.  I slept terribly.    The shower fixtures were coming apart from the wall and the bathroom floor looked like it hadn't been properly cleaned.  The TV had shadowing (like it was old).  The room did have a fairly large refrigerator.  Breakfast was so-so: make-your-own waffles, toast, two kinds of cereal and danish pastries cut in half.  They had fresh

Our stay was absolutely terrible. The parking lot was a nightmare because we woke up to find trash and chewing gum on our car! The carpet and walls were disgusting. The insulation was so horrible that the entire building shook violently from the vibration of Disneyland’s fireworks. Also, THERE WERE FLEAS!!! I put a white towel on the carpet because I forgot my slippers at home and COULD SEE LITTLE BLACK CRITTERS JUMPING ON THE TOWEL!!!! We tried this hotel only because we had a tight budget and our trip to Disneyland was very last minute, but never again will I stay at this hotel!

Summary Heading: Decent location and breakfast for price but soft bed and mildewy smelling showers
Summary: Decent location but a 30min walk to Disneyland.  A little long for kids.  Decent price for location. Breakfast quite crowded but has waffles, coffee, toast and cereal.  Bathroom was a little mildewy and rooms flooring was quite thin. We could hear every things from upstairs.  The aircon was also super loud.  Okay place with friendly staff.

Summary Heading: WE WILL NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN!
Summary: We stayed here for 2 nights while visiting Disneyland and it was an awful experience! The girls who checked us in as well as some of the housekeeping staff were the only professionals there.  When we arrived, I noticed that there was a quarter inch gap from the floor to the bottom of the door. Plenty of room for critters to just come right in. The floor looked like they had not been vacuumed for some time. The carpet was extremely dingy. Also, the bathroom ceiling had mold spots growing on it.  That's not the worst of it folks. When we got there our small child locked the safe. We had to get the maintenance man to unlock it. The next day, we discovered some money missing from the safe. When I got to the front counter to report it, the two males at the front were unfamiliar and

Summary Heading: Nice hotel for the price we paid. I loved that it was about...
Summary: Nice hotel for the price we paid. I loved that it was about a 30 min walk to Disneyland. The Contoinental Breakfast was good but the sitting area was a little too crowded.

Summary Heading: My biggest complaint was the bathroom.  A small amount of...
Summary: My biggest complaint was the bathroom.  A small amount of mold and the shower head was low, had to stoop to get my hair wet

Summary Heading: Room was great but parking is hard to get and the room...
Summary: Room was great but parking is hard to get and the room showed it's age. Especially in the bathroom. The tub had some cracks from where the top coat was pealing away.

Summary Heading: best hotel during our road trip
Summary: Great place to stay for my family of 5. Pool was warm and hot tub was hot! Breakfast room kind of small but it work.
Rooms were clean & location near Disneyland.  This hotel has water issues and needs to be remodeled.

Summary Heading: Nice place for a large family to stay... but noisy neighbors :-(
Summary: We took a trip up to Disneyland and needed a room for 6, which I was finding wasn't easy to find on a budget!  I booked a room at this Travelodge for about $129 + tax/$150 total. Decent deal.    The room had 2 queen sized beds in it and a sofa-bed.  I think I was anticipating a larger room, though... it was a standard sized room and it was a little close for comfort with all of us, but was about $80 cheaper than anything else I could find for all of us to squeeze into.  Room was clean, but I did notice a bit of mold in the bathroom ceiling.  We had a fridge, a microwave and a coffee maker.  Everything we needed.  The glowing stars were really cool - the kids loved it!    However... this was the noisiest motel stay I have ever had... EVER... I know it's not the fault of the hotel
Our stay was great. The rooms were very clean. The location was excellent because it was right beside Disneyland.  The service was also good. I would come back to stay again tot his hotel.

Stayed in this motel for three nights for its location and price when searched on web. However,it was a major disappointment. The room was full of detergent smell and noise. The free breakfast could also be skipped. Will not choose this motel again in our next trip to Disneyland.
Great place to stay for a trip to Disneyland. The hotel stay are very helpful. Try to get a room that is away from the stairs because you will hear and feel everyone that uses them.

My family and I really liked staying here. The front desk clerks were very nice and courteous. Our room was a little small for a suite but we had a good night's sleep and we could walk outside and see the fireworks at Disneyland. I was so glad to find out they had an elevator with all the suitcases and bags we had. We would stay here again.
Property was in a perfect location for our trip to Disneyland.  However, the property was in need of some updating, and exterior repair.

The room is really nice. I thought it was pretty decent for the price. I love that it was air conditioning because I got hot at times. The pool was at the perfect temperature in the jacuzzi was great! Whenever I ran out of towels or toilet paper they came right away with more supplies. I would definitely recommend this hotel. And I will use them again.
Great location. Great service, but no glowing stars in my room and rooms next to stairs aten't the best for sleeping after a long day at the happiest place on earth.

Summary Heading: my daughter and i had a great stay....enjoyed our bed and...
Summary: my daughter and i had a great stay....enjoyed our bed and pillows...clean...open room. would stay again!
Manager Response: Thank you very much for the positive response! We are trying our best to provide the excellent services to our customers!

Summary: Positives to our stay for the cost included location and breakfast. The room was a basic 2 queen bed room with a microwave and fridge with a view to the fireworks, which only show on weekends during March.The breakfast was a basic continental breakfast with a server who kept  everything stocked and cleaned.The hotel is on the back side of Disneyland and is a 10 minute walk  to the tram entrance and about 15 minutes to Down Town Disney. When there was a problem with hot water staff took care of it immediately.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your possible response! We are striving our best to provide the best service to our customers and we hope to see you and your family soon for your next vacation!

Summary: We stayed for 2 nights. Turned on the hot water for the sink only to find out the hot water was turned off, my husband had to turn it on.  We had 2 queen beds which were ok. We stayed on the 2nd floor the floor had stains on the carpet and were uneven. There was a black light in the room which did not work. They had a  coffee pot in room but the sink is too small and you had to move the coffee pot from one side of the sink to the other side of the sink to turn it on.  The 2nd night of the trip after a long day at the park my husband went to take his shower after I took mine and there was not any hot water at all. There was a doorway at the end of the hall to the stairs that was left open the whole time we were there. It did not feel very safe as we were at the end by the busy

My husband and I stayed here for our Anniversary trip to Disneyland and It was the best stay at a hotel that we have ever had. Everything was perfect!! We have stayed at ALOT of hotel near and around Disneyland and The Travelodge is the BEST one we have experienced. It is worth spending a little extra.

Sounded good in reviews, been to Disney about 5 times before and thought this sounded close and nice for this trip. It actually is close, but you'd suffer imenant danger if you took the path to the park. So we drove and that's ok. The room has black lights, the first night it was pretty cool then the next we found a nice glow spot on the pillows. Yuck. They have dollar tree fixtures, old gross fridge and the cabinet that stores it just stays open it doesn't click closed. The microwave knobs come off everytime I click them. There is just a hole with lights sticking out in the bathroom, it's not finished.  The guy next to us got high the whole time and we smelled like pot the whole time. There's alot of more convenient better priced options.

Summary Heading: Great location, pleasant and helpful front desk, everything else was awful
Summary: Bad: Very dirty room. Plumbing was a joke, never know if water will be hot or cold regardless of which handle is turned, shower terrible. Very noisy heater. Breakfast was useless. Bug bites after sleeping on the bed. Bad traffic noise. Good: Easy walk to the parks, Convenience store right next door. Pleasant front desk. Allowed me to leave my car there after I checked out.

Summary Heading: Price wise the Travelodge was ok... the beds were too hard...
Summary: Price wise the Travelodge was ok... the beds were too hard for my liking... i felt like i slept on the floor for 2 nights but i guess you get what you pay for. Overall the stay was ok i didnt like the fact that when i needed more towels they said to come to the front desk to pick them up. The continental breakfast was good, i will give them that also the glow in the dark art on the ceiling was pretty awesome to look at when i was falling asleep but other than that it was an ok stay.

I loved the location !! Close to all highways and attractions. Noise from neighbors was a slight problem, but nothing you can control. First room I checked into had no hot water and had a roach. Second room I was in after my family was moved was better, but mold stains on the ceiling and found another roach the following morning. Key cards had to get reprogrammed after my second night for some reason. Internet was slow in room and on lobby computer. Staff was always helpful and courteous.  Parking lot gets full too quick. Had to walk a distance with two small kids sleeping in the cold, but again I understand first come first serve and out of your control.

We stayed here when we went to Disneyland. It is located at the intersection where you turn off the main road to get to the Disneyland Resort. Some people may walk it, and it's certainly closeby, but it still a long walk if you're planning on spending the day in the park(s).  Our room was spacious and clean, and the window even opened. The window screen was coming off at one corner and had no protective bars -- since we have a 2 and a 4 year old we kept it closed because a young child could easily fall out (and we were on the 3rd floor).  The best part about this place is the INCREDIBLE views of the fireworks. We sat the at table and chairs in our room and watched them out the window.  Pros: Large room with fridge, hair dryer, coffee maker. Comfy beds Clean room, no smoke smell

The stay at this Travel Lodge was better than the one we stayed at in Yuma, AZ. There were only a couple things that we felt were needed to be taken care of.  1.  They need to change the carpet.  The padding was balled up in a few places that were hard mounds under the carpet.  2.  The pillows were like sleeping on concrete.  They are large, but very hard. 3.  They should have some kind of shuttle service to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Nice room and everyone was very nice, continental breakfast...
Summary: Nice room and everyone was very nice, continental breakfast and it was perfect because you only had to walk half a mile to get to Disneyland. The only thing is that at night there was too much noise from the other guests.

Summary Heading: No longer good value for the price
Summary: Had a good stay here a year ago, so came back, though the price had literally doubled (from $60 to $119/night).  We won't be back.  Positive:  The staff was extremely nice, Disney fireworks viewable from the property, easy process for printing boarding passes.  Negative:  We were checked into the wrong type of room and frightened awake by another customer who'd been checked into the same room and tried to get in about 10:30 pm; fortunately, there was a security lock.  Hairdryer didn't work until the 3rd day, despite our reporting the problem three times; they finally replaced it with a new one that did work.  People running on the walkway and floor above were really loud. There was only fruit at breakfast two of four mornings; "juice" was fake, no milk available, but I do like

I booked this hotel because it was near Disneyland and one of the more affordable hotels in the area. I will never stay there again. First of all, there was construction going on directly outside our window just feet from our bed. We asked to switch rooms because of this, and the lady working the front desk refused. She also told me it would be finished before the next day so that we wouldnt wake up to the noise. That was a lie. We woke up to the sound of jack hammers 5 feet away. The room was dirty, carpet ripped, hairs in the bathroom. The walls were extremely thin, we couldnt sleep because the people dirtectly above us were walking around all night, banging on the walls, etc.   I was very disappointed with this hotel, and was even embarrassed because it was my boyfriends

One of 3 families to select your lodge.  All three have more complaints than compliments. Front desk staff  not helpful at all upon check in. First time here and to Disney theme parks.  I asked how to get to tram, she replied it’s behind those buildings. No details. Just pointed to the other 5 hotels across the street. When I asked for direction and the best way to get there, without t looking up, she handed me a business card with a map.  Room was very average, carpet old Microwave did not function to standard Liked the blackout curtains Towels were old and rough, cleaning did not leave enough for 3, only 2. Bathroom - very dated, liked the curtain bar, it allowed more shoulder room. The black light effect very creepy and little to 70’s. Wi fi passwords did not work. Could not

It's a basic Travelodge with basic amenities.  This one is a bit run down.  Lots of wear and tear inside the room that really could use some attention.  Shower head was at belly button level and water kept going hot then cold.

Summary Heading: Toilet leaked, shower ran hot/cold. carpet dirty, holes in...
Summary: Toilet leaked, shower ran hot/cold. carpet dirty, holes in bed sheets. Bed and pillows were very uncomfortable.  The info i read said it had been updated in 2010.  I guess that mean't it had a vizio flat screen TV?!  The price was good and it was very close to Disneyland however very disappointed in the rooms.  Will not stay in that Travelodge again.

Summary Heading: This is a budget hotel if you need something fancy don't book here.
Summary: The place looks better on the outside. The inside can use some upgrades. It has a very old and ugly microwave and fridge that freezes anything you put there. The mirror and nightstand is outdated as well as the bathroom. The room on the other hand is huge and yes you can hear the outside noise as well as the upstairs guests. The walk to Disneyland is 4 looooooooong blocks. You can either walk for 10 minutes or take a bus. The Disneyland parking lot is 1 long block away. The breakfast consist of cheep doughnuts coffee, sugar frosted flakes cereal as well as raisin brand cereal and orange juice from the machine. No fruit of any kind or yougurts. So again if your on a family budget it's a great place to stay if you don't mind what I described. You get what you pay for! If you want

Summary Heading: double charge in to my account
Summary: I stayed three days at your anaheim facility using one room and now i checked my bank account you did double chatge in to my account. Please review the charges and give my money back

Very close proximity to Disneyland and easy access for the freeways. I'd recommend this. The beds are comfortable although the carpets needs attention.Breakfast was OK. Staff was friendly and helpful. Frondesk staff was also helpful and friendly.

Very nice hotel, the rooms were very clean, breakfast was good and filling.  The spa was super.  I recomment this hotel to anyone.  The only thing is, it is not walking distance to Disneyland, we walked and we were exhausted on the way back.  I recommend a shuttle or taxi.

When I first got to the hotel It was a little too early to check in. The lady at the front desk said it was fine. I handed her my papers I printed online after I booked the hotel room. It had my name conformation number etc. She looked me up by name and I was not in the computer. She insisted on telling me I was at the wrong location and instead of calling the main 1-800 number to ask, she called around to other travelodges in the area first. Then she said well they don’t have you on file either, but we have rooms open if you want to stay here. I said well I do not want to get charged twice so I asked her to call the 1-800 so she finally called and sure enough I was booked at the right Travelodge. She had to enter me into the computer since I didn’t show up automatically.

Not very clean Back side of Disneyland (walk pretty far) Old motel Reservations for two rooms not accurate Couldn't get in one room, night clerk asked if we wanted different room??? Night clerk was more attentive to guy with broken down truck, than paying customer. 1st breakfast, very little choices.  2nd day breakfast was better. Black light at night stand to accentuate black light stain on ceiling for ambience (felt like a seen from a CSI episode) Someone knocked on door in mddle of night as well as phone call with no answer The rooms are large, with fridge, microwave and free parking, and internet Failed to give us internet password for the two days. great view of fireworks, however very noisy if you're not interested in them.

We arrived at the hotel around 7pm to check in and found the man behind the desk on his cell phone.  He greeted us and we began the usual check-in process.  We asked that he had us down for 2 rooms and he confirmed "Yes, two rooms), and then handed us keys to ONE room.  When we questioned him he became defensive and essentially said it was our fault because he said we didn't give the other name... He didn't ask for another name.  We went up to our adjoining rooms and for one room, the keys were not working.  My friend went down to the front desk to tell him, and as she was explaining it another man walked up to ask if he could keep his broken-down truck in the parking lot until the morning.  The man behind the front desk attended to this man before my friend, even though she was

Room was clean upon arrival but in very poor condition, rugs were damaged' looked like someone placed a hot iron on the floor with a terrible patch repair. Towels were clean but didn't get replaced the first two nights, onbly removed the dirty ones. Bedding was old and dark, looked like a motel set from the 70's. All we used the room for was sleep and shower, it worked for that, but far from a nice place

This motel is located on the backside of Disneyland. There was at least a half-mile walk to get to the tram/downtown Disney. When the Disney fireworks went off I thought that a truck had hit the building. The motel is so close to where the fireworks are set off that it felt as if they were being set off from the parking lot! I had gone to bed early because I became ill and that first firework woke me up real fast! The free breakfast was "OK": hard-boiled eggs, sliced bananas, cereal with milk, juices, coffee, toast, bagels, and sweet rolls.

This hotel is walking distance to the tram location of Disneyland.  It has great staff and is incredibly clean.  The hotel is showing its age with many amenities starting to show their age  (ie. a faucet that doesn't turn off in the bathroom).  Saying all that, it is one of the cleanest hotels that you can find in the Disneyland area.  The sleeping under the stars "concept" that they have with the black lights on the ceiling is great and fun for the kids.
Little farther than i would have liked from Disney land but an awesome price for the 4 rooms for two nights slept 21 of us :o)
It was a good stay and close to Disneyland. Rooms were decent for the price and decent breakfast. It was overall a good stay and I would recommend it to others staying in the area.
our room was nice and big, clean and close to where we wanted to go. Will stay here again next time were in california.
Breakfast was great neighbor rooms where noisey pool and hot tub ehrenberg after day I'm park wish it was open later

Summary Heading: Ok for the price but beds are really bad
Summary: They show they just remodeled the rooms but all they did was get new furniture and and bedspread from what I can tell.  The sheets were really bad and the mattresses were so old they were stained on the sides.  For that reason I would not stay there again until they get new ones.  After a long day at Disneyland you need comfort and those were not at all.  Good price and shuttle right in front of the hotel for $4.00 per day.  Breakfast pretty good for free and Jack in the Box is right next door.  About 3 long blocks from the main gate so you can walk if you prefer.  We found the shuttle the best way after walking all day.  Pool was really small but at least we got to cool off.  The staff are not very friendly at first but warmed up later.

We have stayed here frequently (a lot) over the last few years. Everything about this place is top notch. The rooms are clean and well equipped . The staff is always friendly and ready to please. Let's face it, you can't get a better location for your family visit to Disneyland!
Overall it was a nice stay at the hotel. The staff were nice. I liked the room except for what it seemed to be a blood stain on the wall. But i was quiet and a good room to stay for a couple of days.

We arrived on a Wednesday for our trip to Universal Studios and Disneyland. It was such a great time. The person taking care of the front desk was very helpful and courteous. We needed towels and extra blankets, we had no problem in getting them because of the helpful staff. I will definitely use Travelodge again.

Nice clean rooms, affordable and close to attractions. Perfect if you are looking for a good value. However with lots of families staying at this location it did get rather noisy, if you are looking for a quiet room this is probably not a good location to stay at.

Great room, clean, the only thing wrong with the stay was the mattress pad. It moved around on the bed. The 1st night it bunched up under us and was hard where it became folded underneath the sheet. the 2nd night we made sure it was in place on the mattress and again it bunched up. the 3rd night we took it off the bed and folded it up and were able to sleep without it bunching up and causing sleepless moments. Suggest the mattress pad be one that , has straps or something to keep it in place, while on the bed. If we stay again we will check the pad 1st and remove it, can't take that bunching up under us.

Manager was very nice and helpful, but room was very run down.  Bathroom light fixture was missing the cover.  Dresser drawers wouldn't stay closed and television channels were very limited.  Outside the hotel looked nice and pictures looked good, but once you started walking down the hall you realized that it wasn't what it looked like initially.   I would not be able to recommend this hotel or stay there again.

okay, i will admit i was put off by some of the negative reviews, but let me tell you that this place was so great for such a cheap price! it was a bit of a walk to the disneyland tram, which sucked after a long day of walking between disneyland and california adventure, but it was still doable. the breakfast could have been a little better, but any time that i don't have to pay extra for breakfast is AWESOME!   the rooms were clean and the beds were so comfortable. after a long day on the road, it was nice to pile into bed. the starry sky ceilings were so incredible. it was one of the best parts! btw that's what the black light is for, you pervs. but the best part was the view of the fireworks. i went to disneyland last year and we stayed at the anabella. let me tell you that

This is the hotel we stay at when we go to Disneyland.  The rooms are clean, it's a close walk, the gas station is right there for snacks or soda and you get free continential breakfast in the morning.

We arrived prior to check in, and yet we were able to check-in and a room was readily available. The room was very clean and open. The bed was large and extremely comfortable!  which was exactly what we needed after a day at Disneyland! A good nights sleep!!!
Not far from Disneyland. Been there before (2009) back then the quality of the rooms was better than this time (2012). Seems that nobody cares really about them...

Booked a last minute trip and this place came through. It was clean, it had a blacklight in the room and glow in the dark "stars" on the ceilings. The one queen room was VERY large, had a fridge, hair dryer and single cup coffee maker. We found the room to be clean and smell somewhat fresh. There were mickey mouse prints on the wall. The AC unit worked fine and was easy to turn on. It cooled the room quickly. They had a typical free continental breakfast in a cafeteria style setting which was decent. Especially if you are in a larger group with multiple rooms and you want to all rendezvous in a central spot before you head out. There wasn't too much that I could find wrong with the room. The TV was small and outdated(though the advertisement in the hotel lobby shows otherwise).

Hotel had a very good price. The room was quite dark in my opinion and the air conditioning did not have a good appearance. The tube had no curtains on the first night which let it terrible after shower (curtains were installed on the following day). The height of the shower is terrible (too low).

Our stay at this hotel was very pleasant. Great staff to greet us as we arrived around 1:00 am Saturday morning. Our room key did not work so the attendant walked down to make sure it had been re-programed right. Great location to Disneyland and great rates. Rooms were very clean. Love the ceilings :)

We stayed here for one night because we arrived late afternoon before moving to an onsite Disneyland hotel. Positives: good value, near Disneyland $6-7 cab ride or near ART, easy walking for mobile adults, friendly front desk, free simple breakfast. Negatives: Disney fireworks are LOUD but my son is a sound sleeper, no blackout curtains so couldn't really see the glow-in-the-dark stars on the ceiling but then again we were facing the always-lit pool, dark green carpet so wasn't sure how clean it was.

this is by far the worst travel lodge i have ever stayed at. there was stains on my sheets/comforter, there was homeless people sleeping on property. the towels felt like sand paper. the staff was very unpleasant to work with, as if they didnt care about the guest needs at all. Even after i had the maids remake our beds, the comforter was still stained!!!! Having kids in this environment was not the best feeling as a parent. We extended our stay at disneyland but move across the street to days inn, a much better experience over there. This stay was a total disappointment, we have enjoyed travel lodge at many other locations but anaheim is just a plain DUMP. OH and not to mention we had no hot water when we came back the second night...my kids were filthy from DL all day and had

Summary Heading: Great price for a very good hotel
Summary: First off, the two ladies at the desk were very nice and pleasant going out of their way to be especially nice to my two children.  The room was very clean and nice but the nicest surprise was at night when the lights are out there were stars painted on the ceiling which my kids loved!  It was such a nice way to close out the busy day at Disneyland.  We will definitely return in the future!

This was the perfect place to stay to visit Disneyland, which is within walking distance. We even saw the fireworks show from the steps outside our room! It was clean and comfortable, and best of all, very reasonably priced! Will come back.

This stay at this hotel was ok no resturants in walking distance. The shower sucked water temperture would go really hot to really cold. the drawers to put your clothes in not enough room. Parking wasnt good either.

Summary Heading: Perfect place for a Disney trip
Summary: The hotel is perfectly located to pull out of their driveway and immediately be on the road to the Mickey and Friends parking lot. Very friendly staff, very clean rooms. The ceiling at night is ALWAYS cool. Well done.

I suppose you get what you pay for and my trying to save money didn't serve me this time. Upon our arrival we waited 10 mintues at the front desk for the cleark to finish his break in the office right behind the desk. The property looked dirty and run down. Imagin our surprise when we entered our room and found that it was equipped a black light near the bed. A little tacky, right? But it turned out useful useful for making suresure the sheets were clean. They checked out fine. It was even more awesome when after allowing housekeeping to come in and clean the room a phone charger we know we had put away was missing. After looking through our things we found that it had been plugged into an outlet for housekeeping's use. I wonder what else of ours they thought it was appropriate

Summary Heading: it worked for a quick trip
Summary: All in all it was okay.  The air did not work to great but the room was nice size, breakfast was good, towels definitely need replacing very thin.  Pool and jacuzzi very nice.....
Great stay! Very. Close to Disneyland. Walking distance from parks. Clean and confortable. Would recommend and stay here again
Stayed for a disney trip. Pleace was great although when we got to room maid was still cleaning it. Had to wait about 10 minutes. Other than that great for what you pay for.
The bathroom door was , so we couldn't shut the door. My daughter was locked in. the toilet didn't flush. I had to take the top off the toilet and manually pull the lever. Air conditioner didn't work

Summary Heading: Not a great place to stay
Summary: Maybe I'm expecting too much for the Disneyland area, but this hotel was not a great place, especially for the price.  I've stayed at other hotels in the area that were the same price or cheaper and had a better experience.  Pluses: Great view of the Disneyland fireworks. Nice flat screen TV  Minuses: -Not close enough to Disneyland to comfortably walk to the gate (about a mile) -No shuttle to Disneyland.  They expect you to walk to the Disneyland parking tram (about 0.6 miles walking although the parking structure is just across the street), which drops you off still about 0.2 miles from the entrance to the park, saving you a grand total of about 0.2 miles. -Not all that clean.  There were dark marks in our bathtub.  The fixtures in the bathroom seemed to be on their last legs,

Summary Heading: We got what we paid for!
Summary: My son and I stayed at the Travelodge in May, our room was exactly what we booked and paid for, it was comfortable, had a flat screen tv and refrigerator, ample off street parking, and it is close to the Anaheim attractions. I didn't stay there to be close to Disneyland, as that didn't interest me, but I chose this hotel as it is in Anaheim, where I like to be based in Los Angeles, due to its close proximity to the I-5 freeway and the Angels baseball stadium. We stayed for 5 days, found the staff to be friendly and gave us good advice regarding what we wanted to do and see, they provide a continental breakfast, and have a large swimming pool which was clean and well maintained. A real plus is having a 24 hour gas station that sells the basics right next door, that was very

We stayed here for one night before we headed to the Grand Californian.  It was easy to get to, however, be aware that there are two Travelodge hotels within 10 miles of eachother.  Our taxi driver dropped us off at the wrong one :(  It was nice that they had a continental breakfast but you weren't allowed to toast your bagels in their toaster, which is weird and annoying.  It's not bad, but for the same price you can get a better hotel within the same distance from the park.

This hotel is ABSOLUTELY DISGUSTING.. the pictures online don't seem so bad, and it's a really good price, but it was awful. Me and my husband decided to stay here because we were on a budget, when we got here, the staff in the lobby could barely speak English but gave us our room, which was actually in the back of the building. The room had barely any lighting and a black light next to the bed, which wasn't a good sign to me. It was very very dirty and the bed was terrible. When it got darker, we turned on the black light, and everything we saw in the room was so bad, we had to get out of there. Not to mention, the prostitutes and sketchy people hanging around in the back, near our rental car. They claim to have security but we never saw any security walking around. We checked

We spent 2 nights at the Travelodge on W. Ball Road in Anaheim and booked 3 rooms.  Overall it was clean and well presented.  The staff were very friendly and knowledgeable about the Resort.  They let us leave our bags at the front desk several hours before check in while we went to the Angels baseball game.  Parking was plentiful and easy.  Having stayed at other hotels around the Resort area, this one had a few drawbacks.  It is a 1/2 mile to the Mickey & Friends parking lot to catch a free tram to the Parks.  Otherwise, you walk about a mile.  A taxi ride is about $7.00. Towels were very thin and rough.  Shower heads are very low.  Our shower had difficulty switching from bath to shower.  Would stay here again but only if properties across from the Park entrance were

My family and I are annual pass holders and have stayed at many motels and hotels within the vicinity of Disneyland. I should preface this review that we also have our own car when we visit so we are able to eat and shop at places around the area instead of buying things at this hotel or having to order delivery to the room which is a little more expensive. Pros: cost efficient, clean, big not freezing pool and jacuzzi, fellow guests were quiet and respectful, free continental breakfast, free wi-fi and parking, right behind a convienence store with great gas prices, close to parking structure and if your good with walking multiple miles a day, you could probably walk to the park in about 15 minutes via a walkway on a small park overpass. We have free parking with our passes and

Summary Heading: Loved the stars on the ceiling
Summary: My daughter loved the Disney princess pictures on wall and the star effect on ceiling when you turned off lights. Bathroom nice and clean, beds comfy clean carpets and rooms cleaned everyday.  We had a sofa bed which when made up was a bit dangerous as our daughter reached under bed to get a toy and cut her arm must have been from a bit of metal or spring hanging down! We just kept the kids away from it. Warning when fireworks start at 9.30pm the noise is very loud we got a shock till we realised what it was. Also we were on second floor next to concrete stairs and we were woken up when some inconsiderate person bounced their case down these stairs at 6am ! We drove to Disney and was literally 5 mins away but the last day we walked and thought glad we had a car! Also having a

Summary Heading: NOT Eco friendly! With a few tweaks, this hotel could be better.
Summary: We were looking for an affordable stay close to Disneyland and this hotel fit the budget well. The stay was ok - we were really too busy with the attractions nearby to use all of what the hotel had to offer.   The positive was that it was clean and relatively quiet. Also, it was close to the park - although their advertising is misleading - it is not a short walk to the Disney Tram - far from it! Walking there in the morning is ok, if you don't mind a mile warm up walk before hitting the parks. After a full day at Disney though - ugh! Better off to walk to the Taxi station at the end of Downtown Disney and take a cab - that will be cheap (under $8). To Travelodge's benefit, the staff said a Taxi was an option. In fact, the staff at the hotel was very nice and helpful...another
Had a great time on a budget!! Would recommend this to anyone that wants to be close to Disneyland and on a budget

I stayed at this outdated but clean motel for a few days while visiting Disneyland and L.A. Although it is advertised as walking distance to Disneyland be warned it's around a 20 minute walk up Disneyland drive. This was fine for us as it was just the two of us, the weather was comfortable and we don't mind a walk but it could be a struggle for families or in hot weather. The parking lot tram is nearby but not that easy to get too, we found it easier to walk.  The room was clean and comfortable, bed was fine and we got a goods night sleep. TV was old and didn't have many channels. Bathroom was clean with no problems with hot water and water pressure. We didn't get the chance to check out the pool. Despite being near the freeway the room was quiet. Front desk staff were helpful

Summary Heading: Average motel stay for a night or two
Summary: Travelodge is located right next to Disneyland, great for families who want a Disney day out.  Besides that, there's nothing much in the area, so it would be best if you had a car.  Wal-Mart and such is just an exit away on Euclid, very convenient.   Had a family room for five, 2 double beds and a sofa bed.  Room was spacious enough for all 5 people to be walking around, bathroom was a bit old though.  Beds and pillows were too soft as well, but as we only stayed for 2 nights, it was bearable.  Breakfast was so-so, quite cramped if there is a queue and people in front of you take too long to decide what they want to eat.  Choices are basic, a few kinds of pastries, cereal, juice, toast, tea and coffee.  The only thing worth mentioning about this place is that it provided free

This  motel's rooms need an upgrade now!  Furniture is very old , bathroom and room walls are scraped and paint us peeling . Water in the shower was draining very slow. This motel is in very poor condition . The only good thing is its only less than 10 min drive to Disneyland

Just returned from the Travelodge on W. Ball Road, I was overcharged for my room, The pool was not heated, and totally in the shade. The security system in place for the room I stayed in consisted of a stick in the window. The walk to Disneyland is a good 25 minutes from this place and totally dark in the evening. Other than the convenience store next door, you are completely isolated from everything. My veiw was an ugly parking lot, asked if I could change rooms, but told NO.  Front desk asian man was totally uniformed of every single question I asked, it turned out to be such a joke, my daughter was asking me to go and ask him something else just so she could get a laugh. The housekeepers were great, but thats about the only thing. Horrible spot for for single woman with

Summary Heading: "Just Across the Street From Disneyland," well not really...
Summary: Travelodge, with its sleepy bear mascot, is a low budget, low expectation type of family option for those looking to spend their money at Disneyland--where it’s not so cheap. As a motel, this is as base as it gets; beds and shower and a place to stash your luggage. If you drive to Anaheim, the parking there is free and seems to be plentiful. But to stay here, you need to have your ducks in a row or, like us, you will literally walk your heels right off the bone. 	At the time we visited (during Rodeo Days in Tucson--especially sweet since the only people at Disney are wearing Wildcat gear), their little breakfast room was being rebuilt, but the offerings were enough to count as free breakfast. Cereal, store bought pastries, fresh fruit, juice, milk, coffee, tea will fuel you up

We were spending a few days in Disneyland and this hotel was exactly what we were after. The room itself was quite spacious and clean which was great. It was walkable to Disneyland but we caught the bus instead which left from right outside the hotel. The staff were friendly and the complimentary breakfast wasn't too bad either (continental). definitely a more affordable option than staying at Disneyland itself.

Simple. Close. Cheap. No frills here, just a clean room with proximity to the park. I like these kind of hotels because I get exactly what I want. I don't care too much for room service or fancy furniture. I only use the room to store my stuff and shower and sleep. Thee few bad things are there computer in the lobby is (as of 1/15/12) was filled with viruses. I forgot a personal item (KIA bracelet) in my room, called the manager but they refused to mail it to me. I even offered to pay in advance. So that upset me. Good stay, although for the service and treatment after I checked out, I will not be staying here again.

we spent four days and it was a very good value for money. The room was enormous and comfortable. I was woorried being on the main street side i would hear traffic all night but i didnt. The morning breakfast was excellent and the place was spotless. When i first arrived i thought i had lost my purse in the office and then i found it in my room. Later the front desk called to check in and remined me about breakfast. I thought that was veru considerate of the front desk clerk to be concerned. The only problem i had was the last night a new family arrived and made a lot of noise. I did call down to the front desk and they apologized but its not really their fault.

my husband and I, two teenage daughters and eight year son stayed here for eleven nights over christmas 2010.  We had a starlight room which I had requested upon booking on-line and found this to be lovely.  Every day started with an adequate breakfast of donuts, cereal, pastries, fruit, toast, juice and coffee.  This was included in the low price. The hotel has a lovely heated pool and spa which we enjoyed every day.  My son actually learnt how to swim here.  Although this property is old and could do with a make-over, we were very happy here.  The rooms were clean and comfortable and with two double beds and a couch we all could fit in easily.   The walk to disneyland was short.  We will be back..for more.

This is my second stay at the Travelodge Anaheim on Disneyland Way. I always stay here because it is affordable and walking distance to Disneyland. The rooms are clean, the staff is friendly, and it has a pool. If you can't afford to stay at the Disneyland resort and do not mind a short walk this is the perfect place to stay!.

I looked at all the reviews before I stayed so I had an idea of what to expect. There were no stains on the sheets or bedbugs as others have reviewed. I gave it a 5 star review because for the price (and location), you CAN'T beat it! It's true that the hotel needs updating but who cares if all your doing is spending the night (or a couple). If I paid more I would have expected more but I didn't. The continental breakfast was what I expected, toast, a couple danishes, juice, milk, coffee. I thought it was awesome that we could fill up for breakfast for "free". We walked from the hotel to the Disneyland parking (free) tram both morning and night, as late as 10:30pm and we felt perfectly safe. The hotel staff was also very nice and helpful. PLUS, we got there at 10:30am and were

My girlfriend and I went on a trip to Disneyland (like any girl, she loves the magic kingdom and always wants to visit).  We was still in school and we wanted to keep the costs down a bit.  we found the Travelodge on Disneyland drive to be a perfect solution.  It's right down the road from the park and was clean and affordable.  the pool and hot tub were a nice relaxing break at the end of long days of walking.  I recommend this hotel to folks looking to save a few bucks without sacrificing the quality of their vacation. The Travelodge brand and standards are well maintained here!

Summary Heading: Best place to stay to go to Disneyland
Summary: I stayed here as it was so close to Disneyland and I didn't want to pay the crazy prices at the disneyland hotel.  It was a great place and the staff was very friendly and helpful.

We stayed here two nights while in the area.  The room was large and had a hide away bed in the small couch.  The room seemed okay, but when it was time to fold down the sheets, there seemed to be a stain of some sort on the sheets.  It looked like speckles of blood close to the top of the bed.  As it was late when this was discovered, I took a towel to cover and then requested the sheets be changed the next morning.  The clerk behind the desk said he was very sorry and the sheets were changed that day.  The frig in our room was noisy and we had to unplug to get some sleep.  I found that the towels when not the softest, but again, we are staying at a travelodge.  We did not use the pool, but the area looked small.  This was not the cleaness hotel, but not the dirtiest either.  I

I was a little bit skeptical when looking at this place after reading some of the reviews people had posted. As the time got closer to our Disneyland trip, prices on other places started going up or became unavailable after being fully booked. I was determined to make it work when I saw I was still able to get a room with 2 queen beds for $79. There was plenty of parking. I was even able to get a spot almost directly in front of our room at almost 5 p.m. Check in was easy and took all of 5 minutes. Honestly, the people on here nit picking about every little dust partical on the floor or a sheet with a crease in the wrong place needs to get off their high horse. The place was clean and the fact they had Disney pictures on the wall was a cute touch. Even better, the black light

Summary Heading: Good place to stay on a tight budget but you get what you pay for.
Summary: The good: location, price, quality towels, friendly staff who gave us early check in, nice beds, soft pillows.  The bad:  very outdated rooms in,need of a paint job, musty smell, very old building, the blacklights in the room threw me off at first but we realized it was for viewing stars on the ceiling.    Not the worst place I have ever stayed, but for the price I would stay again if it was for a short trip on a budget!

Summary Heading: If cleanliness matters to you, don't stay here
Summary: I chose this hotel because of it's proximity to Disneyland, specifically to the start of the Disneyland Half Marathon and it's price. It definitely proves the old age "you get what you pay for".  The room was large and the hotel is within walking distance to the Disneyland Resort but other than that it has little going for it.    I like to take an epsom salts bath after a half marathon but the bathtub was horrible. If I hadn't unpacked before I discovered that there was a bathmat stuck to the bottom of the tub that when peeled back revealed horrible black mildew underneath, I would have asked for another room or checked out altogether.    I'm not a cleanliness freak but I think it's gross when my feet are black from walking on the carpet (black dirt washed off my feet in a

ive read good and bad reviews for this hotel.  maybe i got the lucky room (203), the carpet was fine , bathroom was good , i didn't mind the rubber mattress cover.  they only left 1 towel in the shower but that was quickly resolved with a call.  it was a good 3 nites.  it was a little farther from the disneyland entrance than i like to be.  getting tho DL and back was an easy walk or tram, but its hot in the afternoon.  the fireworks were closer than if you see them in the park.  the continental breakfast was ok.  all in all it was fine.  it wasnt a 5 star  experience but it wasnt $300 a nite either.

Overall a good experience. We were there to visit Disneyland, not necessarily looking for luxury.  Im sure that there are nicer hotels in the area but for the price it surpassed our expectations.  The staff was very helpful, breakfast was good and it was nice that the pool was not too full.  Rooms were clean, and parking right outside the door.  Disneyland is close but just pay for parking its worth it.

Summary Heading: you will be stolen in the room
Summary: Travelodge Anaheim Inn,,,this is bad bad hotel i had never have. I lost my three luggage in this hotel, the insurance from this hotel did not pay me anything back. can you image that happened? be safe pleae do not live there

Summary Heading: Great motel- clean, comfortable, & so close to Disney
Summary: This is a great hotel to consider if you are visiting Disneyland in LA. There is plenty of parking, elevators & the overall property is in a clean condition. We had a room with 3x Queen Beds (was booked early) which was a great way to end a 2 week fly-drive as both my kids could have a large bed each. An impressive feature is the 'starlight' effect in the rooms- when the lights are turned off, the ceiling has been painted to give a really good impression of sleeping under the stars & the milky way!  The hotel provides a well stocked complimentary breakfast, & has a coffee machine in the room as well.  Our room had a balcony facing Disneyland, & it was great to watch the impressive fireworks from the hotel the night before our 1st day at the actual park.  Disneyland is walkable

Great price, location, and parking.  Only 3 drawbacks:  (1)  The beds are stiff and the bottom sheet is just a flat sheet that comes untucked all night long.  If you were as tired as I was from a day at Disney, you really didn't care too much.  (2)  if there are a lot of people using the internet, you have a difficult time connecting.  (3)  I woke up with bites all over my right side.  I am guessing they are spider bites.  Other than that, it is a decent place to stay for around a hundred bucks.

Summary Heading: Very decent hotel, would stay again..
Summary: The price was definitely right with this hotel and all of the options were there. The staff was always very friendly when we needed anything, and the amenities were also a welcome bonus. (free breakfast, parking, internet) The distance to all of our destinations including the Land of the Mouse, were excellent! The one thing that took me back at first was the black light in the room, in that it made me question why would a room need a built in black light. As we turned off the lights I realized that the ceiling was littered with those glow in the dark stars: mystery solved!   The only gripes we has were the following: the bed(s) were stiff, but nothing that a long day of running around wouldn't cure (aka we passed out on contact) One of the nights I had a small non threatening

After reading other reviews, I wasn't sure what to expect. Traveling with our 2 children 2 & 9 to Disneyland, I gave it a shot. Others on here clearly have high expectations and should be paying hundreds for their need of quality. Customer service was great, rooms were clean, kids loved the glow in the dark stars, hotel was close to everything and easily accessible, breakfast was simple and easy. If you want feathered down pillows with room service, pay more and get it. If you want an updated marble topped, plush carpeted, ritzy hotel, pay more and get it! This is a family oriented, older, but nice hotel that I would recommend to anyone on a budget looking for a hotel to sleep in and spend the days at Disneyland. Perfect for us!

Our entire family (kids and grandkids) were at Disneyland last weekend, we stayed 3 days and booked 3 rooms. I wanted to stay in a nice Hotel. but my kids were on a limited budget. So we choose to stay here. I was a litte scared of what it would be like, and I have to say I was pleasantly surprised. The rooms were HUGE, and they were CLEAN, this was by no means a luxury hotel, but you had everything you needed and was clean and comforatble. the free breakfast had the basics and got you on your way in the morning. you can walk to Disneyland from there and that was a terrific. The only complaint I had is that there are no places to eat within walking distance. The parking lot at hotel fills up fast, and if you moved your car it was hard to find another spot

We went to Disneyland for three day vacation.  Like: The hotel is in walking distance to Disneyland  Free Internet/parking/breakfast (very simple, but sufficient) Friendly staff 7/24 Laundary facility

Summary Heading: Great location, great value, great place to stay!
Summary: My mother, best friend, and I plan a yearly girls trip to Disneyland. We have tried other hotels in the area, but have found this to always be the best one. It is a 10 minute walk from Downtown Disney/Disneyland. We have never take a shuttle or tram since we have always been able to walk due to it being so close. The rooms are big, clean, and comfy. They all have a fridge, mircowave, and wireless internet which are all three necessities for us. There is a Continential Breakfast every morning which is also another conveinence. Also, the icing on the cake, you can't beat the price!!! Always one of the best priced hotels in the area! Great customer service too! Will always stay here!

Summary Heading: Horrible customer service, would not stay again..old looking room and dusty beds and furniture!
Summary: In the room the beds don't have proper covering, and appear to have bed bugs on them. The hispanic girl at the check in, has an attitude and couldn't find my reservation! I had to call customer service to give her my reservation number. Themicrowave bed, and furniture scream cheap hotel from the 70's!!! I will not stay again! The room smelled, and its hard to find your room! This is a undesirable hotel for families with kids, its not a comfortable place at all! Your better off in a hotel with indoor hallways. This hotel needs to rebuilt too as well!  :(

Last stayed here in 2005, and had no  problems.  My recent stay was the week of 4/10/11, and went fine.  Didn't initially try to book here, because smoking rooms weren't shown on any of the travel sites. After reviewing all of the *total dives* that did show smoking rooms, I called to find out if they had shut down their smoking rooms. It turns out that they only have five, so you have to call and book directly in order to get smoking rooms.  Staff were friendly, rooms were clean, and housekeeping did an awesome job every day of my stay.  TV has precious few channels now, but I wasn't there to watch TV, and the local news was available on a couple of those channels.  Continental breakfast has moved, (since '05), into a new room just behind the office that's a lot cleaner &

We stayed here in Sept 2010. We booked a standard room that contained 2 comfortable queen beds, with very flat pillows. we asked for extra pillows, but they never arrived. Room had an ironing board, coffee maker, fridge and microwave, and free wifi internet.. The room didn't have enough pillows, tea, or microwave dishes. The bathroom was tiny, but had a bath. The rate included breakfast, which was good - cereal, fruit, toast and a small variety of muffins. The hotel has a pool and at night we were able to see the fireworks from Disneyland. It is only a short 15 minute walk to the Disneyland shuttle. Next door is a petrol station that has a snack area and next to that is Sheraton Anaheim that has two restaurants. Reception staff were wonderful and even stored our bags on the last

The good:  Next door to Disneyland for under 1 Franklin (compared to over 5 times as much at the Disney hotels).  Kind and courteous staff, but they do not go out of their way for the service award -- tried to check in early for 2 rooms but not cleaned, assured we could check in late as the rooms were prepaid, returned to learn that one room was on the ground floor and the other on the third (would have thought that they would have held two rooms next to each other when we inquired first thing in the morning).  Breakfast option is convenient when you rather spend time in line for the rides rather than getting eats but Spartan (2 types of cold cereal, 2 types of canned fruit in heavy syrup, toast, danish, juice, milk, coffee).  Glitter stars on the ceiling was fun as well as the

Just a short walk from Disneyland-about 10 minutes or so. Rooms were pretty basic but clean and just what we needed. The stars on the ceiling were a lot of fun:-). Great value at Disney, I would recommend.

Summary Heading: The only good thing was the location
Summary: This hotel was not one I will stay at again.  I had a room with 2 beds & a sleeper sofa & no pillows were provided for the sofa bed & the hotel did not have any extras.  They also claim to offer free internet but you can never get on their server.

Summary Heading: Good Location, Big but Dirty Rooms
Summary: Stayed at this hotel for our visit to Disneyland. The hotel was relatively close to Disneyland. The rooms were absolutely dirty.  I didn't even want to take a shower in the filthy bathroom. Mildew all over the place and other stuff stuck on the walls.

This place was great..... It's really hard to find a hotel that will accommodate a family of 5 without having to get two rooms..... Their deluxe 2 queen room was perfect and the stars on the ceiling were a HUGE hit with the kids.... Can't wait to stay there again.... :)

The whole thing was a page out of a horror novel.  We checked in, the lobby looked decent but when we went to the room...we were shocked! The doors don't even close properly.  There was 2 double beds instead of the requested King size.  The rooms are dated and dark.  There are plastic covers over the mattresses and black lights in the rooms (apparently to see the glow in the dark stars painted on the ceiling).  Not to mention the police warning that you should not leave any valuables in your car or in your hotel room and  to make sure you lock and alarm all vehicles.  That sure doesn't make you feel very safe! We checked out the first night, found somewhere else to stay.  We had stayed at another Anaheim hotel just last September and neither that hotel or the one we stayed at

If you need a very affordable place walking distance to the Disneyland parks then stay here. Walk took less than 10 minutes to get to Downtown Disneyland, 15 to the front gate. Had a nice looking pool but didn't get a chance to use it. Clean.

Summary Heading: Much Better Than expected.. will be coming back.. family of 6 with 6yr old and 70yr old
Summary: After reading the mixed reviews I was a little nervous. But much to my surprise the room was great. When had 3 queen beds and a starlight (blacklight stars on the roof) room. Everything was very clean. The maid cleaned room, sheet etc everyday.The bathtub was enormous. The water was easily adjustable and never ran out of hot water. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We did have the toliet clog at 330 am but the staff fixed it quietly without waking my sleeping family within 10 mins.The staff also took my 70yr old mothers flight info for LAX and got her a boarding pass online to save time and confusion. The walk to disney was about15 mins to the tram or 20 mins to the start of downtown disney. We walked it with a 70 yr old and a 6 yr old to and from the park for 5 days. The

I got this hotel through an expedia package.  This hotel is one of the cheapest one that was offered at the time.  Since the price I paid was very cheap I had a low expectation at first.  Upon arriving I was pleasantly surprised at the friendly staff, the cleanliness, the location, and the amenities.  Although the decor is a bit dated the hotel gives you great value for your money.  In short, who cares about the decor when you're sleeping.

After reading the reviews I felt like we could take a shot at it. I'm not a hotel snob, and we usually stay in the Anaheim Plaza (unfortunately all the family suites were booked)! From the outside we felt like it was your typical 2 star hotel. The inside was a dumper! The carpet was filthy, the furnishings old and run down, holes in the blankets and sheets, couldn't get a constant temperature in the shower. We had adjoining rooms and my daughter wouldn't even shower in her room because it was rusty and moldy. You can walk to Disney, about a 20 minute walk along a very busy street. Breakfast was pastries and cold cereal, but it was included. Service was average. We will be going back to Anaheim Plaza for sure!!
We had a Great time staying in the Travelodge Anaheim, it is close to Disneyland and the price is great! The place is clean and great customer service! I would definitely stay again at the hotel.

Stayed two nights. Must say that it's very different from what's advertised on the website. Room was dark, furniture was old and carpet was filthy. Bed was uncomfortable albeit clean. Don't bother asking for the starlight room, won't make much of a difference (we had one). Worst was the shower, you can never get the right temperature! The only good thing about this hotel is that it's fairly close to Disneyland. It took us about 30 mins to walk there slowly which was fine for us. Continental breakfast was the typical muffins, toast, cereals, danishes. Didn't try any of it.  Had stayed in other Travelodge hotels before, I must say this one is the worst. Extremely disappointed. Tip: if you're going to stay there, ask for a room away from the road. It can be VERY noisy with passing

Summary Heading: The best surprise of the Trip -brilliant location - exceptional value
Summary: Having never stayed in a Hotel that cost less that $50 a night I was skeptical when my husband wanted to stay here!  I was stunned at what sensational value it was!  Perfect location - could walk to Disneyland but there is also a shuttle right outside!  Breakfast included in the price - great options for breakfast!  Room was very clean, the bed was comfortable and the shower had fantastic water pressure!  Loved it and would stay again in a heartbeat!

The Travelodge Anaheim was very convenient to Disneyland.  The room was clean and smelled nice.  The front desk staff was nice and helpful.  We could hear the Disneyland fireworks (very loud) but our kids slept right through them.  The continental breakfast was good and had a variety of options.  No complaints about the hotel.  We would stay again.

Two nights here for $72 a night - with three double beds in the room for 4 of us.  It was value for money.   Free breakfast included.  It was a good walk to Disneyland, but far enough away from the traffic noise.  The tired legs returning after the day of fun was a bit hard to take, but its my problem, not the hotel.   The room was clean, free parking and free breakfast was a bargain.   Only would recommend a larger eating area as it got a bit crowded with lots of families.  Maybe school holidays was a cause of the crowding, but I'd go another time next time.   Worth it?  Yes, and good value for the money.

I really liked this place. It was very clean: the room, the common areas and the breakfast room were all well maintained. The room was large, the A/C worked fine and the stars on the ceiling were a really cute touch. It was very friendly: the desk clerks actually made small talk, were very pleasant, and procured a first aid kit when I needed it during my stay. It was close to Disneyland: it's a ten minute walk to the Mickey & Friends tram. There's also a small convenience store adjacent to the hotel for late-night snacks, which is helpful.   I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Summary Heading: should have stayed here entire trip!
Summary: My sister and her family booked a room here and midway thru my trip I switched my room to here. The location was confusing, but ask anyone around and they will help you. ( front desk, and or am/pm) Disney is walking distance but you have to ask to figure it out, It was really easy to get turned around in the area. The rooms were  nice and big, and it had glow in the dark stars on the ceiling. The price was great, this hotel is very basic, but really how long are you in the hotel during disney? There really isnt any restaurants close so  eat at the park or run to the grocery store, the fridge has plenty of room. Breakfast was good, and was a good start to the day. I will stay here again because the price was excellent. But you need to be willing to walk or drive to the park.  You

Summary Heading: No running water and attitude to boot
Summary: Ok, I have stayed here once before and we liked it- clean, close enough to the park... so we booked another stay. When we showed up, they informed us at the front desk that there would be no running water in the morning. They said it would be out from 10-5. Uh, no. I have 3 kids under the age of 4. I need running water. Until the very end of my stay. This is not ok.   Mind you- we arn't talking about a broken hair dryer or a missing TV remote. We're talking about WATER.   I told them that I would have to stay at a different hotel and could they please cancel my reservation. Sure! For a $15 cancellation fee. Soooo... I have to find another a hotel hat has running water, at 10:30 at night, with 3 screaming kids in the car- AND I get to pay the Travelodge $15 for the favor?  VICTOR

Summary Heading: Great hotel! Great value! Walking distance to Disneyland
Summary: Would recommend this hotel to anyone with a Family! Perfect area if you dont like crowded areas like the hotel on Harbour BLVD

This hotel was alright. I probably will not stay here again.   Their site says 1/4 mile away from Disneyland, its not true at all. Maybe to the back side of Disneyland where you cant get in from.   My family had 2 rooms, the first night we were upstairs and the rooms were HOT. My parents room (right next door to my family) had problems with the A/C, it started smoking by the early morning. So at 6am we both had to switch room. We moved downstairs. The A/C downstairs was alot better, but the room wasnt as clean.   There is NO shuttle from this hotel to disneyland, so you have to either walk 15-20 min in the heat and up 2 small hills or wait and pay $3 for each person, each day to ride the city bus. Which was somewhat scary. You can also pay $12 a day to park in the disnyeland

Overall, this hotel was reasonable.  It's very close to Disneyland, was relatively clean and had a comfortable, although bland, pool area.  Also, the glow in the dark stars on the ceiling were really fun.  It sounds tacky, but it's done very well and would be great fun for kids.  The biggest problem with our stay was the noise level from the residential neighborhood next to the hotel.  There was a dog that barked all night.  Even worse, someone has a rooster who was more reliable than an alarm clock, going off at 5:30 each morning.  It was really annoying and we got very little sleep because of this noise.  The hotel is fine, but I would not stay here again because of the noisy neighborhood.

Summary Heading: Close to Disney if you know your way
Summary: This Hotel was directly of the I-5 and behind the Disneyland resort. Check in was OK and the staff was friendly. Our hotel room had 2 Queen beds and looked like any other motel room. It was clean, had plenty of towels, extra pillows, shampoo, soap, microwave, coffeemaker, and fridge. The tv worked fine. In some parts of the room, you could see that they were not dusted, but I just brought Lysol Wipes and wiped everything down. No complaints about the room at all.  The black light and glow in the dark stars on the ceiling were a nice touch. The kids loved them! and it was nice to see if the black light could pick up any stains on the bed (there were none) We didn't have time to go to the pool, but it looked clean. Breakfast consisted of small muffins, 2 kinds of cereal, danishes,

Stayed with 4 teenagers, got the "Sleepy Bear Suite" w/2 queens and a cot that I would normally not use as a dog bed. Bathroom was pitiful, looked like a third-world country in there- room had ominous holes drilled in walls, lights didn't work in several fixtures, didn't even try the TV, left as soon as we could the next morning without even daring to shower.

Needed a place to stay after spending the day at Disneyland.  This place fit the bill ... and with AAA it was cheaper than a 1-day pass to the park.    This is by no means a luxury property, but we found the bathroom to be sparkling clean.    It is indeed walkable to Disneyland, there are sidewalks, you just have to cross to the far side of Disneyland Drive.
