This route does take you away from the Disney Parking Structure shuttle, so you have to walk the whole way -- about a mile walking.  I guess there are other buses you can take, but for two adults who are used to walking, the distance wasn't a problem and we appreciated saving the $12 parking fee.  Upon check-in, we were locked out of the first room we were assigned -- when we got the front desk guy to come up and take a

When i checked in to this hotel, i was told that the rooms that i reserved had a computer for my kids to use. Chritstina,(who introduced herself as the general manager), was the one that told me personally that the rooms have computer that my kids can use. i paid more than the room's worth. I STRONGLY DISCOURAGE EVERYONE TO STAY IN THIS CRAPPY HOTEL.

One of the reasons I selected this hotel on a business trip was I had work to do in my room, needed Internet access, and the hotel advertised wi-fi.   Not only did the wi-fi capability not function, but when I advised the front desk of the problem I was repeatedly told the problem would be fixed and I should "try again in 10 minutes". The problem was never fixed.    At checkout, when I complained of my experience, and the fact I'd had to go to Starbucks and pay for wi-fi access both days of my stay, my complaint was met with complete indifference without a single question asked.  If you want Internet service while in Anaheim I advise you to stay somewhere else!

Read if you dare. This is a novella about my HORRID experience at the Travelodge on Disneyland Drive (1057 W. Ball Rd).  Upon arrival, I checked in at the front desk and was given room keys. As I went to the room and opened the door I found luggage, clothing, and items of another guest. I returned to the front desk and told them that there was someone in my room, and they questioned me and asked me how I knew this. My response to this ludicrous question was that there was stuff in the room. I was then asked, “what kind of stuff?” Was this really a necessary question? I was not happy with the attitude of the front desk agent, who then told me he was going to give me another room and made it sound like he was doing me a big favor.  My second room was considered a “free upgrade”

We stayed at the Travelodge Anaheim at Disneyland Drive, located on Ball Road.  This is the second time we've stayed at this hotel, and we LOVE it!!  The front desk staff is extremely friendly and helpful.  The rooms are clean and quiet, the pool is large, clean and refreshing, while the jacuzzi is perfect for relaxing after a long day at the park.  Walking to the entrance of the park is quite a long way, but only about 2 long blocks from the hotel to the Disney shuttle pick up site at the parking garage.  Shuttle is free to Downtown Disney near the entrance to the 2 parks and runs often.  Parking is expensive at Disney, but plenty of free parking at the hotel so you can leave your car and walk those 2 blocks.  At night the view of the fireworks was phenomenal!!  Go up on the

Summary Heading: Close to Disney but far from restaurants
Summary: We booked into this hotel for being close to Disney and for the price. It was close, and it was cheap, thats true, but the room was  a bit depressive. First the bathrooms bathtub had been removed, and it had tiles instead (diffenrent tiles from the rest of the room).  The shower height was too low, at chest height, so you had to bend to have water in your head. There were no resturants nearby, unless you drive.  We saw the other Travelodges in the area, and they were close to Dennys and IHOP and convenience stores, but not this one.  At first we couldnt find the way to the Disney entrance, because you have to go above a freeway, and because we have bad orientation.  But afterwards we found our way, and we were surprised to see how close it was from the Disney parking lot. I

Summary Heading: Great value - above average roadside motorlodge facility
Summary: We only needed a safe clean place to rest our heads at night after a day at Disneyland and CA Adventure and this place suited our needs very nicely.  We are from San Diego, so we had a car and drove to Disneyland everyday.  Could not have been more convenient.  The entrance to Disneyland's garage is located on Ball Road and it was a straight shot out of the Travelodge parking lot to the entrance to the park.  I would not recommend walking - I did not notice any sidewalks unless you enter from the "exit" side of the parking driveway.  Okay, so on to the pros and cons:  PRO:  Great pillows on the beds, excellent AARP rate for midweek, very close for driving into disneyland, jacuzzi was hot and very therapuetic, laundry and refrigerator were nice amenities to have around, starry

Pros: Great location.  Only 20 minute walk to disney entrance. Free parking; free breakfast; friendly, knowledgeable, and helpful staff!  Cons:  There were ants in our room (#202).  They were crawling all over the bathroom floor and ceiling.  Found some ants crawling on our bed too.  Overall i would stay againg but in a different room.  I don't know if any of the other rooms had ants in them either.

Stayed here for 2 nights and had a fab time.Staff were very helpful and friendly,rooms large and very clean,pool and spa clean and tidy.Would definately stay here again and would recommend this place to anyone.Very pleased with stay.

I dealt with the morning and evening staff and they were all very helpful with anything we needed. The rooms were clean, a good size, nothing fancy, but then again we spent most of our time out of the room. The beds weren't feather beds but after a long day at Disney it didn't take much to get us to sleep. The room had a nice size refrigerator and it came with a microwave. We had a room with a view of the pool. We enjoyed the hot tub and pool during the evenings and morning hours. Continental breakfast was light, but filling. You get a little more than just coffee/juice and donuts. You could walk to disneyland, but after being there nearly 12 hrs. I'm glad we pd the $10 to park at the Disney parking lots. You can also see the fireworks from Disney on Friday's and Saturday's.

We were nicely impressed with this hotel.  We were trying to go to Disneyland on a budget which is not easy.  This room was a very reasonable price and the rooms were quite large.  They were clean and quiet.  The staff was friendly and the breakfast was OK.  The pool was large and clean.  It was the perfect temperature when it had been 85 degrees all day.  The beds were comfortable.  The best part of the room is the stars on the ceiling.  I read this in a review so I looked for them.  Turn on the black light for a while and then turn off all the lights.  It was like sleeping outside under the stars.  Our whole family enjoyed this.  Our only negative thing would be the refrigerator did not work too well.  Also, it says it is only a block from Disneyland but you have to walk

Summary Heading: Great location for Disneyland ... OK hotel
Summary: Advantages of this hotel include its proximity to Disneyland and its rates.   Our first assigned room (#126) was at the back of the hotel, and was very old, and dirty with an unpleasant musty odour. Even though it was supposed to be a non-smoking room, it did not seem like that at all. We requested another room and were given a newer room that was more pleasant. Note that the room was still older and not the cleanest.   Access to the internet was not available due to a problem with the hotel's provider (SBC). However, this problem had existed for over a week and still had not been resolved. There appeared to be no sense of urgency or concern on the staffs' part to resolve this.   All but one of the staff that we encountered during our 2-day stay here lacked customer service.

Very close to disneyland.  We had a great view of the fireworks from the balcony and parking lot.  Pool was clean, and the kids enjoyed it.  Room was sparse but clean.  Desk staff were helpful and friendly.  Cannot beat the value.  It is not the hilton, but you are not paying hilton prices.  Five minutes drive to disneyland.  Location was fine, (not scary going out at night).  Older building, its age is showing, but if your after perfection pay 5x the cost and stay at the disneyland hotel.  Will definately go back to this place next time.

Summary Heading: Great Value, definately not the Four Seasons
Summary: All the reviews were confusing to me. My family had a good time using the pool and watching the fireworks, and it's so close to Disneyland. We can back in the afternoon for naps and went back later in the evening.  It's really just a hotel to sleep at, at a great price. We saved a few Thousand dollars by staying here. I think it's worth it. Nothing wrong with the rooms. Helpful staff. Nice Pool. Good location.

My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel in Feb 04 while on vacation in Disneyland. This was a Best Western hotel when we stayed there.  I work at a Best Western so I at least expected it to be clean.  As soon as we walked in to our room I was on the phone trying to get a different hotel.  Unfortunately, everybody was full.  There were picture hooks hanging on the walls, but no pictures!  There were only 3 channels on the T.V. that were in English.  The breakfast was served in a train car which sounded like a cute idea but the train car smelled like it hadn't been cleaned since the day it stopped operating.  My keys didn't work, and the desk staff told me it was because it was raining outside!!!  And I work at a front desk, so I told them that was ridiculous.  The 3rd night there

From start to finish our stay was great. The front desk person was very friendly. Asking how our drive was, were the kids excited to go to Disneyland. He checked us in very fast and was extremely helpful. Even though the property is older it was clean and looked to be recently renovated. The rooms were spacious and clean. One of the best parts was the black light. You turn it on at night turn the lights off and Presto! You have glow in the dark stars to look at while you drift off to sleep. My boys LOVED it! The Continental Breakfast was standard and in a temporary room while they are building a breakfast room. Housekeeping kept our rooms clean!! Easy in and easy out to the parking structure at Disneyland Resort, another plus when leaving after a long day at the park. Didn't get

Summary Heading: Great deal in an expensive town.
Summary: Hey when the breakfast place down the street wants $8 for a glass of Orange Juice this place is an absolute deal. Free breakfast, close to the park and great view of the fireworks at night, better than inside Disneyland. I'm glad I stayed here and saved money. The rooms with glow in the dark stars are great, I don't know what the complaints are about.

This place is alright for it's purpose to sleep and shower. We were sent to this hotel for one night because the hotel we had booked, had overbooked and didn't have a room for us upon our arrival. So we were upset but the front desk person at the other hotel said what a nice place this would be. Everyhting was fine, except for a very uncomfortable sofa bed, up until the next morning when my bf's mom went to take a shower and the ceiling started leaking throught the light fixture. It was pretty bad and the floor was flooded. You couldn't even use the toilet as that is where the leaking was going We called the front desk and they sent someone but it took him about 20 minutes to actually arrive. We all wanted to shower, but what could we do? He came in and looked  at the place,

I read all the reviews for this hotel before we left & was very nervous that we would be staying in a real dive. However it was quit the oppisite. The room was clean, pool was fine, and staff was very helpful & polite. There is much to do while you visit Anheim I'm not sure why you want to stay in a 5 star hotel as we were only in our room for 6 hours at night to sleep, then shower& then we were off for the day. This hotel is only 3 minutes from the free tram, and then you are at Disney in another 3 minutes, can't beat that. The hotels on the side of the front entrance have to walk or pay for transportation $3.00 aday per person. I would recomend this hotel to anyone. Those of you that complain I don't think you'd be happy at any hotel.

Summary Heading: Dissapointed - Not a good option for family
Summary: We stayed in the Family suite becuase we have four children.  Our room #223 had one window near the hide - a - bed that didn't do much to light the dark stuffy room.  When we did open the window, smoke from somone in the pool area drifted in forcing us to close the window.  After bathing the children, I noticed their feet were black.  I realized how dirty the carpet was.  It wasn't too noticable at first because it was dark carpet in a dark room.  We didn't return for the 'hot breakfast' but danishes were ok.  The staffing in the train cars did need help to empty the trash cans and wipe off the tables.  We did get someone to replace the broken inside door latch so we could keep the 2 year old from opening the door at will and wandering off.  Generally, a dirty old motel.  The

I was pleased with our very large room with 2 queen beds and air conditioning.  The beds were firm, comfortable, and a welcome respite after spending 13 hours at Disneyland on a Saturday.  It was close to the park (within 1-1/2 block's distance to the "Mickey & Friends" parking structure from where we could catch the Disney tram to the front of both Disneyland & Calif Adventure).  The staff at the front desk was helpful and gave us extra coffee filters, cream/sugar, etc. for our room.   The complimentary breakfast was not fancy, but fine with us, and included coffee, eggs, bacon & toast, and pastries.  Also, it was fun that the ceiling would "glow" with stars and the milky way once the lights were turned off at night.  It was convenient to have a filling station next door to the

Back in June 2004, my boyfriend and I stayed here because we wanted a good night's rest before spending an entire day at Disneyland. In terms of location, this hotel is not bad, but that's about the only thing this hotel offers! Our room smelled a little funky (mold perhaps?) and the sheets were not clean at all -- my skin got itchy the next day. The room came with a fridge and microwave, but unfortunately, none of them worked. There's hardly any restaurants near this hotel. The area didn't look too safe. I would not recommend this hotel at all! You're better off going a bit far from Disneyland and get a better deal.

Read all of the reviews and decided to give it a go.  I will tell you that a lot of the reviews I read must have been written by a guest with a "grudge".  The hotel is nothing too fancy but it's only a 2 star so what can you expect.  If you want luxary stay at the Disneyland hotels or at the Hilton.  The place was clean, cheap, and they had a decent size pool.  The breakfast wasn't the best in the world but totally free so that helped us.  The staff told me they were going to be remodeling soon, that is good cuz it does look a little "old".  All in all a good trip and I would stay here again[.

Summary Heading: Roches------Raid please * do not turn on the light
Summary: Roches------Raid please * do not turn on the light **unless you want to see the roches race.   we had a 2night stay, after not being able to sleep on the first night *we check out - never have i been to a hotle that had Roches as the #1 guest , a call will be made to Health Dept.

We stayed at this place for about 30 minutes on July 9, 2004.  We couldn't stay that long because of the stench in the room.  It smelt like there was mold or something musty in the room.  It was like the room was sealed up for 5 years and finally opened up.  The room appeared to be dirty.  The sitting chairs in the room were soiled and the carpet was dirty.  Trust me I am not a picky person but this place was the pits.  My wife and I both got headaches and had to leave.  As my wife was checking out I noticed that a majority of the rooms had their windows open.  That told me that others were experiencing the same thing.  Keep in mind this was on a busy intersection and it was noisy outside.  The staff was nice and tried to offer us another room, no thanks. We ended up staying at

You'll get a close distance to Disneyland in return with the price you pay.  The staff was so2, some wasnt so helpful.  The restaurant for breakfast was an old train which is small and not much light.  The hot breakfast (scramble eggs, bacon, potato) wasnt great but the orange juice was great.  Stay again? mm..60% yes.

Summary Heading: Budget Accomodations with some good points...
Summary: If you just need a place to crash, or enjoy walking around the grounds with open containers, this is the place for you.  But considering how inexpensive many nearby places were-- Sheraton and Hyatt Regency were only $20-25 more--I recommend you look further.  This is really a dive.  I chose this location because of the reviews which said you could see the fireworks from Disneyland--You can quite well from the third floor walkway between 2 buildings, but they only last 10 minutes... When they're over, you're stuck with a dingy hotel room in a poorly kept up complex--beer bottles, food, and diapers really all over the grounds and the parking lot.  No apparent effort at upkeep from owners/managers.  Room was pretty clean and spacious, beds were comforable, and it did have a small

We have been going to Disneyland for over 20 years and have tried many economy hotels some have been rotten and some have been great.  This hotel was a pretty good for it's age and it's price.  The room was clean, it had a fridge and micorwave which was great for the evening.  The service was good. Check in was great.  The pool was cold but great for day time use.  As another reviewer commented the pool was salty but that was because they use a water softener.  The stars on the ceiling was charming.  It was less than 5 min. away from Dland.  The free breakfast was average but better than most donut and coffee places.  The two greatest thrills were: the stars on the ceiling and being able to see the fireworks from Dland without the crowds.  For the price I paid, I'd stay there

I made reservations at this hotel and was very excited because the advertisement said it had stars on the ceiling, it did, my kids enjoyed it very much.  The rate was good, the breakfast was ok, it saved alot of time from going somewhere else and paying more and getting to your destination later than expected, the staff was very nice and helpful, our room was some what clean, buttttttttttt the pool was the worst, on the first day we stayed my kids went into the pool and they said it tasted salty!  Yuk, Yuk!!!!! Then there was a family there with a little boy in the pool with his pamper on!!!!!!! How grouse, and the pamper looked like it was about to explode, and the next day these same people were there again. Then there was a sign that said something to this "Because of

Overall we had a good stay at the Stardust.  We had a coupon book and went to five other hotels in the area and the Stardust is the only one that honored the discounted rate.  We were very pleased with the Fireworks.  We actually left disneyland the second night so we could catch the show from the hotel--as close to fireworks as you can get, kids loved it!!  The breakfast wasn't so great though.  We ended up going out to breakfast on the second morning, but after spending almost $50.00 for four people and waiting 45 minutes at Dennys we ended up back at the Stardust for breakfast on our last morning.  Not great food but free and it held the kids over until lunch.  The rooms were simple but great for the rate.  Basically we could have paid more money and stayed at a fancier hotel

We booked our room through Travelocity and stayed here for three days. The stay was very pleasant. This is the best value for this rate. Comfortable and clean rooms with refrigerator and microwave. The hotel staff were very helpful and the breakfast was good. This is our hotel of choice in Anaheim. If you want luxury then this is not the place. If you want to get the best value for the price, this is it. It seems that People who whine in these reviews want luxury for cheap.

April 18, 2004. I read the postings on this site and kept my reservations. Upon arriving my husband and I had to wait 5 minutes for the desk clerk. Their were ants crawling all over the desk and bugs crawling on the local attraction broucheres. The bed spreads were stained, there was a red/orange stains on the bathroom walls, mirror and fridge. We did spend the night despite the overwhelming insecticide odor. I complained to the manager and Bestwestern. Neither was much help. We ended up staying at the Sheraton Anaheim which was nice. Most of the posts complained about the breakfast which is why I kept my reservation, Big Mistake!

Summary Heading: Good Value, but a lot of people at Sold Out Hotel
Summary: For the most part I thought this was a good value for my family. My only complaint was that it was very crowded, I think the Hotel was sold out, and we had to wait in line to check in and check out and eat breakfast (30 min wait). One day we didn't want to wait in line for breakfast so we went to the IHOP and ended up waiting an hour and spending $70 for breakfast for 4! It wasnt the best breakfast but it was eggs (real, not powdered), sausage, cereal, OJ and donuts. It is a convenient location.The pool was very crowded also. We were able to do our laundry at the hotel at pay washer & Dryers which was convenient.
It was my worst experience of my lifetime. The refrigerator was gross, the room was dirty, the pool was dirty, the food was bad, the help was not very friendly.

What a disappointment. We travel to Disneyland about once a year now, and we have stayed in clean rooms that have also been inexpensive, but this was the first time that we stayed at a hotel that was dirty, and nobody cared enough to do anything about it.  We checked into the room, and by the time, I got the bags into the room, my wife said that the room was dirty, and she was correct. There was white dried, hopefully it was dried icecream on the table and the floor. The fridge had some red liquid that was floating in the bottom of it. I think it may have been meat drippings from some raw meat, but whatever it was I was disgusting. The mirror had makeup on it. It was purely disgusting. We contacted the front desk, and they said that they would promptly send someone up to clean

I read this review board while looking for a place to stay near Disneyland and the reviews were more good than bad so i decided to give it a try. BIG MISTAKE! Our first room was dark and dingy and the sink was clogged. We waited a couple of hours for someone to fix it, then called the office to see what the holdup was and they decided just to move us to another room, so we repacked and moved into a room that was missing the sofabed, so we went back to the 1st room and called the office again, the phone in the 2nd room did not work, and we were brought up a key to a THIRD room. This was was just as dark and dingy as the 1st one but everything worked and the stars on the ceiling were cool. I loved the traincars where they served the breakfast, they were old and neat and the

Summary Heading: Never ever will stay here again
Summary: I do not know why this is called a hotel because this is a motel in true sense. We got a room at the very back and the corridors were dusty and smelly. The room was neat though and so is the bathroom. But the big disappointment was the breakfast. It said full breakfast and what you get in the addition of continental one (without any fresh fruit) is cold scrambled egg and two piece fried potato. I am not kidding it was just two piece and you get to eat in a old train car which needs lot of renovation to give a flavor of healthy looking eating place at least.  Will never stay here again. I wish I checked outt he reviews here before I booked.

I have just returned from my stay at this hotel, and I must say that I was very much so disappointed. I have come to expect better from a Best Western than this.As this way my son s first trip to Disneyland I chose this hotel for the proximity to the park and the stars on the ceiling, but the rooms themselves were a disgrace.Both the chairs in our room were so filthy, that I refused to sit on them. The table leg was broken, as I found out when I had to move the table because it was blocking the vents for the A/C unit, which barely even gave off warm air. The bedspreads were both stained and dirty and when I requested housekeeping service on Saturday, nothing was replenished or cleaned (towels, soap, washcloths, etc). The only thing that was done was the bed was made, but the

I've stayed in the Stardust twice and found it very pleasing both times. It doesn't have video like the Stovall's Best Western, but we got around that. The Sauna is very warm and the pool nice. It's not gigantic pool, but adequate for the size of the inn. I liked the freebie breakfast in the adjacent railroad cars. Don't expect a menu and a waiter, remember this is complimentary. Found the restaurant and inn staff very friendly. Good a/c. When you turn off the lights and switch on the U/V light for a spell, then turn off the lights, a cut-out moon glows and your whole ceiling glows like the milky-way. A most romantic way to cap off your evening.

This hotel looked pretty good over the internet.  However, in reality it's just a small motel bordered by a 3 lane off-ramp and a 7 lane road.  The windows are very cheap so the noise level is high.  The pool is small, plain, and in the middle of the parking lot.  The breakfast is served in two dimly-light, dingy, depressing old trolley cars.  It's quite a hike to Disney.  There are no restaurants nearby.  We stayed one night of our 5-night planned stay and moved to Howard Johnson's on Harbor Blvd. at a substantial daily savings on the room rate.

After reading several reviews we booked at the Stardust for our Disneyland vacation. I must say it was the one low point in our trip. The rooms are old and run down though fairly clean. Lots of patched walls and older looking fixtures, not to mention we did not feel very safe. The breakfast that everyone raves about-we could barely eat-very greasy and processed no fresh fruit. The last two days we skipped it and went to I Hop. The staff was nice enough and we did have the pool to ourselves which was relaxing. In the future I would rather pay a little more and stay at a little nicer place-with or without breakfast. Jenny
This was a good hotel, but what we really liked was seeing the nightly fireworks from here!  No jockying for position, and a better view!

The room was nice, with a fridge and microwave.  The service was excellent, but the really great part of the hotel was its proximity to the Disneyland firweorks.  We were suprised that the firworks show was better from our room than from inside Disneyland!!!!!!  We were so close it seemed like the fireworks were coming right at us.

You can see the fireworks better from our room than from inside of Disneyland!  I was very satisfied with the price, because it included free eggs toast, bacon, donuts and cereal.  The staff was very helpful and helped us save money by pointing out good restaraunts and the grocery store.  The pool was heated and very warm.  The only negative was that the hotel was almost completely full and there were a lot of people at the pool even though it was very big.
free bacon and eggs in the morning, pool in the afternoon  and cool stars on the ceiling at night.  a bargain.

This hotel is by far the best value near Disneyland.  It is accross the street from Disneyland, Downtown Disneyland and California Adventures, it is the second hotel when you exit I5 on to Disneyland drive!  Service was good and my room included a free hot breakfast of eggs bacon and toast for my whole family.  My wife and I especially liked seeing the fireworks from our balcony at night.  While our kids giggled with excitement when we turned off the lights and blacklit glowing stars appeared on our ceiling. I would definately stay at this hotel again.
